RW3tibedO6Wbk6dP93Wqzw.text: As far as tapas goes this is a good place for those who enjoy small food. The quality of the food we had was fine. Our group ordered a bit of everything so we were able to sample a variety of the dishes. Again, the food tasted fine but the only thing I did not understand was why all the vegetables we ordered came out last, at least 45 minutes after we ordered. This was on a Friday night and it wasn't that busy. Anyways, be ready to eat elsewhere after leaving this place.

7AzPwfrkk7SwoiL-jstuOQ.text: Meh...not the best because I wasn't that hungry so I ordered mussels and potato salad. Mediocre.

gZPEa4JX_BrX1kDh1RTd0A.text: I stumbled upon this place by checking yelp. This restaurant definitely deserves five stars. The food was very good and tasted great as well.  A bonus is that the raw fish here also tastes fresh, which is sometimes rare for seafood restaurants. The service is decent here too. The ambiance is calming and gives a good representation of a Japanese restaurant.  The prices here are also fair compared with other sushi restaurants in Las Vegas. I recommend here for every one who craves sushi when they come to Vegas.

F0T9k9xg2AZGf5gUP8TWWA.text: Fantastic izakaya. Everything we got was amazing. Favorite things being the chicken meatballs and the miso salmon bowl. The Hakushika sake was the perfect accompaniment to all my dishes. Can't wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BngUAsS-Uw9SeylCGc-KtA.text: WAY overrated.  I guess when a restaurant puts out a "Review us on Yelp" sign, you can expect the reviews to be skewed in the positive direction.  I think the mistake I made was forgetting that the word "Sushi" is not in this restaurant's name but the first category it is listed under on Yelp IS "Sushi Bars"  I had both Sushi and Izakaya.  First off, first place I've been in all my travels and hundreds of sushi bars that they actually don't have a Nigiri menu (only roll menu).  This should have been the first red flag.  Second red flag is they had a bar area like a sushi bar but no one was standing behind it making sushi.   The sushi was LAME.  Edible, but the pieces of fish were small, quality of fish was average, rice was mediocre and construction and presentation also mediocre.  The Izakaya was good but I've not eaten many places so I'm no expert.  Had mushrooms, pork belly and tuna belly.  Pork belly was so so, the other two were good.    Service was uneven.  I guess if you live in the area and like Izakaya, this is not a bad choice, but overall this place is unremarkable and the Sushi was very lackluster.  4 stars for Izakaya, 2 stars for sushi = 3 star average.

67VzA40m00kPIAMOV9V4rw.text: A nice change of pace off the Vegas strip.  Comfort food and a laid back atmosphere but great service.

photos.caption: Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6SVbYUyej6iACB5fKsXogA.text: So glad we tried the food here. Our favorite was the whole fish sashimi, after you eat the sashimi they deep fried the rest, to die for!!! The soft shell shrimps and soft shell crabs were delicious. The blue crab salad was also tasty. I don't recommend the chicken items we had the chicken karaage and chicken yakatori they were both over cooked and dry.

0vq1174btxJ0f8MFVi6RPg.text: Following the decline of one of my favorite restaurants in town, I thought I would never smile again.  Izakaya Go has me smiling once more.  Every restaurant scene in any respectable city has to have a good selection of tapas joints (among other things of course). I am especially fond of the "small plate" joints as I tend to be a light eater, yet I love trying many items at once. Japanese tapas has always been on the top of my restaurant list because, well let's admit it, the Japanese just do food better than anyone.  We stopped in late night for a small snack before heading home. Of course as always, I ended up eating way more than I should have.   While I thoroughly enjoyed my Udon, the highlight of the evening was certainly the Ramen Burger. Using pork belly instead of ground beef was a simple stroke of genius, and the sauce was absolutely amazing. This just might be might favorite dish in all of Vegas.  Service was great (I think the owner was our server), but the place was a little slow. Which was too bad, I think more people need to hear about this place, I think it has a good chance of taking the place of that old favorite down the street that recently fell off its perch.  I definately recommend giving Izakaya Go a go.

z6tpzLLmiP1cI7UyQUp0Vg.text: I really was impressed with the service and food. But more important the close that it looks to a traditional izakaya. Prices were reasonable and quality of food were really good. We ordered 2 small bottle of sake, that were smooth. The service these guys give is very good even I heard a happy birthday with lights out.

g6U4gtC0x-ylJNlFo5DQZQ.text: This was a toss up between 3.5 and 4 stars. When we first got there, they didn't look all that busy, but they only had space at the bar. Because it was just two of us, that was fine. It took them a while to greet us, even though several people walked right by us, but that was fine.  We ordered a few types of yakitori, a chawanmushi, beef ponzu, and shrimp yaki udon. I will say that everything was good on flavor, 4.5 to 5 stars for taste. My only gripe was the yakitori with plum, which was clearly bottled plum paste that I use at home and on the hiyayako (tofu) they definitely used ginger paste instead of fresh grated ginger.   The reason why I was torn between 3.5 and 4 stars is because of the service. It was slow and the order the food came out in was so random. We got one of the yakitori then our main dishes then another yakitori. About 3/4 through the meal, we got our final yakitori. After we finished our meals, I inquired about the chawanmushi. It finally came out, 45 minutes after ordering, and wayyy after we had finished our meals. It was definitely delicious, but it was kind of sad to eat it at the end of the meal. We asked if we could get the free ice cream for checking in on Yelp. The waitress asked if we wanted green tea or vanilla. I ordered vanilla since my bf doesn't like green tea, but they brought us green tea anyway. I love green tea ice cream, so it was fine, but I felt bad for the bf. At least twice, two different people brought us things we didn't order and we had to tell them that wasn't ours.   Overall, it was a good meal at a reasonable price, but I think there are better izakaya type restaurants in the valley. When we left they were super busy and had a huge line.

photos.caption: Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef ponzu meal

BiTbJRydAQuUgat22eHI2g.text: Yayyyy!!! Had dinner here tonight.  Having Japan withdrawals I've been on this Japanese kick. I ordered the sashimi bowl, mom my ordered the katsu dinner and we both had a side order of shrimp tempura. We got seated in a booth right away... Order was taken promptly... Everything seem like it was going great until my moms order came out and mines seemed to have a major lag... Not to sure why when I had a sashimi bowl which is faster to make then a combination plate. My mom was almost done with her dinner... Still no sashimi bowl. The owner seen I looked distressed and came to our table. I told him that I was upset about my food not coming out.... He apologized... And about 10 mins later my bowl and our tempura came out. Food was great. Only thing that upset me was the timing of my food coming out late. The owner Go was nice to send over takoyaki... Which I thought was very sweet of him. He came over to check on us and we ended up talking up about all things Japan. The takoyaki here taste just like takoyaki in Osaka. I will be back! Arigato Go! It was nice to meet you! I'll be back. I'm a fan! -miss yelp 2015 (Mariko) P.S. Check in on FB to get free ice cream! Oishii!!

photos.caption: Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Arigato GO

9YbDJ1AcDyt_0dQavwU_kw.text: Delicious food! So many options it can be over whelming. Have tried several different items on the 4 different menus and never been dissapointed. Service is always great no matter how busy they are. Great selection of alcohol. You could go to this place every day for months straight and not get the same items. The dinner plate deals are amazing deals very cheap for a ton of food.

9usfZF3tmK6tzilsVV6Ewg.text: Great atmosphere, feels like you're in Tokyo, creative menu not seen anywhere else! Ahi Poke Salad was the most delicious salad I've ever had and I'll go back again next time I'm in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy Ahi Poke Salad

eXZ8UsGu209S30waQExjqg.text: I have been here few times, and never understood what the hype was all about until this time. Yes, there were still some server who were not as friendly as other japanese restaurants, but it did not bother our dinner at all.  We had a little wait, but were seated as soon as a table was ready. The server came, and I really wanted to try their catch of the day sashimi, yet they only had one kind and aji-mackerel left. Not so sure if they are kept alive, but it didn't seem like it since they did not have a fish tank on display to show the activeness of fish. Another kind, the server explained it to be a tougher texture so we ended up ordering a regular 5 kinds sashimi. The halibut was really fresh, and so were the rest. The tuna could have better color but when I tasted, it was still very tasty and soft. We also got blue fin tuna carpaccio with cruncy garlic, yummy!!! It was really red and almost melted in my mouth. Tako wasabi was a generous portion. Shitake mushroom and tiger shrimp skewers were worth every penny, but Kyara definitely has better ton-toro skewers. We added the truffle butter corn, shio ramen and spicy salmon cut roll at the end. The truffle butter corn definitely should not include truffle in its name, since I couldnt find a bit sign of truffle in the dish, yet it was REALLY GOOD-YOU SHOULD GET THIS IF YOU LIKE CORN AND BUTTER.  Shio ramen was a half portion but was more than enough. Spicy salmon was a bit too spicy for me but t was bearable.   I would go back again and try their catch of the day. Good quality food, definitely a good joint to hang on the weekends.

photos.caption: Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corn-shitake mushroom-tiger shrimp Corn was bomb
Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bluefin tuna carpaccio. Must try!
Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork cheek.

dBxz-Qf3koAbqbSL7Rptxw.text: First visit today and definitely not the last! Extensive menu with great variety of options. The menu is a bit overwhelming but the servers were very helpful. Lychee Chu-hai cocktail was absolutely delicious with a refreshing summer floral taste. We ordered the tonkatsu ramen, miso salmon and tuna belly appetizer all of which were delicious! Overall, good service, great food and yummy cocktails! Cannot wait to return and taste the other delicious menu items!

photos.caption: Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried chicken hearts 3/5
Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tonkatsu Ramen...4/5
Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna belly...very tasty!

6cp4OU6m0dsrX1pI5NSZ4g.text: This place is fairly new and opened in December. I've been wanting to try this place out for a while and my mom and I decided to go today, and we were so happy we did!  Decor: Small, quaint Japanese restaurant near Kuma Snow Cream and Starbucks. The place was nicely decorated and had a decent amount of seating. They even had a seating area in the middle where you could take off your shoes and sit on the floor to eat (with cushions of course).  Service: We were seated almost immediately after entering the door. Our server was very nice and always checked up on us, refilling our drinks, asking if the food was okay, giving us extra napkins, etc. I think he was the owner, too. I never had a problem with anything.  Food: My mom got the Grilled Saba dinner plate and she said that it was very delicious ($10.95). Overall, the food was excellent and so worth your money. I ordered the ramen burger ($8.75) and it was heaven on earth. The pork was cooked to perfection and melted in my mouth, the grilled egg was a nice touch of flavor, and the grilled onions were perfect. Although a bit messy to eat (I had to use a fork and knife because my mouth was too small for me to just bite it), it was all worth it. Everything was perfect and I'm still salivating over it as I'm writing this review.  I'm so happy I finally got to try this place out. I can't wait until I get to return! I'm dying to try their sashimi!

cpO6IYVvRiMl4a4zMeOgYw.text: We caught the late happy hour that starts at 10:00PM. Amazing selection of small plates, open late for after show dining and low key, friendly ambiance. Parking is easy, the happy hour prices were extremely reasonable and the service was excellent. I could eat here every day. My previous go-to Tapas restaurant was just so-so last time I was there. May have been an off night so I will give them another chance, but this place has just taken the number one spot in my book!

25bYgTeHsu3op4ZoOoxyxw.text: Called in and was able to make a reservation on our way the restaurant. When we arrived, the place was busy but our table for 7 was set and ready!  Service was great and everything we ordered was delicious! The raw fish was very fresh and just melts in your mouth!  Oh and I believe they have late happy hour-I'm going to have to come back one of these days!

YVS1zf2-IvysZQTINptGYQ.text: Typical Japanese tapas fare. Our servers seemed annoyed at us when we asked for water or napkins and it was a Saturday night, so naturally, it was busy. We ordered yakitori, ramen, sashimi, a soda and 2 pitchers of beer. It was $186 for four people without a tip. A little pricey for the food since it wasn't huge portions or anything, but again, I've been to places like this and there isn't anything to write home about, especially from this particular place. I would say I would go here again if I had to.

rBHl4GnlE3t2MJMR_VLStg.text: A cozy little place in Chinatown. Great food, service and happy hour.  Usually no wait after 10pm.  The staff is quick and attentive. The owner always greets us and checks for satisfaction.  The strak bento box and fresh fish are my fav. The truffle edamame is a must.

photos.caption: Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Such great quality and good prices.

vpKu1TzQwHT1fIXRmUrDyw.text: This place is one of my favorites! I feel like it's one of Vegas' best kept secrets but everyone should know how amazing it is! Staff is friendly and attentive! Food is amazing. Since its tapas you can try a bunch of different things. I love trying new dishes. Some favorites are enoki butter, pumpkin croquettes, fried squid legs, onigiri. There's too many to list. This is definitely a regular spot for me and my friends!

h3tP-8fCL0jTILQNphVfDA.text: The Spicy Miso Ramen was top notch.  I drank all the broth right to bottom of the bowl -  it was that good.  I like a Japanese restaurant that's not all sushi and tempura.  The Poke bowl needed some onions and different seaweed, but the shredded daikon and shiso was really appreciated.  The Salmon and Ikura bowl was awesome.  Since this was my first visit it will take me a while to narrow down my favorites.  The menu was so extensive that it was really hard to choose.  Service was really friendly.  The food came out really quick.   I tried to go there for lunch last month, but found they were only open for dinner.   I'll go back again for sure, but I'm usually in that area around lunch time rather than dinner.

jc1H5xpsU-Fxg_Olv8QWgQ.text: Excellent! After recently traveling to Japan, we have been seeking out new Japanese restaurants in town. This place is great. The owner knows his fish and personally did a wonderful job guiding us through the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flying Fish
Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red Grunt

Aes1mLIeLlYQLixozyq0WQ.text: Izakaya Go is exactly what I was looking for to escape the strip scene. Go and his staff are super friendly and they make an out of towner like me feel at home. The menu is amazing and the sushi (not always something you find at an izakaya ) was great. Loved the sake selection too. Met some other sake lovers at the bar and we ended up partying all night. I will be back here every time I am in town!

u_uGjq3V3Of2YY7gt8bmDg.text: This is not a sushi restaurant. Forget rolls, tempura and pickled ginger. Order the worst sounding things, get out of your comfort zone, and you won't be disappointed. Fantastic food, fantastic staff, and fantastic atmosphere. They have great drinks too.

X1l3pV984QN39c-EbDRd7w.text: The best place for happy hour hands down. Everything is made to order so be patient, you won't regret it

_uz7OSzEtKFqfZAS_XrqEw.text: Love this place!! Love all the flavors and the same options. Although I could have sworn I ate the tiniest baby octopus sauteed  with salt and pepper! I've yet to find them here again...I never thought I'd eat let alone love octopus!

mEazpAkVFErRW8qHdKHSlw.text: Excellent service, great food, great prices!! It was my first time in Vegas and from all the places I ate this was so good that I had to go twice durin my vacation!!! Highly recommended!!!

pDXX9AOIal64zUPbEOO9GA.text: I read the reviews about how great this place is so I wanted to go check it out. But due to not having enough time to dine in I opted for take out. Employees were very nice and polite which is why I gave a two star rating instead of one.   The main reason why I wanted to give this place a one star was because the main dish I ordered was not worth its price. I had gotten an order of takoyaki (which was very delicious) and an order of the chicken karage dinner plate. For me it was not necessarily bad but it was not as good as I thought it would be. As for the quantity, I had only gotten 4 pieces of the chicken karage. I was disappointed that I had paid $12 (not including tax) for this. Even though it comes with a side salad, one scoop of potato salad, a small tofu side dish, rice and miso soup; it was not worth the price for me. I feel that if it came with 8-10 pieces of the chicken karage then I would be ok with this. For me the three items that hit it for me were the miso soup, the rice, and the takoyaki which is sad to say. (I have a picture that I took of the dinner plate but for some reason I cannot upload since I am using the app on my phone. Will update soon)  Probably will not be going back there.

-V6XUV_9EcXv75OspS4f9A.text: Excellent all around! Staff offered suggestions and were highly attentive. We tried a bit of everything and loved it all-poke California roll, bluefin roll, ramen, chicken gizzards, fatty chicken hearts, pork belly (a fave), plum wine...and price was outstandingly  for value.

gyGzfEFtn97Qv3s1Q9LPoA.text: Big fan of this place.  So many options and so far everything I've tried, I've enjoyed.  Service is a bit slow but worth it.  Some of my favorites are the shiitake skewers, tempura udon, spicy tuna cracker, squid tempura... We were a little bummed out the last time we went because they didn't have any uni which I was very eager to order because my parents love uni.  Hoping they will have uni the next time we go back.

atv0QYlP4DjZRZAww0WS7A.text: This place is decorated with Japanese decor but they're bumpin island music. The poke bowl had spicy raw fish that melts in your mouth. I just left and I'm thinking about going back for a poke bowl dessert. It had the power to drown my gambling loss sorrows. In the words of my friend, MD, "it's slap your mamma good." Wasabi skewers were the best in my book. We're contemplating going for happy hour later tonight.

Y-FkgrRyarsHv7FzY0jHuA.text: Some friends brought me here for the happy hour. We ordered a few things off the happy hour menu and they were just okay. Spicy tuna, poke, and California rolls do not excite me. The pumpkin croquette was very tasty though! I saw Tony T.'s review and knew I needed to order the teriyaki chicken set as well. The chicken was nicely grilled and glazed with a teriyaki sauce. The bowl of rice was perfect, and the different sides (miso soup, salad, cold tofu) were very tasty. Be prepared to wait if you come during dinner or happy hour--this restaurant space is tiny.

I50xUnIOf-PWvBSVAfL0Vw.text: This is a great place to get quality Japanese food in Las Vegas in a relaxed environment, with excellent service. The menu can be a bit overwhelming with so many choices, but we had about 8 different plates and all were excellent, and the prices were definitely reasonable. I agree with other reviewers, the crips pork belly is an unexpected winner!

7pbUYcpli8dZVPL-r7gR_g.text: omg. every single food was tooooooooooo salty n not fresh.  we ordered many dishes n we dont like any of them.   poke was too fishely n we returned it. dynamite was too salty n we also returend it. we ordered some sashimi and it was not fresh as well.   only good thing was service. one korean girl served our table most of time. she was super nice and good.   i wish they upgrade their food. Food in Ichiza is much better for me.

Nm-fxaavw5qJqiYMdohvwA.text: Best Japanese curry I've ever had!   The vibe is very chill and inviting. Tonight there was reggae music which made the experience so much better. It reminded me of eating or hanging out at local bars along the beach in Hawaii and Guam.   It's a small venue with a window view into the kitchen. So if you want to see your food being made, sit at the bar. Although, it through me off that the guy cooking and plating the food didn't wear gloves but rather wipe off on a side towel everytime he touched food.   Service is great! The owner Go speaks English and Japanese, so I found it a bit entertaining to hear someone at the bar showoff their Japanese skills by speaking the language . Although Go means 5 in Japanese, it can mean other things too. Here I am thinking it's the 5th restaurant of its kind...like Thai Noodle house 1 2 3 4 and 5...  The food was amazing and will be back to try more. They also carry Junmai Sake which is one of the best Sake out there.   Tucked away behind Krung Siam, it's a bit difficult to find, so just find Krung Siam and it's on the back lot of the restaurant.

gghtraJM0ly6z6Ilt3bH3A.text: Good decent sushi at a good value.... there spicy tuna actually taste pretty good. Though they don't have a wide selection on the types of sushi, it'll be a go to spot for me when I return.

DGwZEe92gGAjBiBDI8WKJQ.text: Why go here? Their ramen is sour and their chicken wings are burnt plus their food is overall bad. Plus the staff didn't care about any of it. Not mad.... just disappointed. Think they bought their ratings....

Opd5URxtXwoQZq6MK-gkgQ.text: I thought that this place was alright, and thought that they had a very extensive Japanese menu and has quite low prices (especially for the combinations). However, the fish quality was pretty low and I was not especially impressed with the food. I would not return, but if you're looking for a cheap eat, I would suggest this place!

fbIb2i7cq8iScJVwnGe2aQ.text: Ten Zaru soba w tempura is the nuts. Not heavy clean and filling. Great seafood from hokiado. Yakitori is very good too. Highly recommend.

UodMNMN4bTrhAwY0oTDZfA.text: Slow service. The workers here move at a snail rate. When we first arrived, there were maybe two tables seated and rest were empty. Instead of seating us right away, a worker was just strutting around drinking her coke while the other two workers hung around by the bar. After we were finally seated and put in our order, they brought out one of the main dish and rest of ours did not arrive until 30 minutes later. Not to mention that the appetizers came out at the end. Pretty disappointed with the service and the professionalism of the business. Giving it a 3 stars because the food was pretty good.

Kk0c5DdxvrwxzqYyPbLCSg.text: This is probably one of my favorite restaurants in Las Vegas! I was surprised because it is always so busy!!!! Such great prices and awesome menu items. All of the staff here are so nice and very attentive. We ordered the poke sushi burrito which was sooooo amazing, the ramen which had amazing chashu, egg, and seaweed! I didn't really like the noodles but everything about the ramen was perfect.   The skewers are definitely a must get. We got the chicken liver which was cooked to perfection, asparagus with bacon, tuna belly, and corn. Everything tasted amazing and our food was awesome!! We were surprised at the end of our bill because everything was priced so perfectly.  I will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ramen!

OciWc9I7cG74NHTD7GB9Fw.text: Overall great experience here. A bit of a wait to be seated but the staff handled that with ease. Quite a lot of small dishes on the menu, but everything was tasty. Well varied happy hour menu with perfectly cooked dishes. Agedashi tofu and tuna belly skewers stood out in particular. Good choice of tasty Japanese whiskeys as well as fruity drink options for the more sweet inclined. As a lover of all things sweet, I would recommend the lychee soju in particular. Would gladly come again.

1pVqHVuNOnBf-ptB0_-Ttg.text: I was searching for a new restaurant and found this! I can't be more than happier. Now I have a new go to Japanese place. This is a great Japanese restaurant.  First we walked in and saw only Japanese people in the restaurant. We are the only non Japanese in the place. After seeing that we initially thought this must be a great Japanese restaurant. We sat down and saw grilled squid on the table right next to us and they said it is really good especially when it's a bit burned. Lo and behold we ordered that and mentioned to be a bit burned. Came out and it's so delicious! We got the Omakase as well and its also delicious. However we ordered the uni pasta and we were surprised as it was not the same as the one we saw in the pictures. The pasta is so creamy and yes delicious so if you are on a diet this dish is not the choice. We just want to try it and taste what an uni pasta taste like.... it's  delicious. Try it.   We also got a free ice cream just by checking in Yelp! That's very nice nice! We ordered 2 bottles of sake! It was just the right sake taste we were looking for, not so fruity and sweet and yet not so dry as well. Just perfect! I will definitely come back again in this place! It is now one my favorite Japanese restaurant here!

photos.caption: Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Free vanilla and green tea ice cream!
Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Uni pasta
Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. They make their own soy sauce!

NbAfVFfA3VcyKWe2rEdngg.text: We were excited for sushi and called ahead to make sure we could get in. They told us to come on down.   We walked in and then were told it was a 20-35 min wait. We visibly saw 3 tables open and we were told they were reserved for parties 35-40 minutes from the time we were asking.   Front of house staff didn't handle it well. We even took a lyft to give it a try. Hopefully the food is better than the service.

7AREECARQoAFwUlxSUTVWQ.text: Loved everything about it. Food, atmosphere, service  Great Happy Hour menu. Definitely will return for late night eats.

QEBH4wV9IoR35epsV7RrBA.text: This place is open late and thank goodness because it is bomb! I love the fact you can buy skewers individually that range anywhere from $1.95-$5. Also, their food is just the best quality I have had and was worth every penny. There is nothing to complain about for this visit and I would suggest it as a spot you should try!

photos.caption: Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half Ramen- Tonkotsu

glzpVryajQb1JhmnEVRIKw.text: Looooove all the Japanese authentic food! As a Japanese native, I am so happy that I have a place to go to anytime I crave for real Japanese food! Thank you!!!

89O9UxiD-ZlGx2auZpdRGA.text: I waited 45 mins and ended up leaving. What a waste of time! I asked why the other group got the table before us, the server said he called my name a few times. Ummm no!!!! we've been waiting outside in the cold and he never called for my name. I guess you have to wait inside, packed with other people in order to hear your name. They dont care for people waiting outside! Not a good place if you're claustrophobic. Too bad, I will never ever go here and waste my time! I should call fire marshall next time because everyone is blocking the entryway.

3OnViMecE4jPK5x_ywxcGw.text: Food is alright during happy hour but it took over half an hour just to get two rolls to go when I called ahead of time

8IFhIpuzuzk1kaVZjkG_ow.text: Very quality sashimi. I have the 5 kind Sashimi for $19.95. 3 pieces of each kind include halibut, salmon, tuna,hamachi and albacore. The fish is very fresh. The waitress suggest to try with the Yuzu Kosho on the Sashimi and is way much better than the wasabi. It has lemon and spicy flavor, goes well with Sashimi. Strongly recommend to check it out if you have not done so. The happy hour starts at 10am to close.

photos.caption: Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 5 Kind Sashimi Platter

kXPL8YSAj5FgwfzK0MDAhw.text: This place has a lot of varieties!   We ordered the following:  spicy chicken wing yakitori~it  was pretty good, medium spicy.   Uni wrapped with white fish sashimi~it was good but the uni taste was stronger than the white fish. So its better to just eat the uni on its own.   Uni sashimi~$23 for just about 5 large pieces. it was very fresh and sweet.   miso eggplant~ it was ok. Flavor got a little strong towards as I ate more and more.   blue fin toro cut roll~very yum! recommend this dish!!   i forgot what else lolll   I would come back when I visit vegas again!!!

btg_rDzE7kUuO8hNsgWQnw.text: Got seated right away. I suppose the happy hour is going on. They don't tell you about the happy hour.  The food is okay. Make sure you go there on Thursday for fresh whole fish sashimi style. I don't believe the restaurant runs out of free ice cream after I checked in yelp. Disappointed with the high ratings.

5_ZCxGimN98jElpYcu8AWQ.text: The food here is so Amazing!!! Everything is good, the service is awesome, and most of all the prices is so reasonable! We are in Vegas only 3 nights and spent 2 nights here already. Kudos to the chef and the staff

m3TZjd5nUV8ZXo-KAlZj4g.text: Very good food and service.  I was impressed with the whisky selection and the opportunity to try a Hibiki whisky I had not had before.  Tonkatsu Raman was very good...not the best ever...but very good all the same.  Sushi was fresh and flavor was good.  Uni could have been a little better.  That said, if I lived near this place, I would be a regular customer!!  4 stars just because I think there is room for improvement...but then I am a bit of a self admitting Japanese food snob!!

BH2vmZoVcvYvhG_k4SeZhQ.text: By now I would call myself a regular at Izakaya Go! So let me tell you a little bit about one of Vegas's best Japanese Restaurants.  First off the staff at this location are incredible and provide excellent customer service.   Now on to what you really came to read about and that's the food. Izakaya Go is REAL Japanese food not AYCE sushi ran by non-Japanese workers. I recommend going during Happy Hour (10-close) not only are drink prices great but you can try a wide assortment of their normal menu items for a fraction of the cost.    Thank you Izakya Go for all that you do in food and in service !

photos.caption: Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

madC_bgWhEMGE5lStWgGUA.text: After a colllld long day, I knew I needed some ramen to fill my stomach, and this was one of the very few ramen places still open at 1 am ( which by the way, happy hour is from 10pm- close!!)  We got seated at the big table. We shared it with 3 other ppl, but my bf and I were on the other end so it wasn't too awkward.  So for the both of us, we ordered: 1 lamb chop 1 tiger shrimp 4 pork bellies 4 beef tongues Takoyaki Pork gyoza Ramen burger and fries  Half miso ramen with spicy on the side  LOL. I let my eyes order bc I was clearly full before finishing all this food.  The skewers were all wonderful! Priced between 2.50-4.95. For some reason, my first round of pork belly tasted better than my second, but it was still fatty & delicious! The beef tongue was my favorite, but it's always my favorite to order. I could've skipped the shrimp, and the lamb chop was very tender and juicy!  The takoyaki was amazing :) it came with their takoyaki sauce and I'm going to guess mayonnaise? But altogether probably one of the best I've had!  Their gyoza was good too! I've been on a gyoza kick lately so it really fulfilled my appetite. It came with 6, and if I wasn't with my bf, I would've eaten all 6 of them to myself.   The ramen burger is prolly a 3/5. It's messy, too soggy, not as flavored as I'd like. If I were to come back, I probably wouldn't get it again. The fries were good tho!  And the ramen itself was good. I had the spicy on the side, but I ended up adding it in after. It was good! Loved the actual noodles themselves. It came with the same toppings as with a regular ramen, just a smaller portion obviously. So I still had egg, pork, seaweed and bamboo which I highly appreciated for it only being 5 dollars.   All of that food for only 60 bucks!!  All in all, I'd be back bc I love Japanese tapas and their happy hour :) just skip the ramen burger.

photos.caption: Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

O_YQiWiJ7qhZ5SrAPcnaQw.text: Finally tried this restaurant! ( went there few times but always packed) Absolute love it!!! Whatever I tried, they all great!!!!  Tried few of this kind Japanese bar food restaurants but never really impressed by them. (Expensive and taste just ok!) But somewhere somehow, everything we ordered, we all love it!!!!! Three of us ( big guys) we spent around $160. Not really a cheap dinner or late night supper! But I will definitely go back there!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KqVX93bdKTZxYpxLvBW7jw.text: While there is usually a wait in the evenings, and definitely on the weekends, this place is totally worth it! I love how diverse the menu is and all the food I've ever ordered was really delicious. I love taking people here who have only ever had sushi for Japanese food as it's a little glimpse into other options for food in small plates, so less commitment. The atmosphere inside is very lively, and feels like you're almost not in Vegas. Parking can be a pain, but usually able to find a spot.

hpOw8cOsxLKkEbIqQkbjhw.text: This is one of my favorite places to hang with my friends. The happy hour is so cheap & delicious. Def a most go!

95poy9_KN95zw4ZJAG1aSQ.text: We had our first dinner there last Friday night.  Saw it on Yelp and went there directly from the airport, bags and all.  After a quick wait we were seated at a nice table and served by Ja-o, the sweetest server ever.   She knew the entire menu very well and steered us to some tasty dishes.  We had Buta kakuni (braised pork), hamachi kama (grilled yellow-tail collar), uni, ika, some yakitori, and a couple of other dishes that were all very authentic and truly outstanding.  I love Japanese food, been to the country many times, and will gladly go back to IzakayaGo the next time I'm in Vegas.  LOVE this place, the food, the servers, the vibe!!

B4O7H5PgEjoNRYFkz_DJtw.text: Recommended:  Uni wanzen Grilled black cod Pork face  No need to wait for a seat, it is a new spot!

photos.caption: Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4ZMHVzhjweQ7VWf22QuYlA.text: A little about me because this is important to the review (everyone is biased through their background, right?):  I'm a southern Californian who is a self-proclaimed foodie. I refuse to eat bad food.  I'd rather starve.  This is the place I'd go back to EVERY TIME I go to Vegas, FOR SURE.    We went to this place around 3 AM.  It's really odd, but I honestly thought a lot more places would be open on a Saturday morning at 3 AM in Vegas, but I was wrong.  This place closed it down at 4 AM so we barely made it.    What I love love love about this place:  1.  Freshest sashimi I've ever had.  In an inland state????  How is that possible?  Ok, I've never had sashimi in Taiwan when we went last time and I've never been to Japan.  I stand to change my mind when I actually do that.  2.  The best "Happy Hour" menu I've ever seen in any place.  Period.  And for whatever reason, at 3 AM, Happy Hour was still going on.  Fine by me and my big mouth!  3.  Exceptional service.  I felt we were very well taken care of even though this place was PACKED.  I can't wait to go back to this place.  Seriously.  I don't go to Vegas very often, but I for sure will be coming here the next time we stop by.

UECKJ-yHM-eDa4pQX-CmsA.text: Super disappointed in the experience here. I was so excited by the reviews  Ramen barely had meat, the beef udon soup was okay, sushi roll was falling apart :( The only thing that was tasty was the fried pork.  On top of that customer service was so bad  They only had 1 menu for 4 people to share. When we asked for a new sushi roll to be made because it was literally falling apart before we picked it up they said "no that's the way it is". When I pointed out the ramen only had two scraps of pork the owner acted like a child. He was unprofessional saying we were causing the problem & asking what our jobs were? Super sad that it wasn't as good as it is cute.

KRqQtujNFKhY8mpIOtosLg.text: Awesome little place that offers a lot of variety like sushi, ramen, yakitori, and Japanese tapas. We always come here if we want more than just sushi. The food is flavorful especially the skewered meats and veggies. Great service from the staff.

Me15xUwnTV3yS4TfXhQ-4Q.text: One of my top 2 izakaya places in Las Vegas. Great selection, quality and service. Rarely a wait for a seat. Five stars for the Uni pasta, but be sure to share as it's a very rich tasting dish.

Nn5MGKUS9Bdwu1MYdodGBA.text: This place is so tasty. My parents and I came here because my mom was craving ramen at night 11pm (very odd, yes). But we ended up here and ordered from the happy hour menu, which has a lot of variety and options.   The service was outstanding and the waiters are all good looking too! We also got our food in a timely manner, and it tasted so good. So much flavor!   We loved this place so much, we returned here again before my parents went home the next day. And surprisingly, one of the waiters remembered us and welcomed us back haha. Overall, yummy yummy Japanese food!

98tEVKA9FmBFeilM96styQ.text: Coming from Denver, this place is definitely more unique. This has more of an ambiance much like what you would get in Japan: hole in the wall, hard to find, but damn oh so good. We had my friend with us who never ventured past a California roll. He was willing to try something way outside the box and this place delivered with full stomachs and happy faces. As soon as you walk in you know and feel like this is the real deal. The loud conversations from other patrons will right away tell you that what they are eating and drinking has a positive impact in their mouths and they are enjoying each and every bite. This place is small so if you have a large group, be ready to wait. Smaller groups tend to he seated quicker.  I will try to remember all that we ordered: garlic lemon gizzards, pork belly, tuna belly, cow tongue, spider roll, dragon roll, Unagi roll, sashimi 5fish plate, and Uni. My favorite was the Uni but the rest comes in a close 2nd. Everything we ordered was made to perfection and there was nothing we could complain about. This restaurant made my friend a sushi fan and more than ever willing to try more exotic dishes.   Next time We are back here we will definitely come back. But we will be ordering  different things on the menu. Only to explore other items that we anticipate will only gratify our pallets.

photos.caption: Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna belly
Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dragon Roll

4Y6U65BVddTzY82OGVVhVw.text: 4 for the price points offered, 3 overall. Cool offerings such as sea cucumber, raw octopus, silverfish however quality and freshness was not peak on all of them.  Robata was a high point, sushi rolls were mediocre. Service was surprisingly efficient and fast. Fun Japanese beer selections, lots of reasonably priced Sakes.

photos.caption: Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Battera, pressed mackerel ..

ydLJ4tsuIAWQWhKZkRl9gQ.text: Location: parking was bad.  Service: the lady forgot my order couple times. They didn't come around the tables that much.  Food: Yakitori was really bad. I have never been to a yakitori place as bad as this place. The meat quality was bad and the taste was awful. The miso soup was meh. All of other food we ordered were meh. People who gave this place 3 stars or more should go out and try REAL Japanese food.  Never come back!!!

FU6EnLaFTiPsn8iM1e2c9Q.text: Bruh! This place is a gem. You gotta go! I've been there 4 times already and every time we order something different and they never disappoint.   Not going to write hella much. There is only one take away from my review: GO THERE AND EAT THIS GUYS DELICIOUS FOOD. The prices are awesome too!  ayyyyyyeeeeeee!!

photos.caption: Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Legit

djTTJHOrzAyZt7OuH2tIgQ.text: I LOVEEEEE Japanese tapas sooooo much. I've been wanting to try this place for years now and finally had a chance to over the weekend. It was super late so our only other option for Japanese would've been Sushi Samba, but we literally had that the night before so we gave this place a try. There was no wait when we came around 11pm, but we took the last table.  Ordered: x Spicy Tuna Roll - we usually don't order rolls, but lately we've been ordering spicy tuna rolls everywhere we go. This one was a little loose and lightly wrapped, but still flavorful and delicious. Helped that it was on the happy hour menu :) x Spicy Tuna Over Crispy Rice - I LOVEEEE crispy rice, but this one tasted more like fried. Super sticky rice in the middle. Still good, but won't order this again. x Sea Urchin Dumplings - It tastes exactly how you would imagine it. Eating warm uni was a little strange for me, but the boyfie thoroughly enjoyed it.  x Truffle Corn - SOOOOO GOOOD. There's actual pieces of truffle hidden around the corn. MUST order. x Whole Grilled Squid - I love grilled squid and this one did not disappoint.  x Albacore Handrolls - Probably my least favorite of the night. The albacore wasn't fresh and there was just SOOOO much rice. Usually hand rolls come with cucumbers or sauce or SOMETHING, but this one was just fish, rice, and seaweed. Meh. Maybe I'll get the spicy tuna next time.  The food is good and it's a pretty fun environment. Coming here for happy hour makes everything 100x better. Beers were only $3 and our check for all of that was only $50!!! We left stuffed too :) Usually when I eat Japanese tapas the check is ALWAYS over $100. So happy about this place. Even better because it's only 5 minutes away from where I stay.  Happy Hour everyday from 10pm - Close.

Wg1-w8zn6B_uzNPTXlw95g.text: This is a legit Japanese izakaya. We had a tofu salad, rainbow roll, tekka maki, yakitori, and curry udon. Each dish was tasty, well seasoned, perfectly cooked. Their fish selections are impressive as they have stuff from Hokkaido and other parts of Japan. Friendly and attentive staff, too. This is going to be our go-to spot whenever we come to Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tekka maki (tuna roll). Nice n&#39; simple.
Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rainbow roll. Wrapped with very fresh pieces of sashimi.
Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tofu salad. Bonito flakes and shredded daikon on top. Very refreshing.

PT0OxsLIhkH-j07XanhU3g.text: This place is awesome, the octopus is some of the best I have ever had and it was not a one time thing. We had uni, octopus, jellyfish, beef tataki, and a bunch of other items off the menu and everything was extremely fresh and prices were great. Their menu is awesome, lots of small portions so you can have all kinds of stuff rather than filling up on one item. Had a great time will be back again and again. Highly recommend.

n-BNwVT99lNfWepS-rcA-g.text: Had this bookmarked for quite some time for when in Sin City.  Finally made our way there last night and boy am I glad we did.  It was pretty busy upon arriving and had to write our name on a waiting list.  We checked out their menu while waiting, and we were super excited to get a table and try out their eats.    We started off with the Hawaiian Tuna Belly Steak, Scallop yakitori, and 3 kind sashimi platter.   (We had salmon, yellowfin, and maguro on the sashimi platter--okay portioned.)   The tuna belly was BOMB and so were the scallops.  We also tried their Miso Ramen and Octopus balls.  The ramen was slurpin good. The octopus balls presented well with bonito flakes that waved and moved like the dish was alive, but they were so-so.  We also got the grilled whole squid and that was BOMB as well.    All in all, I shall be back here soon the next time I am in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Miso Ramen

GQwNrunPkIOKPDtXPT_41A.text: Food is a little bit above average and the prices are reasonable.  What i felt was lacking was the quality of the fish.   I wouldn't say it's the freshest but i didn't feel the quality was a miss.   I just felt that the sushi slices were thinner than most places.  But at least the portion of the food was a decent size so you are getting a bigger bang for your buck.  You also can make reservation so you can avoid the wait.  This place does get packed so come early or you will have to wait.   The servers were nice and attentive.  They came back a couple of times to refill our tea and glass.    Don't order the chirashi bowl.  They don't give you much fish and the fish wasn't fresh.  My fiance ordered the udon and he loved it.   He finished even the soup.   lol...     I would come back here for the quantity and reasonable price of the food.

Fe8S6VVyK1mDjNpmTzjFUg.text: The food is great and the service is awesome! I've been here couple of times now and I've been satisfied every time! The Happy Hour pricing is pretty good too and will definitely be coming back!

Ry-Y2OaZLHPQshGyjy5FkQ.text: I'm shocked at the high ratings this place got...it really was just ok.  Food: we ordered a lot. Grilled mackerel was a bit overdone and tasted dry as a result. The calamari was extremely oily. Our vegetarian friend got squid flakes in her salad (funny but a big no-no). Enoki butter was good. The stir fried udon and grilled squid were delicious. Pork karaage also came out late. It was also dry and room temperature.  Service: Waitstaff was sweet but simply no where to be found. One of our dishes also came out as we were getting ready to leave.  We were hoping for another great experience venturing off the strip, but this was just an average place.

UUO8EWHy3c8GdQiejfyU0Q.text: Favorite spots in Vegas during the night after coming out off work late and not feeling to cook. They are fast on service fast on food can't complain and the best part all my favorite cravings is right there too

_zXxNDxYPj_jdmZAQb09NQ.text: Wonderful service!  Great quality food and reasonable price!!! Check this place out... does get loud and space can be better, that's why I gave 4 stars, but it's all about Good Vibez!

_rFGaXwE5gWB5G03ubqMMQ.text: My coworker and I were planning on going to a restaurant in the same shopping center and saw this place had newly opened and decided to try something new. The menu is pretty interesting and I am interested in going back later and trying one of their burgers. I wasn't in a burger mood this time so I tried a one of the combination platters with grilled salmon teriyaki. I can be a salmon snob so the first bite is everything. If I get the hint of fishiness it is going back. But, I was super happy to note that there was not a hint of fishiness. For 9.95 the Combo plates are massive and have a lot of food, could not even come close to eating it all. In the end it was very good. My coworker got the curry and enjoyed it. In order to get a five star review a place has to really wow me, and this place did not. But it was very good and we will return.

knqEENG1N1FrwKPPuTY9Ug.text: I went here fairly late at night. Everything was very flavorful and fresh but the service was a little slow. Regardless, the service wasn't terrible, and I will go back again because I have no complaints about the food or the menu.

eMMSHNzOtw0n1vZwQIHytg.text: Been to this place twice now and every time I always leave full and happy. The food here is amazing, they have tons of choice some being traditional Japanese food while others are more fusion type. Overall love this place their kara age is juicy and filling and so is the Ramen burger, plus their season fries are perfect. Highly recommend if you're looking for fair priced Japanese food

photos.caption: Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kara age dinner plate filling for about  $12

Vjq8bFG4slXXhvdxKC8e8g.text: You won't regret eating here! They are very friendly & their food is delicious! I'd travel across America just to eat here again. Till next time Las Vegas & IZAKAYA!

gVYMSBz8d4cG0vHeZ3rZeA.text: After reading some Yelp reviews we came here for an early dinner on Valentine's day and thank goodness it wasn't busy yet and got a table. Overall I liked this place; I want to go back and recommend it to friends. The atmosphere is very welcoming and service was attentive. We had their craft beers, trout sashimi, uni, octopus takoyaki, salmon rice and mackerel.

NLBnzvJg6ExI_kLedtpQlw.text: Loved it!  We were looking for good Japanese off the strip (way cheaper) and found this jem...  Great selection and quality!  The tapas menu format is a little confusing given that some things are not really to be shared ...  Some more guidance on the menu could prove beneficial to future guests....

EFRgF-yLRg1qgFFwRBJOug.text: Sevice was pretty bad tonight.  We had to chase after the wait staff to put in more orders.  Food is pretty good though.  Maybe if they didn't seat my friend & I in the back where we were easily forgotten as customers left & emptied the place then maybe they would've served us better.

hcUhChOh-8IEuySAbF5y0Q.text: Great place great service! 10/10 recommend! Food was delicious with a large variety to choose from.

lDLKcys6cOMjo7Vftcvohw.text: This is one of the few places that is actually ran by people that speak and can cook a decent Japanese meal. The fish is very fresh and they have real Wasabi, not the fake tube crap they all other places serve. So when you mix it in, hold on to your taste buds. The ramen is also a nice treat. The service is very prompt and highly friendly. The only thing that I am sure will be fixed shortly is that they don't have their liquor license. Otherwise I would give them 5 stars. I do miss my sake.

8JD4WsTDgQOdURhkdmFO_Q.text: I ordered a certain way and it was not correct when I got it. There was not broth with my noodles as I asked for it. The dynamite is not "dynamite" it's the opposite in fact, I felt like I was eating scallops out of a pool of melted mayo. When the broth for my dry fried noodles came he also brought my ice cream knowing I'm clearly not done eating as he just brought the other half of one of my dishes. My boyfriend eventually asked him if he could keep it cold somehow while I am still eating. To top it all off a bug crawled on my leg while eating.

vGKu2jrvnauP3OrF6dC-_g.text: This place is great! Happy hour is 10-close. The food is amazing and the service from the staff was superb! I definitely recommend the Tuna Belly Steak,it was so juicy and fresh, cooked to perfection, also the dinner plates are a great deal for all you get and the skewers are amazing as well! Definitely a great spot and open till 3am on weekends :)

5kHlBldw5_Wvxj59JhfC7A.text: Not that spectacular. Their grilled squid really sucks, it tastes like they boiled or steamed instead of grilling. Vegas has so many good Izakaya places, so I don't think I will ever go back. Uni pasta was okay, not that special. you won't be able to taste uni, and you can make a cream pasta by yourself and put some uni on there. Probably the same taste.

z4VwE4ag2U76-IZL2xLz6g.text: Great ambience, good get away from vegas strip, cozy atmostphere, tasty tapas, yummy sake and green tea mochi dessert.... we loved the experience and the tapas were awesome

dyjvSxTMoHxKnJ9hoaXXmg.text: Ordered enough food to cover 3 tables: we had sashimi, yakitori, udon, sushi, tapas.... Only tried 1/2 of them because my kids move faster with their forks and hands. Well the half that I ate was wonderful, one of the best! If u are in Vegas, don't miss out. If you are in LA, what the heck, just drive!

eVi6KnZtEEpjtBaZlb6hwA.text: most amazing japanese restaurant!!!!! absolutely outstanding, freshest, customer service, just everything is amazing!!!!!!!

kMPPnbBb8KcN2DVkQpsTvA.text: Good food. Good service. We enjoyed our lunch of 8 people in the group. I liked the Ramen and beef teriyaki.

9HBvWP6vssK9yCHGhvhYFA.text: Excellent service.  Extensive menu with wide selection.  Happy Hour Late night!  Staff in kitchen do their job---no monkey business. Owner knows what he is doing. Best in Vegas!

WvQFm4ErtaxXt7cV2YrfkQ.text: Great place for late night and off strip.  Happy Hour menu is great.  The poke California roll is delicious

6f-2qyUAdlFUFA2yrEqICA.text: Oishikatta! I'm Japanese and I thought it was really authentic and affordable. Standard izakaya fare done well. We had karaage, chawan mushi, fried rice, hamachi roll, yaki udon, poke burrito, ramen, and a ume onigiri :) they also have combination plates with stuff like teriyaki chicken so your friend who isn't an adventurous eater and/or can't appreciate good food has something to eat. (You might want to reconsider that friendship though.) wish I lived here so I can try more of their stuff.

dJq45UQX6BCUty81iWjH-g.text: The first time we ate here months ago the service was awful but the food was so good we decided to give it another try. The server that gave us issues is no longer there but the food has remained consistently good. The fish for sashimi is always fresh. The crunchy pork belly is spot on. The izakaya go fried rice has that umami flavor going for it. Even the vegetables are good (garlic spinach and the eggplant with miso).

SM5z89W-lZR7w4djDcPjRg.text: Great place. You'll feel you're in Japan. The place has an amazing happy hour which I recommend. Make sure to try the fish and chips on the happy hour menu. Cheap and delicious. The sushi is high grade. If you love uni, this is your place. I've never seen any place that serves uni in the portions that they do. For $23 they give you practically a big box of it. Well worth it given how expensive uni could be.

photos.caption: Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Omakase
Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oysters on happy hour menu
Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sushi ikura roll. Must try.

AWXH9wn3rVpn6Y1q4zccNw.text: Very authentic Izakaya in Las Vegas. Extensive menu including fish flown daily from Japan. Excellent!!!!!

03vMo0wSfFEsZOJom8Et-w.text: Great place! They have amazing choices from their sushi rolls to skewers. I had their curry which was pretty good. The only thing I have a problem is their prices. It seemed a little too up their for their quality. Not to say that the quality of the food was bad but it wasn't worth how much the bill came out to be. Between my and my friend, our bill came out at $50, which I thought was a lot considering we didn't order that much. That being said, would I come back here? Yes, probably during happy hour, though.

photos.caption: Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bN6Lk7RgSj_twkVb9Jbgyw.text: This is by far my favorite joint in the Spring Mountain vicinity!!  Let me start by saying you can can get just about anything Japanese that your heart desires. With everything from spicy ramen to octopus carpaccio and everything else in between, the menu is very extensive and never dissapoints! Our go to is pretty much everything off the grill. The okra, mushrooms, scallops wrapped in bacon, pork cheek, beef tongue and korubuta sausage are just a few of our favorites and are always cooked to perfection.   Another plus, they are open late! However, they do get pretty busy, no matter the time of the day... so call in advance and make a reservation and head on in.

sgzZA0FuHipKK_FzHi0aKw.text: Just all the yes! Came here for dinner with a friend and the service was friendly and great and everything we ordered was also amazing! I ordered shrimp tempura which came with so many sides like miso soup, potato salad, salad, pickled veggies, etc. The food was cooked perfectly! We also ordered a sushi roll and I loved it because unlike other places, they go light on the rice and really add a lot of content to the inside. I'll be back as soon as I can!

photos.caption: Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5tyHBLnQgmW6av9I178A0g.text: I love this place! It's my first time, I was craving ramen so bad. This place did not disappoint! The ramen was great, not too salty or oily; just the perfect balance. I also got a free ice cream from checking in! The prices are cheap, I came here with a friend and our bill together cost $22! The staff is so welcoming and very friendly, we had 2-3 staff helping and asking if everything is. I would definitely come here again and recommend this place to others!

photos.caption: Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xh8GN_eMCv2BSn4l48ltuw.text: Really good! Everything we ordered was good and prices were surprisingly cheap! We ordered:  1. Braised Pork Appetizer- I failed and meant to order the crispy pork belly LOL. It was pretty good but a bit salty. If you order this, make sure to eat it with rice.   2. Fresh Halibut Roll- So good! I ordered it with spicy tuna inside anyways of California roll. I would definitely get this again.   3. Tuna Belly & Unagi Yakitori: I saw good reviews on these so I ordered them, but they were just okay..I wouldn't have minded skipping these.  4. Sashimi Platter- Don't get this..it wasn't good.   5. Cold Soba- good and refreshing on a hot day!   6. Soft shell crab appetizer: Loooved this!   Overall, I think this place has such good reviews because of their pricing. I wouldn't say they have the best quality fish, but you're getting really good food for the price. Service was friendly, menu was diverse, and the food was tasty. Would recommend for anyone looking for good Japanese food in Vegas.

62v2swxIIOaD7WoJKorfVA.text: Stopped here for a late night dinner/shared plates - authentic Izakaya experience.  The food was great, ramen was very good and plenty of beer/drinks options.  Highly recommend this place.

0yJaIi6SHsutYPr0afViBQ.text: I am impressed. A memorable and delicious meal does not need to come from an expensive restaurant. This Izakaya proves right. I love the buzz and coziness of the place. It is busy even after midnight. The wait is around 15-20 minutes for bar seating. You put the name of your party on the wait list. The tables do not accommodate more than 4. Only one table for a big group. It's perfect for a light meal after clubbing.   The menu has more varieties than normal izakaya. If you are hungry, it can be pricey. It may run around $30 and more. Beer is not my beverage of choice but the Kirin draft served in a thick chilled glass is so smooth and refreshing. Come after 10 pm to get the happy hour deal.   Order: Tuna belly, pork cheek, chicken liver, unagi, Uno bowl, sweet shrimp, etc. The grilled foods contain a lovely yummy aroma. Super good.

fYPE87H6qfXGp8LuYenWXw.text: I came back to Vegas, looking forward to dine here again!  The head chef is from Osaka, where my mom is from and that may explain why I love everything I tried on their menu  (^.^) I'll keep coming back here every time I'm in Vegas!!

photos.caption: Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy hour $5 ramen.

MGNrYoB6xxdGOiYV6-mUdQ.text: If you are looking for hard to find dishes, come here and they have it. I initially wanted to come here because i saw that they have the Chawanmushi. Very few knows of or if they do, they make it wrong. Another thing I always try to look for is the fish liver. THEY HAVE IT TOO.   Things we ordered :   Uni Tempura - ok. not impressed Chawanmushi - very impressed Uni Chawanmushi - Vey traditional, Very impressed Salmon Roll - just ok  Uni Sashimi - Very good Ramen ( forgot my husband got it) - it was ok  Fish Liver - Perfect!  Fried Chicken - for the little one - Was really moist& good.   We will def tr to come back to try other dishes

KRzC90Y_fW_Ovi2rtPD9uA.text: When I travel and try new places, I always ask myself the same question: would I want this restaurant back home near me so I can go there again and again. In this case, the answer is a resounding YES.  When the waitress brought over a stack of menus almost 10 inches high, I had my doubts. How could they possibly do a good job on so many different items. Pictures looked good so our party of three ordered grilled, raw, and from the kitchen items to try. Fish was perfectly cooked and seasoned. Raw items were fresh and briny. We also ordered the uni pasta, creamy with a hint of sweetness and sea. Overall everything was very good with maybe one or two out of 10 dishes we ordered were 'only' good. Service was also friendly and prompt. We never felt rushed even know there was already a long line on a Monday night at 7:00 PM. We will go back again before heading back to New York for sure.  Last but not least if you like to drink, there are a wide variety of Japanese whiskey and beer at very reasonable prices. BONUS.  Man I wish we had a place like this near me.

photos.caption: Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Daily specials
Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Daily specials
Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Daily specials

5-bzupPQ_jKdo4mIRUQXgg.text: Went here around midnight with my sibling, good atmosphere. Not too brightly lit, great music, and hand drawn chalkboard ads.  Service was ok, they seemed to disappear a bit too long but its after midnight so im not too worried.  Had food off the happy hour menu. The ramen noodles were a bit chewy but the broth was savory. Loved the menma and onsen egg in it.  Fried softshell crab was delicious for something ive never had before and i loved their handrolls.

photos.caption: Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Gi4uAqY8O1lArt79BU8y_A.text: Quite good authentic japanese food  - fresh fish sashimi was great, they deep fry the fish bones and bring it back to you. - the okra was amazing - tako balls were a bit heavy - the hamachi uni sashimi was a miss - the uni bowl was good but can be better - service was excellent

fMGXgkOaQsAzw2LtFhqRlw.text: Best spot in town to bring friends and enjoy some drinks and good food! We always order the skewers and some of their sushi items- which is pretty fresh. We really enjoy their happy hour and appreciate how late they're open. This place actually reminds me of the some of the izakaya that I went to when I was in Japan- ambience wise. It's always busy, but service was always consistent and quick. I recommend making a reservation in advance.  My friends and I really enjoyed the skewers (we always just order a variety of different kinds to enjoy with beers). I think they're slightly overpriced for the amount you get & the meat quality isn't the greatest, but it's good beer food. We've had the uni bowl- it was Santa Barbara Uni that tasted pretty fresh, but really small. I also recommend trying the sweet soy dango for dessert as well. Honestly, we've ordered almost everything on their menu and enjoyed everything. If you're from Rowland Heights, CA and have previously dined at Honda-Ya, you will get a similar vibe. The only thing that I think needs some improvement would be service. We had a few servers that were really attentive, friendly, and accommodating (one specific male person whose name I didn't catch that always seats us for our reservations). However, the last time we were there, we had a female server who didn't really offer that friendly service and we had to keep flagging her down to order or get a drink refill. She just seemed like she was in a rush the entire time and we felt bad for taking up her time so the entire ordering experience just felt very rushed and unpleasant. I work in the hospitality industry and I think it's important to always speak clearly, be attentive, and maintain composure in a high volume or fast-paced environment, but speaking from experience, it is also understandable and we still had a great time. We plan on returning and will always bring friends/family whenever they come visit us from CA.

LVTSb8fLC1ef5tODUTkOSw.text: The service was excellent and staff very attentive. I loved the food & prices were great. A place to visit again when I'm back in Vegas. ALOHA

yG33e7cTULtswJj4KXxkCg.text: I love this spot!! Small Japanese tapas!! I just love the flavors!!! This is my go to spot for tapas and some other entrees.. I always get the uni pasta.. whole squid, yakitori..yumm  Must try!

Um7JIgCYYUQfYJd1Q-ANew.text: The food is good, but takes forever. Not much customer and it take about an hour for hour food to arrive.

cACNlBsbeW_L7mBghS6tXA.text: So two great thing about this place.  1. It seems reservations can be made but only during the weekday.  2. They have a great happy hour menu for food and beer  Service wise: great. The two young waitress/waiter was attentive even though every table was busy.  Food: surprisingly very tasty and a great place to try some Japanese style food. However don't get the seasoned French fries unless you get it at happy hour because the price is worth it. Their takoyaki was amazingly crunch on the outside but super soft and melt in your mouth texture. Curry udon was good but their ramen wasn't anything amazing but happy hour you can get a half size. Uni pasta is amazing! Super creamy and grabs the uni taste without over powering this.  Basically, all their foods are Japanese style tapas and meant to be shared! Definitely try this place out and there is a separate parking with tons of lots so that won't stress you out.

8YnaskbjX_73QUo_GrKPcQ.text: I found this place on Yelp recently when I was in Vegas with my boyfriend. After watching a show, we got hungry, well I wasnt hungry but he was and so I suggest that we should go to Izakaya and grab something light. This place had the best review and it was the closest.  I really liked how small this place was. Thats because if its too bug, it gets too loud and I cant even hear myself talking. That bothers me a lot. Like Hondaya in LA, I have to scream to talk to friends and I can barely hear what theyre saying so, who enjoys that right?  Their menu was very extensive like many other Izakayas. I know yakitori/skewers are people's favorite but we skipped all that and just ordered a few dishes that caught our attention. When I go to Izakaya, I always start with Takowasa. I dont know why but thats just my thing. I love raw food and so Takowasa is just raw octopus smothered in light wasabi. Its very good and you cant never go wrong with this!  Then we started ordering other dishes and one of them was Uni Chawanmushi. Its a very delicate egg dish. Its steamed egg eith some shitake mushroom tooped with uni. It was really soft and flavor was wonderful. Though I dont eat Shitake mushroom, its flavor wasnt too strong so I was able to eat them fine. But I let boyfriend eat the mushroom itself, haha.  Second dish we ordered was what, Zaru Soba? Haha, I love soba and I thought it was a better choice than Uni Pasta or other noodle dishes they had on the menu. It was a small portion but enough to share with the boyfriend. We ended up asking for another dipping sauce so it was easier for us to eat it on our own dipping bowl.  Boyfriend ordered the House Fried Rice. It was very good. It's one of those fried rice you cant really dislike. Just egg and scallion - - thats all you needed to have that great flavor. I really enjoyed it but I can make this home better, hehe.  I think thats all I had that night. We were pretty full from eating them because before the show, we pigged out at a buffet like crazy! It was good food with good ambiance. Price was just right and service was pretty good in general except when they brought out zaru soba, they gave us an empty dipping bowl. I told them it was empty and they couldnt believe it as if I was lying. Why would I lie about that?!   All in all, food was great and I would probably frequent this place if I lived here. Will come again with friends next time I visit Vegas!

QvqhDwXfZu8PM72tY4x1jQ.text: Long over due review. We go to Vegas at least 6 times a year. Every time we make a trip to Izakaya Go. Food is consistently great every time. The owner is there every single time and that is so rare for restaurants now a days. We recommend doing sake bombs and order things you normally wouldn't. You will be surprised. We always try different things and always find something that is crazy good. Good thing is that if you don't like something than you lost a couple bucks. Big deal. We have been to other izakayas but this by far has the best service and consistently great food.

Rx9NYIacl_mgr_jCgJ6c7w.text: Nothing Special. Overpriced for small portions of average food. I had asked the waitress for hot tea three times! Either she's absent-mindedness or laziness.

k8NkUWxgT5DHBr-KmQ3tTA.text: First and foremost SERVICE could be better, our drinks was never REFILLED even went we ordered several different times from 2 different server!!!   Second all the house sauce is horrible, I just simply had better sauces in different restaurant!   Third all our food tasted bland  We ordered the Soft Shell Crab (Sauce no good and Small), Tuna Belly Skewer (Sauce OK), Black Pork Sausage (No good), Izakaya Go's Fried Rice (No taste BLAND), Fish and Chips (Just ok BLAND), Pork Gyoza (Just OK) and lastly they ran out ice cream flavors only Vanilla (Just OK) and Green Tea (taste like medicine) available. With that said we won't be back glad we didn't ordered too much food. THE ONLY GOOD IS Restaurant atmoshepere is GREAT!

a1ZF1wARdcan82cGRoWLTA.text: Everything was super yummy and very reasonable Ly priced.  The service was spot on as well, which included when they brought out the dishes.  Definitely be added to our Vegas rotation of restaurants to eat at when we are in town.

Pl0z-saSCY9SgxT-8c1lMA.text: I always try to come here whenever I'm in Vegas. Super close to the strip, good food, and a great mix of traditional and more adventurous plates. The staff is always friendly and I have yet to be disappointed!!!  By the way, the truffle butter corn is to die for.

ImslRjL7sETHY0YcIbj-gQ.text: Great hole in the wall. We ordered a bunch of stuff for my wife and two kids and I.  Can get a little pricey if you're not careful but I thought it was all well worth it. Lots of sharing options. Kids liked the set menu in the back and the wife and I got the risotto which was pretty good. We got a bunch of skewers which were good. The chicken in plumb sauce is something to be considered. Least favorite of all we ordered.  We signed up for the loyalty club and got a free ice cream for the girls.

KWgtHaA6Y5Qld3HQgF3oXQ.text: I love this place, after 10 pm they have a late night menu, and they have a pretty nice prices. My hubby and I use to go to Jinya for Ramen but lately last few months the food gives us stomach aches and explosive poops. Haha but this place plays reggae music and you can call ahead for a reservation and kids are welcomed here. I love when my family goes here to eat. I get the Shio Ramen and it's yummmmmy.

UakMARro88vRsl1dO0UltQ.text: Ramen was decent. The highlight was tuna belly. My husband's teriyaki chicken average. Soft shell shrimp had a weird bitter taste in my opinion. Atmosphere was really cool, server was friendly. Maybe we didn't order the right things but this place was just ok.

photos.caption: Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Soft shell shrimp. Tuna belly. Shoyu ramen spicy.

U8hS97u1oqj1TVF6bgt8CQ.text: YUMMY TAPAS & SOME MAIN DISHES AS WELL! This place can definitely add up at times since the tapas can be small and even though it's a few dollars, it could end being more than you expect. So just be careful when you're getting carried away!   The beef tongue skewers are delicious as well as their soft crab. There are just way too many good ones to name :(   I like their combo meals at the back of the menu if I want a full dinner/lunch that will definitely fill me up without the tapas. Their fried rice is delicious as well! I like to add hot sauce obviously to add more flavor!  ALSO, don't forget to check in to get free ice cream. Why would you want to miss that?!

kyxGqdAULM5_ky0zGGccKQ.text: Happened to be in Vegas for the weekend and wanted some good Japanese food. Even with all the restaurants on the strip we could have went to Izakaya Go was the drive to Chinatown. It's my future  go to spot if ever in town. Delicious food, definitely well priced, good happy hour, and fresh ingredients

TAA2ohJoUV_E5a5B5DAm7w.text: 5 stars for service 4 stars for food  I'm no stranger to this restaurant. The best tip I can give you is to come on Monday's when they get their fresh shipment of fish in.   This place gets busy so I usually come right when they open. Otherwise, expect to wait - but it's very well worth it.   Izakaya go has a large menu, so if you're indecisive, ask your server for some suggestions. Also, the chef usually gives you complimentary dishes. Yesterday we got conch, and mantis crab - very different but very tasty.   Here's what I ordered:  Corn butter: delicious but I wish they melted some cheese on top  Dried Mullet Roe w/ Miso cream cheese: salty but goes well with beer Oyster shooter: great but if they added a quail egg, it would've been perfect  Baracuda sashimi - amazing and when you're done, they can deep fry the head for you.  Porkbelly skewers, chicken skewers and the beef tongue was my favorite. All delicious and perfectly grilled.  Potherb mustard yuzu salad with shrimp and avocado - dressed nicely and the shrimp is raw  Ramen Burger with Fries - MY FAVORITE ITEM. Instead of using a regular beef patty, it's chashu pork.   Service is excellent however when it gets busy, just please be patient. They're doing their best and I can definitely see that.

5TUgntwCMzseFUBK-eBWUQ.text: Came with 4, spent $160 :O  Vast selection and authentic. Typical izakaya are far more reasonable. Hawaiian music was a strange combo. One piece of salmon I had in the carpaccio was messed up. Not sure what it was but had to spit it out. Tasted very stale so didn't want to risk it.

NjdmpF4JQ-C6y7w7_OEy1A.text: BEST PLACE TO GO IF AT LAS VEGAS! Everything is reasonably priced and the food is delicious! They have a great variety of dishes and the food is very fresh and Izakaya Go always serves good quality food. I go every time I'm in the area, and everything is great here!

o-CSv21I4ApJh-xuOVjBxQ.text: This is are favorite place right now a little of everything... sushi ramen beef etc everything cook to perfection...

Hob0QFBMme7ICH0QLRLZWQ.text: Best sushi in Las Vegas period bar none. My wife and are both sushi snobs. We were introduced to this place by our Tokyo native friend Hideyo and we were blown away.  The restaurant is located in a strip mall in China Town don't let that fool you. The decor is in line with casual Japanese restaurants on Tokyo.  The food. We ordered the Horse Mackerel $19.50. It's essentially sashimi. They slice the fish into site size pieces and use the bones and head to dress up the plate. When you are done with the dish they deep fry the bones and you can eat them. Very nice and crunchy.  Omakase Nigiri $65. We were serves 12 pieces in total. Everything seem to be freshly caught that afternoon (even though it wasn't) Tuna Belly (Toro) was flown in from Turkey (600lbs tuna). Super buttery. Sea Urchin (Uni) flown in from Santa Barbara. We were served proper size pieces not those wafer thin pieces you get at other places. Thus we were able to fully experience the subtle flavors. Sorry got to go now!!!!!

wSEbEDmBDpFkYhjHMTSKVw.text: So guuuuuu. So guuuu. I love this place. Very  guuuuddd. I'll be back . Maybe tomorrrooo .

dJi2PNpzAsZWSd32Bj5RxQ.text: I can not wait to come back to this place - I want to sit here for hours and just keep ordering plates!   I had the fortune of coming here with a Japanese friend and everything she ordered was delicious. One of the dishes was so delicious I ordered a second one... miso glazed eggplant.   This place is best described as Japanese street food - or small plates/tappas.   The sushi was fresh and well done - not an absurd about of rice paired with it. The sashimi salad was on point in every way.   There were a couple of dishes I wouldn't rush to order again; their flavor just didn't compare to their other dishes. One of the dishes was chicken breast with plum, it just lacked flavor.

wTOFQdKFuTQtcYzBSrwrbA.text: The food is delicious. price is good and it opens until 3am. We come here for food break from the casino. Love this place so much.

The only down side is the seating is small and when you order for seconds, sometimes the food doesn't go through and you have to wait a little longer. I was a little annoyed on our last visit because we had ordered a lot & the waiter responded " just to let you know, you already ordered a lot ". That was a rude comment to make. Overall the food is good.
