mnQxCxXxZ6-9sd7UVL4uyQ.text: Great happy hour menu.  My favorite go to spot for a late night bite. I live for their soft shell crab!  Also, the free green tea cream you get when you check in tops it off

YbFunbj2mqgkA6P9loGgAw.text: Always feels like family here. I love my Brians (inside joke)! This food is on point Andre than reasonable prices. Their uni is authentic and the owner himself picks the distributor. All of their food is AMAZING! I'm a good critique and don't yelp so trust me when I say This place is bomb! Im from Guam and only 3 hours fr Japan, we know good Japanese when we taste it. THE REAL McKoy food approved

3tLsTNcg-gecvUnT4wkeaw.text: We are a group for 4 and we ordered a lot of food. Love the omasake, Jao, our server was very nice and attentive. I will definitely come back to bring my so who also loves Japanese food.  Check in to get free ice cream.

1O7VLrMPBO5coGFm9HecuA.text: Long ago this place was popping to the point that a 20 minute plus wait was expected no matter what night. Showing up on a Friday night this week, it was dead. Only 2 tables were filled and the almost all Japanese staff were replaced by no Japanese staff.  The food was still just as decent and definitely one of the better Japanese restaurants in the city, so no complaints there.  Sashimi of the night (25, 35, 45$ options) To eat between two people as a tapas plate (don't expect this to be that filling) the 25$ was perfect.  Karaage: skip it. Over fried, over burnt, no flavor. It was closer to KFC chicken then your traditional Japanese style karaage. 1/5 Takoyaki: The tako wasn't the best quality, but it was good. 4/5 Okonomiyaki: There aren't very many places you can order this at. It's like takoyaki batter, but pancake style and with different seafood/vegetables in it. I preferred to okonomiyaki to the takoyaki. It was also a way bigger portion for the price.  With beers being as cheap as 4-5$ on draft, it really felt like a Japanese izakaya.

jqnmW455WVn0QAJXa1BNdg.text: If you are from nyc and miss st marks, this might just be the closest thing you'll get. Food was yummy. Not good for large crowds of more than 6 people. Staff are friendly. We were table of 7 people, bill was $600!

KuUpykMw5Jyj44J4RLhD7w.text: So we sat at the bar, which I like because I love scoping places cook and make sushi . Our server was nice, gave us a bunch of good recommendations. I liked this place because it was small plates/ Tapas style and we were able to share a lot of different things.  Place is cute, small but charming. Decent wine and alcohol options.   Ordered:  Pork cheeks- good! But ours felt slightly over cooked  Halibut roll- super fresh and delicious Spanish bluefin - very happy with  Hamachi - comes w/ jalapeno and tomato slices. The jalapeno on this were HOT Kimchi pork- really enjoyed but could have been more spicy Chicken skewer w/ plum sauce- cooked good- didn't love the plum sauce.   The menu has SO many options. I'm looking forward to going back and trying more.

wdTtgTs5qsIb1Sdm3Ro8-w.text: Izakaya Go is a secret gem Japanese restaurant. It's tucked away in the South East corner of Spring Mountain and Valley View. They offer traditional Japanese cuisine as well as sushi. Some of my favorite items on the menu other than sashimi is the Beef Tataki, Rock Shrimp, Truffled Butter Corn, Sushi Burrito, Tuna Poke with Chips, Miso Marinated Salmon Bowl, Sauteed Mushrooms, Halibut Carpaccio, Salmon and Hamachi Kama, Salmon Carpaccio with Truffle oil, Toro and lastly the Wagyu Beef Sushi  !!!! They have a full bar and are open really late which is a huge bonus for night owls like me. The crowd is always fun and interject this place is a must try.

vikj5x2b0p8hRqdghOPGJg.text: I come here for their Yakitori. My favorites are chicken gizzards, chicken hearts and liver because not many places serve those in Vegas. All of their Yakitori chicken skewers are absolutely delicious!! I wish they were open for lunch time... Last time I ordered fried chicken cartilage (torinan) and it was very greasy for some reason. I've had better in Ichiza. Sad. This place is always so busy so sometimes my Yakitori order takes more than 20 minutes to come out. It's worth the wait though!! Right off I-15. I always have hard time parking.

LKeQZofO4q3q2SSf_eq-xg.text: The food at this place is just so so to me.  The price is kinda high for the small portion.  The service was not impressive especially the server made a mistake but didn't even care to apologize.  We already the monk fish liver but I didn't want the server to get confused whether we wanted fish liver or beef liver, I told her one more time it's fish liver and she said okay okay.  After a while the fish liver hasn't come so we asked about the fish liver and she said we ordered beef liver.  I told her that we emphasized that we want the "fish" liver and she asked if I talked to her about that.  I was like my husband placed the order but I mentioned one more time after that I want fish.    Later she just said okay okay and I was gonna tell her that it's fine we can take another beef liver, she just seems so frustrated and ran away.    I just felt that her service was really bad and the food was just overpriced for the portion.  The only dish I liked was the blue crab salad.

hwfooc7NHSGcUuCKyFFIrw.text: We needed a few small bites to tie us over before our Christmas Eve dinner and this place was perfect. They accommodated us before it got super busy with the dinner crowd. The chicken karaage was crispy on the outside and super tender on the inside. The omakase sushi was a fresh selection of 4 sushi's. The poke bowl was well flavored with lots of fresh fish. The prices are quite reasonable too.

k65dTTLEPoTmdXrLWTkZcw.text: The male server with the glasses is terrible. He forgot our order and not very friendly at all. He looked like he was high or something, he kept forgetting our order and gave us wrong stuff multiple times, definitely one of the worse servers I've seen in years. He was not focused and lacked of good manners, I used to be a server so I know exactly what to do and not to do. All the rest of the female servers were super nice though, so be sure to ask for female server.

Gp0eTFJhrr3D5IQABuLm2Q.text: I was told about this restaurant from some friends so went semi late on a Thursday (11pm) . It's a small restaurant in a strip mall but it's very busy . We were lucky to get a seat at the bar and the restaurant filled up quickly as soon as we got there . They have a few different menus including a happy hour menu and a fish menu and small plates as well . The service was good and attentive . We ordered some happy hour menu items and some regular menu items .  Monkfish liver -good Baked muscles -ok Uni pasta -amazing but very creamy  Marinate Cabbage -good  Wagyu sushi -great  We had other things all were average or above average .   We will go back to experience more of the menu and get into the fish side of the menu .  We did not get into the grill items but that will Be a future trip too .

photos.caption: Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle butter corn
Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shiitake mushroom yakatori and ginkgo nuts
Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken wasabi yakatori

HR0MrvTjpwgUjdbJIVyGYQ.text: Came here to get rid of a very strong Japanese street food craving after watching YouTube videos of the street food venders in Japan. Ordered the Japanese pancake as well as the takoyaki balls and I feel like it under delivered as far as the sauce and slightly over cooking it went. Other than that; it is great to be able to order these authentic Japanese dishes here in Vegas. The ramen was actually not bad compared to the fully dedicated ramen joints. The spicy pork is more mild, but the flavor of the pork and broth was very tasty. The hot Japanese green tea is fantastic if you are in the mood for tea. I would avoid eating an onigiri here (as it is just rice wrapped in nori) but the salmon belly skewers were delicious, and cooked to perfection. The grilled corn had a nice flavor to it as well. Overall a great place with a very excellent, expansive menu which means many new things to try!   --Reserve a table or get there early as seating is very limited!!--

photos.caption: Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy miso Ramen!

EU5NskswipW7A4HUaTCAag.text: We left the club at 2 in the morning and came here for good eats. There was a wait at 2 in the morning! It was worth it. They have a late happy hour menu which has sushi, ramen, curry, etc. We had the ramen and it was perfect for late night eats.

5Fu5MNsN8NGp0WTAgdZHvQ.text: Great late night find! Vast menu, excellent selection, everything we tried was tasty and delicious! Prices are phenomenally low, great value! Conveniently location not far off the I15, far away enough from the strip but not too far that it's a pain to get to. Highly recommended; will definitely be back!

SCVk_1i3zA59JPiWeNBOzw.text: Great food but Awful service. Our server short asian lady with tattoo on her right arm. She looked young. Refused to take our dessert order because the bill was already printed. Customer Service Failed.

REd-ii4H5gTByzNPk2n49g.text: Seriously it's just okay. Small pieces, omakase presentation is non existent, miso marinated salmon was salty, and the mochi ice cream...the mochi is supposed to be chewy and soft but it was like plastic. I was so hoping they would ask if everything was okay but never did. The only thing that was good, but really, how can you go wrong with tuna rolls and kake udon? At least the kids were fine until the dessert came out.

photos.caption: Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

p7bE1Bq14tyWIxHbDpzGnA.text: My first time here...must say I am positively impressed. I usually go to Ichiza for Japanese if I go off the strip but decided I wanted to try something new and didn't want to wait in the long line at Ichiza.

ShcVGQvDOauBn79hE4tosA.text: Thank you Izakaya for making us wait for almost 40 minutes for a table...because if you hadn't, we never would have walked out and found this hidden gem instead....Umiya!    Horrible customer service here. Will NOT be coming back. Will be going to Umiya from now on!

IpqrWRBXokDDHI-XhPPl7w.text: Came here to try the happy hour menu with a group of 6 people. I enjoyed the fish n chips and the udon was also good. I saw the mochi cheese on yelp and felt the need to try it for myself but i didn't like it. It was basically mochi with smelt eggs on top and then covered with a layer of melted cheese. Would not get it again but i guess im glad tired it. Good prices for sake and beer on happy hour. Only thing is that i felt like our server was mad at us from the moment we got in. I didnt feel welcome but maybe she was just having a bad night which i can understand. This restaurant is v small so i wouldn't suggest coming here with a large group. I would like to come here again but on a slower night and with just one friend.

photos.caption: Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheese mochi.. i am not a fan....

1ySXcedFpQRVMRKehlAMVw.text: Incredible, you have to come here! Food was amazing, ambiance was dope. And they also have traditional Japanese seating at one of the tables without shoes if you wanna have the culture experience. Sushi rolls took a little longer than usual. But this place is SO worth it! My family and gf are going to come back every time we come to Vegas!!!! P.s. The spicy tonkontsu ramen was some of the best I ever had!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lni3SxEvpmWsNgR3JJ1Qdw.text: My bestie and I were in town to celebrate my birthday and this place was recommended by the Japanese hairstylist that cut my hair. Always trust  a native.   Izakaya Go is a small, but cozy, restaurant that made us very happy. The menu is very extensive, from sushi hand rolls, yakitori, tempura, etc. The pretty much had everything, even hamachi Kama.   We had the daikon salad, yakitori, vegetable tempura, pork belly crisps and other things I can't remember. Everything was excellent.   Price wise, to us, everything was unbelievably reasonable!  I would totally come back here and recommend this place to everyone.   I will be

photos.caption: Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hCZr4o7mjStWa28GgfqyMQ.text: What a fun find we finally got to visit! I loved the feel of Izakaya Go from sitting in an authentic Japanese setting to having some of the best tapas I've had in town!  The service was extremely friendly and quick! We ordered drinks and the sparkling peach jelly sake came quick! Remember to have the server shake it for you and you won't regret it!   We had everything from octopus balls (hahaha) to shrimp ramen to blue crab salad to fried rice. NOTHING wasn't delicious! My favorite was the blue crab salad but there was so much on the menu I want to go back to try!

oR8CbhdF2zbvRZYwFg-zeA.text: What to eat when you're out and about at 2am in Vegas. There are very few spots that stay open that late.  We drove in from OC around 1am.  I didn't feel like having a heavy meal so we found this spot on Yelp.  I know that it's somewhere outside the strip.  The Uber driver took us here so I don't quite remember the exact location.    This restaurant is small with a bar area and some booths.  The service was ok but it's Vegas and people are not chipper all the time.  They have HH here.  The menu is pretty extensive from sushi, ramen noodles, udon, rice dishes, tapas and more.    We wanted something light so we opted for ramen.  The tonkotsu ramen was ok.  Not the best but it will do when you're hungry or hungover.  I tried the spicy miso ramen.  It was more tasty than the latter.  Again, it's a last resort.  I probably wouldn't choose this spot again for late night eats.  There are better options around the area!

photos.caption: Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy miso ramen half size. Meh!

tQNYyuX-IOEeVWJeZnp5rw.text: Very very very yummy-5 Yummies I'll attach pictures and you figure it out. Right now I'm curled up in a food coma from overload of the senses. Everything was great! Expect to wait a little bit because their seating is limited. But, it's worth it. Cost is reasonable too! Portions are small but filling. Owner is wonderful. We sat in the middle of the restaurant shoes off on pads in a sunken table, the way it should be lol.

mBBOegJrk9uIGdry92h3-g.text: Authentic Japanese food you can have here. It is typical Japanese tapas bar (Izakaya).  Sashimi & sushi 5/5 Hospitality 4/5 Food 4/5 Price 3/5  All in all, we enjoyed eating here. Some staff were able to speak Japanese.

But this place is SO worth it! My family and gf are going to come back every time we come to vegas!

E0fCApacw9KUmWc7fIZTkw.text: The staff is very friendly and will help you with all your needs. Get here early on Friday and Saturday nights the place fills up fast.

dkBj-fDI-lfJ-AW9n5w9hA.text: Food is good, not salty. Ambience is nice. Service is quick and awesome.  Staff are nice.

photos.caption: Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qtUpFdO3a55SZp_wtGq6_g.text: This place is seriously awesome. A great place to come with your friends/family. It's a small intimate restaurant with amazing food. The prices are more than decent and the quality is more than you can ask for. It's also a fun to place to get your drink on with some liquor or sake bombs. Some people get fun and a little rowdy here and it fits the vibe.  Their happy hour is really enlightening, there's a bunch of items that are a steal for what you get. My favorites are the, katsu curry, truffle edamame and wings. So much more that I can't think of atm.  ALSO, when you get here you MUST try this layered white chocolate crepe cake. You will not regret it, this work of art is so delicious you will melt.

photos.caption: Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Layered white chocolate crepe cake!!!!

zp1e_Mn-i7BrZ5eP8f5uUg.text: Ambiance Izakaya Go is a very nice Japanese restaurant in the Chinatown in Las Vegas.  This has a traditional wood traditional Japanese restaurants have over in Japan.  It has a decent amount of seating.  Definitely get off the strip and try some of the items in Chinatown and others like Izakaya Go.   Food Pork belly  -Korean BBQ style salty and tender.  Scallop  -Pretty good.  Some crunchy outside and really have the scallop on the inside.  Lamb chop  -Super tender and fresh.  Chicken leg -I really like the sauce.  Tasted very smooth.  Egg mustard soup -Tastes like yolk that has not been cooked all the way.  Super tasty.   Beef tataki -Good smooth meat with a little kick with the flakes on top.   Tuna belly steak  -It was ok.  Has scaled skin at the bottom so make sure to cut the steak on top if one does not like the skin.  Grilled pork cheek -Salty with the green onions.  Very smooth and tasty.  Combination fried rice  -Really nice blend of rice with meats  Yakisoba  -Wet soba noodle dish. Not on a sizzling plate  Service I thought the customer service is very good.  The food came out in a timely manner.

qyrdDqvPCExazFFcdjGOAA.text: This place is awesome! Super nice staff and phenomenal food.   This will be my shortest Yelp review because I think we ordered almost everything on the menu and it was all good. No pictures attached because I was busy eating.  But beware of how much you order, $2 there, $6 here can add up fast. I dropped $500 with tip for a table of 4 but we were also drinking... a lot. No regrets, great experience, I'd happily drop that much here again!

2Kq6X3cX61qVjSdMr5KzqA.text: Happy hour at Izakaya Go is da bomb!  I wish I have access to a fun happy place like that.  Hubby and I wanted a place to chill out, grab a beer, and order some snacks.  So glad we picked Izakaya Go.  It was pretty packed, but thankfully we made a reservation and was seated immediately.  There were so many things we wanted to order, but with only the two of us, we had to control ourselves.  We love the idea of half portion ramen.  That's usually our dilemma... we wanted a bowl of ramen, but usually those are pretty big portions and you order one you are basically done for that meal.  So we opted for the half portion spicy tonkatsu, steamed clam in broth with sake, the takoyaki, uni over rice, a variety of skewers and a pitcher of beer to share.  Everything was delicious.  The service was fast and friendly, there is a wide variety of things to order, and the price is on point.  We walked out happy and stuffed.

photos.caption: Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Variety of skewers... wish we could eat more
Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Love bacon wrapped tomatoes
Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Variety of skewers

LgjsZNhpBBRWBR4hJhnUUA.text: Not too much to say other than I was not impressed.  In a city where ramen is so prevalent, you really need to step up your game. This restaurant was listed on top ramen houses of eater in vegas. I've tried many and this one was just not that good.  I went for their famous happy hour. The menu is limited and my server didn't really know enough to influence me. I explained it was my first time there. They do a happy hour half bowl of ramen, but it's also a half portion.   The flavors of my tonkotsu was off.  The chicken karaage was ok. The pork gyoza was so so as well.     I usually try a restaurant a second time, but here in vegas where there is such an abundance of pho, ramen, soba and more, I'm off to th next noodle shop.

1oj1KhfrPzxvpJDOsgRbeg.text: The best to go to place for me this side of town. Must try the Rock Oyster. Happy hour prices are so worth it. Come at 10pm to close.

photos.caption: Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Rock Oyster. The bomb

wuts9v_RqG7UUvk4ADKJyA.text: They have a pretty decent happy hour menu. Make sure to sign in when you arrive, we seen a few guest leave because they were waiting for awhile to be seated but was not told to sign in. . . . We ordered Curry w/rice and steak, Takoyaki, miso ramen, and shoyu ramen, all were flavorful. Music may be really loud so be prepared to limit your conversations unless you want everyone to hear lol. besides that service was great!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vEsSaSBF9mTGw-z_wj6NYw.text: I definitely came on an off night a few years ago and am embarrassed that I would give a review based off of one bad experience when the service was great.   I no longer live in Vegas but was visiting and came in with a group of friends.   Lucky for us, we made it for their happy hour which is 10 til close.   We ordered almost everything off the happy hour menu and wow.  I remembered thinking that the price points were good but the happy hour is definitely something to come in for.   The highlights were the salmon belly ($6)and the  uni bowl ($10) and the curry rice (base $11ish). The uni bowl was so good that we had to order a second.  Our party of four left stuffed with a bill of about $100. A steal for what we had.    Thanks for a great night.

YmEtEdhpgFu9E6sXFUqwbA.text: The foods and the experiences were so good I wanted to order the restaurant to go! I been wanting to check out this place for a long time, but was too lazy cuz they open late [yes, I'm a lazy butt even for foods]. However, I ran into Bryan or was it Brian  who is a server there at my work [in the mall] and the way he talked about the place totally motivated me to check it out without weeks. I was not disappointed. It's truly amazing and the foods were authentic. So many selections that I forgot how much I ordered and had to eat in tears at the end cuz I over ordered. The staffs were friendly and place is cozy. Now that I'm writing this, I need to go back for another meal!

photos.caption: Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Takoyaki
Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. From bottom to top; chicken gizzards, pork belly, and beef tongue
Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon avocado

5I_RWkU3f94t2OpNDZNzng.text: First time here and already im in love.. Awesome customer service and awesome food with awesome pricing..  its really hard to find a good Japanese restaurant with good price.. im happy most definitely going to come back..

Zlm_2jxcDyBNdWG0Bpid2Q.text: Super yummy! I love the whole design of the restaurant and the little details they put into the place.   Service was excellent. My server was patient, friendly and knew her food. The food choices we chose were delicious and flavorful as well.   The portions are more than your average Japanese tapas restaurant so me and my boyfriend were full and satisfied after ordering a few dishes.   I would love to come back and try their other menu items.

_Jb1jnJKM3tOIF5Z5qsslw.text: The Ramen Burger is great.  Menu is huge but the other stuff I had was just ok-good, nothing stood out.  It was also on the pricey side for relatively small portions.

DsOZokRTbiQ24Xc38NFv0A.text: Holy crap i found a new go to for japanese food. The chef/owner is awesome. He came to our table and personally took our order and helped us to make our choices. From the homemade soy sauce, to the crispy pork belly, the amazing chef's choice sashimi platter (including Toro!), Takoyaki cooked perfectly, Tempura squid legs, Nabeyaki Udon, and Zaru Soba. This is the best Japanese food you will find in Vegas. Don't  forget the chef and owner go to the fishmonger daily to hand select the fish!

0KIdIbFZ6Hf8Icl7NHuWEQ.text: By farrrrrr my favorite izakaya in Vegas.... Yet. Go during hh and you'll get some great deals on food and drinks. Uni sushi was always fresh when I went here so that's a must! I also love the fact that they had tako wasa. This place hits the spot when I have a craving for that. Otherwise... I have to give it up to Tajima in San Diego for the best tako wasa. Uni pasta was decent. Very filling! They give you good portions here. They have combo dinners that's always a good option if you want a bit of everything. They get pretty busy at night but if you're in a party of 2 the wait isn't that long at all. This place does accommodate large parties though so it's a good place to grab drinks with a group of friends. For the yakitori, I recommend getting beef tongue, bacon wrapped asparagus, and chicken heart! If you like foie gras you'll love chicken heart. Not sure if they have fatty chicken heart but for you foie gras lovers out there, get the fatty heart if they have it.

snqNH9OT3xteZNwKzOYKSA.text: Amazing amazing amazing! The jalepeno fried rice is a must! Yellowtail Jalepeno might be one of the best in Vegas.

TOrK3_3lpehQD7adCV9xdA.text: Went here for the first time the other night.  My first time being at an izakaya type place.  Everything was great.  Uni pasta was a great size for the price, and so good.  Also tried uni chawa something, a savory egg custard topped with uni.  Yes I love uni.  Tako wasa I think raw tako with a wasabi sauce excellent.  Takoyaki again awesome.  Maybe I should take pictures of these things.  I will be back for mote

S2ckTcKraFuKK2cZ7zQpyw.text: Great new spot to eat. The food was great, especially for just opening and changing things. The staff is very friendly and attentive. I met the owner on accident, and he is a very nice guy that started while still working full time. Great place to eat and support!! It will be fun to see it grow and progress.

cfCFl01XsQqaktEEUwWZpw.text: First time last night. I was craving for Japanese food, found this gem in Chinatown.  Great food and very friendly staff.  I drove by a few times last year and they were still closed. Finally opened last December. Will be back for more.

4v23UGseNzqsILlrAMqpfg.text: We've been coming here quite frequently and its always quite an experience every time!  The service of this food (not to also mention the food from Chef Andi) are amazing.  They're a super friendly bunch and always try to be accommodating to ur needs.  They're daily fishes are always great and the other foods, magnificent.  They have a pretty large menu so they can cater to a lot of different palates.  Make sure you call in to make a reservation because they can me slammed any any given time.  They're open late so early dinner or late night dining, they got it covered.  Don't even get me started on the sake selection, lets just say I haven't tasted one that I don't like.

IyRRS2eJcvBGpKQPhQHOCA.text: Wow and I mean wow. Various dishes made from scratch just as well as their very own soy sauce! I am greatly impressed and by all means you will be too! This small Japanese tapas restaurant is more than meets the eyes!! Thank you Go for the introduction! I'm huge on sake and love to marinate with a few dishes. I will be back regularly!

wniQRZXJX1e3NA-JcSTHVQ.text: This is an amazing place. 2 of us just wanted to stop by for a quick (and cheap) dinner and then go to the  bar....we've ended with $200. Just couldn't stop to taste everything in the menu. Food and service are outstanding.

-PLgtfbNo1gPaiqRAxNQNg.text: Went here after a Cirque show for a late bite and had a wonderful experience. Had the poke salad, rainbow roll, albacore roll and halibut roll. Food was fresh and delicious and staff are super friendly!

Ow34AUXZpJ-o5L4PIOIuVw.text: Legit izakaya! Everything was delicious and service was impeccable. Great new spot! Can't wait to go back when I'm visiting!

ADO9RI8pS_hAfJCDTQuWhw.text: I almost don't want to write a review, for fear that it will get super busy and then I won't be able to get a table! Haha! This place was GREAT! The owner/chef/manager blew us away with his friendly and attentive service. They had a surprising array of fresh fish flown in daily, some rare and tasty choices! Most amazing of all, is the price! It was VERY reasonable. Overall, it was great!

B1qymPITSphyuSFhMXcnFA.text: Love this place for late night sushi!  Great vibe!  The food is on point and very reasonably priced.  The staff attentive and friendly.  My go to!

ItlH6NWN2BWqecy4YBlfgw.text: We came here on a weeknight for dinner after my daughter's kumon hour. This place is nice and was not crowded on this night. The food was pretty good and service was efficient.  Forgot all the things we ordered but the Kara-age chicken stood out and was really good (well seasoned) as was the sashimi bowl (fresh), mixed tempura was also quite good but the vegetables needed more cooking time. We also ordered Yaki-soba but it was not cooked well either, the noodles kind of clumped together, not easily separated and we did not care for the sauce used.  Overall, not a bad place for food and drinks with an attentive wait staff.

ymGxGGRhZe0cvC-JRRri0Q.text: This is by far one of my fav Izagaya on my book, and i am from LA, i have tried many places .One of the reason is their menu is very unique,other than the usual stuff that everybody have, they have something unusal like sashimi halibut fin, stirfly gizzer with garic leek,and some fish intestines that i never eat before and many other dishes.You just have to try it yourself.They also have late happy hour from 9.00pm to 12.00, the drinks are very reasonable.Every time i come to LV i at least come to this place once.Hope you guys keep up.

Xh0-XNmaaCGhZs-7dC8BZw.text: Amazing food! We loved the service and the small plates. The squid ink rice was perfectly cooked and each grain was a burst of flavor.

JdBzHfamP2xdqEuPIIqazQ.text: My dad was trained to be a chef the old school way in Tokyo shortly after WW2, and I grew up eating his food so I know what I'm saying when I say that eating here is like actually eating in a legit Izakaya in Japan. You'd be surprised how many of places like these aren't actually run by Japanese people, and those that are try to be way too fancy and high end and charge an outrageous amount for the fish. This place is reasonably priced, and the menu reminds me of the days in Osaka drinking and eating and having a grand ol time with my cousins. The menu goes from sashimi to ramen to yakitori, but whatever you choose it's good ol fashioned Japanese food the way it was supposed to be made.

u8qWjp2r7i2K-neJ07CjZw.text: Went in here with my Son and had Sushi. When we got in we were seated right away. the place was busy but it seemed like a lot of people were just getting finished and new ones coming in.   We ordered and got our beer right away. the sushi came out quick to. Let me tell you this place has good sushi that tastes fresh. I get all my sushi with Soy paper so you can taste the fish and not how seaweed tastes. We got 3 rolls total and each one was different and great!   The price here is good for what you get. the service was good to! Way to go! All in all this is a really good place to stop for sushi! I would recommend this place to all the sushi lovers!!!

3w07glalmfjriVMPupVjhQ.text: This place was very good we loved it !! The best time to go is after 10 pm to get the great deals !

3bzO9g7ZsOZOZ2AA33lU6g.text: The ambiance is very traditional Japanese. The ikura and the salmon meat are very fresh. I am very particular with the taste of green tea ice cream if its too strong I don't like it but their matcha ice cream is really. Highly recommended for Japanese food. Will surely be back.

Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Izakaya menu

kR1cmOOY7Nfjy2NFCmYGzA.text: One of my go to spots when I'm in Vegas!  Great food and service but, there's a wait sometimes.  Happy hour is the best which starts at 10 PM to close.

PJcbHwu1sQ_SSomYhRd1AQ.text: Great food along with great service.  The place is a little tight but you won't be disappointed.  We will definitely go back.

XC7jJnyMOcnr2iu_h1BXSA.text: Good quality great prices and nice atmosphere. Reminds me a lot of places I have been in Japan, LA, and NYC.  Most recommendable off the the Strip and family friendly to boot!

ul25Gf0CGQ_olugxNV9AXg.text: Great food and Asahi beer (my fav). We ordered like 10 things and they were all good. Agedashi mochi and tonkatsu delicous. The crunchy sushi (shrimp tempura w tempura bits) yum!! Finished with black sesame mochi ice cream. Definitely going back.

--XoMpk8K7z_rfduT6sMVg.text: Come here for some good Izakaya! Favorites... soft shell crab, pork belly and agadashi tofu

olZXwvtuL9QRpu9aTU18ig.text: Was just craving some takoyaki and they were 6 pieces! And reasonable size. very good. Slow service... but the food was alright. Order from this piece of paper and they missed like 3 items XD that I had marked then charged it in the bill later. Then gave our takoyaki to some people who came in after us. Two tables near us got great service and got their food before us but they both came in after we were seated.

FPKvQ0hZIufvLXj8JZNygA.text: The only good part of the experience was the POKE BURRITO & the UNI PASTA. and the constant checking. Got seated at exactly 8:03pm and didnt get greeted by the server for at least 5 minutes -_- (yup! we had to wait 5 minutes to get asked what we want to drink) So upon ordering, since the place is new, the server wasnt really knowledgeable of the menu ..  dont get me wrong, SHE WAS SUPER NICE.    So our food took SOOOO LONG. we got 4 dishes and waited 40 minutes for everything to get delivered, in addition to that, one of the order was wrong..  (they had 6 tables) & the only good thing was that she frequently checked on us. Although when it was time for the check, we had to ask like 3 times for her to bring it.    Dont order the sashimi bowl. Im suspecting that was what made our stomachs hurt. We love japanese cuisine and we could tell by the first bite that the fish were not fresh at all.. this place need some work. OVERALL: food - 3 stars Service - 3 stars WAIT TIME - zero starsss !!

photos.caption: Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So Cute

twMcCb1wrYiEJnE4b9b0tg.text: This place food is really good. I can't say anything on the food quality and flavor. My friend recommend me here and I like the food. Only thing made me mad was when we asked for the bill, I checked it and I found 1 thing on the bill that I actually didn't order and they didn't bring it neither. If I didn't order but they brought it to me and I eat it, I will pay for it. But the pork cheek belly that was a mistakenly charged by the waitress. We told her about that, she tried to say what the food looked like and we ordered it. She even brought the food picture to try to refresh our mind. What a "kind" waitress! I think she think I am trying to lie on that $6.95 dish and take advantage from them. We even show the picture that she helped to take for us and all food dishes was on the table. She said that dish she brought to us before the picture. In the end she said " it's okay. I will take it off for your guys" which make me feel that she is okay to give us that dish for free. THANK YOU VERY MUCH!!!!!!!! I won't lie for a dish that I never order and never eat. And I won't lie for a $6.95 dish. She never said any single word of sorry to us. My night was totally ruin by her attitude. I will miss the food but will never go back. I still think she owe me a sorry!

XRw7JLQG6bqFAsJayLv22Q.text: I was in Vegas visiting and needed food after watching a late night show at UNLV (with cocktails).  I figured only ratchet places were open at midnight ish but heard about this place.  Glad I know about it!!  LOVE Izakaya Go.  This place has everything your Asian palate desires and it's open until 2am.  They have amazing happy hour deals, but I ordered mainly off the regular menu, so it's pretty affordable regardless.  How affordable, well less than 60 bucks fed 3 hungry people and we ordered a lot!  Ambiance and decor is modern Japanese. We had a cool table that is like a Japanese tea house.  Staff was friendly and on point with customer service.  I had yakitori (chicken hearts 4; okra 2; asparagus 2; pork belly), sauteed gizzards with stir fry vegetables, curry rice with chicken cutlet, sushi, AND kim Chee soup (and ice cream).  Everything tasted really good too.  They have a huge menu of exotic dishes, I can't wait to come back and try more (Uni pasta, sushi burrito, and more).

photos.caption: Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy Kim Chee beef tongue soup

uXVJutfVTP1iRz5rRLTXBw.text: This is an awesome Japanese spot for whatever it is that you're looking for. Authentic with a slight modern take, incorporating Italian flare (talk about that in a sec). Ramen, udon, sushi, or yakitori? They've got it all, and at very reasonable prices. Food taste fresh and decor adds a nice authentic ambiance. Music doesn't seem to fit the style but it's good music (reggae). I was actually drawn to this spot because of their sea urchin pasta dish, and wow, it was bomb. Creamy with a hint of the uni in each bite and a hint of saltiness from the shiso leaves and white sauce. The Alfredo pasta was on point. Can't wait to come back the next time we're in Vegas. Lastly, staff was super courteous and friendly. Home run stop to eat at.

wlL1pfpej2BNRAWSHzJqbw.text: We had beef teriyaki and tempura dinner plates and both were great. The previous reviews were spot on.

zIooSaxFjsh78zp1IEQlVw.text: Very friendly place with a simple twist on the decor. Food was great, with the right balance of flavors. Will diffently return.

yPWMNGg-oIaOodG8SBjoIA.text: Love this place! Their Happy hour menu is pretty good! Not very big, small and the service was great.  They have a Japanese style table where you take your shoes off and sit on the floor w a low table. It was pretty cool. They also have tables and a few booths. The booths only fit 4, the tables fit 4, unless you put them together. The food was great! The appetizers were very savoring and affordable. Their ramen is delicious...it's all about the broth! Would definitely come back!

xxHME0vg7WtbKcLtEj0XTg.text: One of our favorite restaurant in Las Vegas trip I recommend to book ahead since it's a small Place.

WWwPs09jrRr7f1Ak-ok3zQ.text: Ok. I gotta go back and eat more stuff, but I'm just reviewing the RAMEN BURGER for now.   I tried a ramen burger from L&L once back when I took a trip to Hawaii. I was so traumatized. It was so greasy.   So I was a little apprehensive of this one at first, but then I took a bite, and I lost my damn mind. At first in the photos I thought it was roast beef in it, so I was like "IDK if that'll be good. That doesn't sound good..."   Plot twist! It's pork. I wanna say pork belly. But it it was just so tender and ripped apart so easily in every bite.   The consistency of the ramen bun was perfect. Crispy on the outside for a nice crunch and then a perfect (not soggy) noodle on the inside.  I'd go back for this for sure, but also aiming to try that bomb looking uni pasta.

5Nj6vOj7_c_VZujzdGcYOg.text: Food was just ok - friendly staff, loud and drunk customers. Good atmosphere if that's your thing.

cqtmBIHLxiWE8jMzSNotjQ.text: Fantastic food! I'm visiting from Honolulu and found this fabulous izakaya... and I know good places in Honolulu, this is as good as it gets!  Better yet with the service!  A must go!

gBvjQAD6tFx78wNpNdhK7w.text: Honestly, this is our second time eating here this week and we dont regret it one bit. The restaurant itself is small but creates an intimate setting. The decor and ambience is very relaxed and the servers are very friendly and attentive, whether ir be busy or not. Food, on the other hand, is exceptional and the quality is amazing. Definitely recommend this place to anyone who enjoys eating Japanese food and sushi! Will be back and will be bringing family and friends from out of town here.

zbWeIsjib5ccPPVkPjKX-w.text: Best meal of our Vegas trip! Excellent service (we were served by Jao)! We will definitely come back the next time we are in town

QF3bJX-X0GTjJ8Tkd0HieQ.text: Hands down THE BEST Izakaya in Vegas. Every single dish is soooooo legit and good!!!!!

zv3_Fawj-oDxosg42d2M2w.text: This place rarely disappoints. My Tokyo-born cousin requested a visit after seeing my IG photos of food from Izakaya Go. She was happy with our meal. I'll be back!

KSrCdb9yo5mWaYuabhel_Q.text: Da Bomb on the GOGO!! With all the variety of selections here you can't go wrong. Great vibe, incredible grilled to perfection tapas, and some damn good house sake for a more than reasonable price. Try there miso ramen and hotpots if your looking for some warm me up soup. Never disappointed when I come here.

h-4VFwXJujcMiII4PLHLgQ.text: Kinda tucked away in the middle of Asian (Spring) Mountain area of Las Vegas. This place was definitely a gem !!  Parking is kinda limited, but was not to bad. I can imagine it being very crowded and hard to find parking during peak hours like lunch and dinner.   Also, there is not many seats, so waiting is inevitable. Lucky for us, we caught them on slow day during a weeknight and got seated right away.   Waitors running everywhere! its great that you can pull one of the waitors so that you can either order something, get more drinks, or simply asking a question.   Portions were pretty good being an Izakaya place. Becareful though because these dishes stacks up and before you know it, youre racking up a hefty bill.   Music was all over the place. From EDM to Hip Hop to Rock Classics! I didnt mind at all.   Simple guy like me, i really enjoyed the house salad. Simple cabbage and sesame ginger dressing. Great substitute for rice !!  Don't forget to check in on yelp and get your free ice cream !!   I recommend the uni pasta, soft shell crab, and of course the seasoned cabbage !!  Enjoy !

g98eM5Wg2AgLPw4_C1a4Wg.text: Awesome place with great service and to mention the food is soooooo good!  Will def recommend this place to any folks coming to Vegas!

QgdKtLr0rWd99glACCbB_A.text: Delicious late night and I'm sure delicious just as a normal meal. We just landed late night, ventured out here, and ordered a feast. The hand rolls were fresh, and the noodles were yummy. Izakaya was a bit Smokey but it wasn't terrible. Good specials and prices. Cute, casual ambiance.

kjb-Rv6qDQcCF1WZHSkpvA.text: Not a fan of raw sushi. Pointing that out now. Came here on a whim after babe and I found a restaurant.com certificate for $10 off. Wasn't too thrilled at the wait (about 30min), but for a small joint and absolutely no one in the mood to rush, I wasn't allowed to be too irritated. Servers checked on us constantly and updated us on times. Got seated in a cute booth that looked utterly uncomfortable, but funny enough, was the opposite. Our fat asses ordered a slew of plates: albacore roll (all his), crunchy roll, rice porridge, chicken teriyaki combo, and a ramen burger. I'm not sure I've ever had such flavorful chicken teri in my life, but this was a bomb in my mouth. The sauce in the ramen burger tied in how flavorful the meat was--which was a pleasant surprise considering my expectations of the thing were low. My only problem was one of our servers. He had a lack of energy when taking our orders and asking questions that it dented my experience. Never a fan of lazy service. The other servers were great and helpful so I s'pose it sort of made up for it. 4 stars to food. Definitely coming back when closer to happy hour.

Q3PiN-p7ZZ3r9iyjYB6Akw.text: This was a recommendation from a foodie friend and it was AMAZING! Great prices, great food and excellent customer service. Our server Bee was very friendly and recommended so many great menu items.   We ordered:  Braised Pork Belly 10/5 STARS!  YES that's right 10/5 stars! This was out of this world AMAZING!  Tender, juicy, full of flavor pork belly. YOU HAVE TO TRY IT AND FALL IN LOVE!   Miso Ramen 5/5 stars Broth was delicious, pork (the same one above) was sooooo YUMMY! Noodles were tender.   -Spicy Friend Rice w/ Jidori Chicken 4/5 stars It was very spicy. Full of flavor but the spicy got me..lol  House Fried Rice 3/5  The pork pieces we so yummy and tender but the rice itself was kinda bland.   -Pork Gyoza 4/5 stars steamed and pan fried well. full of flavor but the dipping sauce could've been better.   Fresh Oysters 4/5 stars I personally do not eat seafood. My boyfriend said 4/5 stars, the oysters were very fresh but the vinegar sauce inside of the shell was very over-powering to the flavor.    Pork Belly (on skewer) 5/5 It was crispy, full of flavor, and tender.   Karaage Fried Chicken 4/5  Crispy, very flavorful but there was a lot of fatty parts. The dipping sauce was very good.

Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Braised Pork Belly 10/5 STARS! This was out of this world AMAZING! Tender, juicy, full of flavor pork belly. MUST TRY &amp; FALL IN LOVE!
Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. House Fried Rice 3/5  The pork pieces we so yummy and tender but the rice itself was kinda bland.

n4GsWipXz5kRRtF8iOd8uw.text: Food-wise, this is a fantastic izakaya. The menu is full of interesting things I have never tried before, from the shark cartilage and yam to the uni chawanmushi. Yes, they were out of many things even on a Monday (which is when everyone here seems to recommend coming for maximum freshness/availability), but there were so many things to chose as back-ups that there was really no disappointment at all (except maybe missing out on the uni dumplings - we'll be back for that!). Be ready to make substitutions!  The drink menu and presentation was somewhat lacking for an izakaya. They have a decent sake selection with many unique sweet options, but no shochu and a rather lackluster beer/wine selection. I think based on other reviews and info online they may have a decent Japanese whisky selection, but it's not well presented/curated on the menu, so unless you're sitting at the bar, I guess you have to ask for more detail.   Minus another star for atmosphere and parking situation. I know, it's Vegas, whatever, but the staff didn't need to encourage the creepy misogynistic bachelor party going on at the table next to us by taking shots with them and obliging their requests to show them their tattoos, etc. There are plenty of more appropriate places for that stuff in this town. And then parking: despite the location in a rather ugly strip mall with what looks like it should be plentiful parking, we had to drive around the lot a few times to find a space, even on a weekday. When we finally got a space, we saw that all the spaces were marked as "80 minute" parking. Seriously? In a strip mall?! Plan ahead and arrive early!

photos.caption: Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8zSkTStrH86diDYiA2SpJg.text: this place is amazing, the quality fish they provide is over the top and they have amazing customer service. my server was Brian, and I asked his opinion on the catch of the day fish,l, he was very thorough in explainijng the differences and making a delicious suggestion. He also added that the fish bones could be fried after so that one could eat them; I thought about it for a second as weird but I decided to try it before I made a decision not to like it, and it was amazing! thanks guys for the wonderful food and service.

photos.caption: Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. the fried fish, again AMAZING!! and all edible.
Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. a little bit of everything. all amazing. even the shitake mushrooms.

wL03np5O7xKWIybuGcBvtw.text: Came here for happy hour cause we were wanting hot sake! Definitely recommend coming here for happy hour because the sake is good and prices are affordable. We didn't try any food here because we had dinner before we came here. We mostly wanted to drink but I would definitely come back here to try the small dishes and food. It looked good. It's a cute small spot too. It's cozy inside.

VSbEoijczwreOgv9UjBXVA.text: Had to peep this spot out, excellent experience.  Fairly small spot but the menu is authentic and on point!  So much selection of lots of good, old fashion True   (Izakaya) style drinks and food.  Definitely will be back and highly recommended to Japanese bar food lovers!

Xc0-YOv6eT__Ho81ZPaI6w.text: Here for a late dinner. Service very fast. Food very authentic and tastes good. Price reasonable for this kind of restaurant. Order a variety of different things. Heaven: pork belly! That's why some people ordered just pork belly I guess... Good: Ginara (miso cod), beef tongue, miso ramen (not spicy), salmon sashimi OK: takoyaki, chicken heart, chicken gizzard, chicken with scallion Don't like: spicy chicken wing (don't like the gross Korean like sauce layer), scallop (don't like the taste of the rim, it's like you are eating the wrong part...) Definitely try the pork belly and beef tongue! They were great!

JvflR1jTNZMCJR7y3f2TdA.text: Came here for dinner while was in Vegas!  I ordered salmon with rice and a salmon roll. The rice bowl was definitely not good. I didn't enjoy it at all because the salmon was waaaay too salty. I didn't expect it to be so salty and I couldn't even finish the bowl.   Service: the service was great. I didn't expect them to give me anything when I told them I couldn't finish my food since the salmon was too salty. They gave me extra sashimi on the side as complimentary.   Overall, it was a great experience since the service was great, but the food didn't hit the spot.

hfTGy8YzSNOef2wce1Pd2Q.text: Whenever we are in Vegas for work, we prefer to go off the strip for food.  Food tends to be better (not as fufu) and much better priced.  We love going to Raku, but wanted to try something different so decided on Izakaya Go.  They have a cool homey hipster type vibe.  They have bar seating with alcohol bottles all lined up against the bar, and they even have one long table in the middle where you take off your shoes (True Japanese style!).  They have a very extensive menu so it was a bit overwhelming trying to decide what we were going to order, but we settled for the following:  Yakitori - Beef Tongue/Scallop/Asparagus With Bacon/Chicken Breast with Wasabi/Chicken Meat Ball - My favorite out of these were the scallops, the beef tongue and the meat balls.  Yamasen - Good but forgettable  Hamachi Kama - Fish was soft and delicious  Chawan Mushi - Light and yummy  Yakinasu - I'm not a huge fan of eggplant so I didn't particularly like this dish, but my friend enjoyed it.  Grilled Mochi with Cod Roe Cheese - Must get.  Never had any dish like this.  Sounds weird but it was quite addictive.  Squid Garlic Fried Rice - Really good.  Felt like it was slightly missing something but can't quite put my finger on it.  I feel like we had more food, but I can't seem to remember everything right now. Overall the food was delicious and better than most things on the strip.  All the food plus a small bottle of sake only came out to $95 before tip.

photos.caption: Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hxy7VuKJwurZLTbPqQAjGw.text: Simple, delicious, and friendly restaurant. The ramen was just right and light enough (not so heavy with fattiness in broth). The sushi was simple but tasty. The wasabi that went with the sashimi was exceptionally spicy.

They turn off all the restaurant lights if its your birthday to sing to you happy birthday and play a bday song on loud speaker! Its so cool!

They have the best miso salmon bowl i have ever had in my life! Hands down a must order! Their poke is fresh , the jalapeno poppers are mouth drooling. And honestly i forgot a few names of the stuff i ordered but i saved the pictures to order it again next time i am in town.

Yq_Wt5tCxqJDqYYemF_9Vg.text: Came here because of a Restaurant.com deal because I didn't want to eat at the standard touristy joints on the strip since we were going to be here for just 2 days. I am glad we made it here. The service was very friendly and very fast. The food was very authentic and at a very reasonable price, even without the Restaurant.com deal. I would gladly come back here on my next trip into town.

Ke3-yCjYW6rntwxYuYwizw.text: Quite possibly the best sushi experience of my life. The grilled shishito peppers were the best I've ever eaten, then the fresh halibut roll made me literally groan in ecstasy. We moved on to the grilled scallop skewers, the tuna belly skewer, and drank unfiltered, cold sake. Heaven! The coup de gras ... We met Go, the proprietor. Wow. Just wow. He personally visits the fish market every day and suggested the snapper sashimi (perfection) and house made soy sauce. We will be back. Go ... You are The Man!!

k453-V9zoFtKFeso79UciQ.text: Food was delicious! Every dish we ordered was enjoyed! I especially liked their agedashi tofu. Crunchy on the outside and super soft on the inside. Every dish was served piping hot to us and food promptly came out. We did arrive early for dinner so got nice attentive service from the wait staff and the fellow who was possibly the manager. It's a small restaurant so may not be good for really big groups. Will be back again when we visit Las Vegas next time...

5bA-hDQtdBVlXSXh2-B3tg.text: Great service, great food. Music was interesting, but good atmosphere. Really glad we found this spot. Had the California and Philadelphia rolls both were good and the miso soup was delicious, I've missed good miso soup.

d1gsGNh2Uk4oVRkx1QpIYQ.text: The Service and food was great, and everything came out in a timely manner.   Great experience all around.  Had the pleasure of sharing the following with one of my favorite people;  Fresh Halibut Roll  Steamed Clams in Sake Tuna Belly Grilled Forgot the Name but Dish that had crispy pork belly (thin) and beansprouts/cabbage  All were great don't get me wrong,but If i had to choose one, it would be the tuna belly. my date liked the crispy pork belly dish w/veggies. Ill be back for something different!

_8M6E6Lt-haJauBQdSCqBQ.text: Great food - ramen and various Yaki (grilled) dishes!! Service was great. Felt like we were back in Japan.

RlXXWM38LKgNnXT7-2rNVg.text: The food I ordered was mediocre! Beef tongue was chewy. Kawanmuchi was pretty good though. The food took a while to bring out to our table! Some of the servers was very nice but some  wasn't! I won't be back. I will stay at all favorite next time on our visit!

CaZ_vyoGnkN1EthaOoPMCQ.text: This place is so good, worth every penny! The service and food is on point! One of the best Japanese food I've had since moving here from Hawaii!

4Vy0upxoXGtzehi5u4Nz9A.text: Absolutely love the curried rice and tonkatsu udon, as well as the service and atmosphere of the restaurant. 5/5 would come here agian!

1_Uw2MM8Kenffaz6Bz-XHw.text: I love this place! It was located right next to our house in Las Vegas and we liked to go there after 10pm- it's a happy hour!!! Even without it it's very good price for this quality, food is very good and fresh!

LkHp70CJA0MixzYCVAPDfg.text: I love this restaurant!!!! Great prices, awesome food and the staff is wonderful. Open 24 hours with fresh food always available. Definitely a 'must try' in Vegas!!!!

5Wam6MGVeMN5MZHcRmIrrg.text: Some of the best food I've had ever.  Great experience to boot.  I tried things I've never had before.  It's a daring street food inspired restaurant with excellent cuts of fresh fish.  Couple that with laid back music; reggae when I was there and you need go nowhere else.

tYMGMoZ5uM0o0kaPAa_xDw.text: We decided to try something off the strip and we were pleasantly surprised that this place exceeded our expectations!  No big name chef here and totally not needed!  The chefs here really know their ingredients and were able to create incredible, flavorful dishes! The waitstaff were beyond attentive and can recommend dishes based on what you like, don't like, or are craving.  We ordered 6+ dishes and enjoyed every bite of them.  The chefs make everything to order so it may take 5min longer than at a fast food joint but take a swig of one of their many imported alcoholic beverages and enjoy the eclectic music they play on the speakers!   I highly recommend coming here and it seems like the locals do too.  We will definitely be coming back for more next time we're in Vegas!    And...the bathrooms were clean too!

dtXVHnFZ2JkjeIr_VlBL3A.text: We are all so picky living in this town where the restaurants have to be on cutting edge for us to appreciate them. Well - this place is such a pleasant surprise!! The vegetables hat are part of every dish we ordered were cooked to perfection, seasoned perfectly, the fish was fresh and the rolls were different, creative, spiced and prepared perfectly. Nice job - my family of foodies was impressed. Can't wait to go back!

n0ISwFj5vVEBfjOmYB6d5Q.text: Excellent sushi! The rock shrimp with chili sauce was yummy too. Nice place off the strip.

JjOzYvCUM0hk1XKg-oPZhA.text: I'm not really a foodie, but had to write a review bc the food here is delicious.  We went starving after attending CES and ordered a ton of food.  Despite ordering many dishes, our bill was surprisingly cheap.   The house fried rice is amazing and the Bbq Korean ribs with greens was flavorful and seasoned just right.  Like I said, I'm not really a foodie but it was so good I'll be coming back to try the ramen burger before this Vegas trip is over. Service is excellent!

oz3kjeb82dqMEWK00KzYPA.text: I came here with a party of 16 during happy hour and the service was wonderful. I love the atmosphere here--Japanese with reggae vibes. It definitely brought me back to Okinawa. The food was also great. Everything was perfectly portioned, reasonably priced, and delicious. My boyfriend and I ordered Japanese curry with braised pork belly, salmon flake onigiri, spicy salmon cutroll, and tuna belly steak. Everything was so good. Between the two of us, there was a lot of food to keep us full and satisfied, all for $27 (happy hour prices)! I also tried a bite of my friend's okonomiyaki, and it was amazing! If you check in on Yelp, you get a free scoop of ice cream. I got the green tea ice cream and I loved it. It was probably the best green tea ice cream I've had in a long time. Overall, I really enjoyed my experience here. I will definitely be back in the future. Thanks Izakaya Go!

X-Kxpo4I4N4xAKFs0bgELw.text: Great service! Delicious ramen, we all got shio ramen, shoyu ramen, and miso ramen! I like that they offer free ice cream to everyone! Lovely little place overall, would definitely come back!

QmC8I0xRxVO7lVOsNiRiKQ.text: Place is nice and clean. The service was kind of slow. As for the food the fish was fresh but the best bang for your buck is the bento box. I ordered the teriyaki chicken and there was a lot of food! I would go back and try other things on the menu.

vJivr0A1MYSxVJag8l5lIA.text: The waiting time for this place wasn't great but wasn't bad either. Food was okay, and the waiter was kinda quiet. Kinda got a hippy vibe from the music. Overall pretty cool.

s4lRVoiWiT2cXzqiERGsvg.text: Excellent food and I never comment on service, but all the servers were not just experienced and attentive, but genuinely friendly.   The tonkatsu ramen is a MUST. I rarely order ramen outside of a ramen restaurant, but this was labeled as a "staff favorite" and it was SOOO good. Good even compared to LA ramen.   Their happy hours specials are great as well.  We ordered several cut rolls, a hand roll, skewers and the ramen. Left stuffed. Will definitely return again when in Vegas.

oR9aSSxGWyvtANKySUEIMg.text: I always enjoy coming here. The service is good, they have all sorts of options, and happy hour is every night. I usually go for the combination dinners with an order of sashimi. Those never disappoint. On this recent visit, I decided to try my first ramen burger. I was looking forward to the runny yolk but my egg ended up being fully cooked, bummer! The ramen part was too bland, however, the filling was delicious and flavorful. In conclusion, ramen burgers aren't for me. I just don't want none unless you got buns hun! I'll be back though.

photos.caption: Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ramen burger

xY-e47_tjZQ2vkYegXPPUw.text: After seeing many delicious pictures and hearing great things about this place from my friends, a group of us decided to try it. When we entered, we were immediately greeted by one of the staff members and quickly gave us a table. I love the decor and the atmosphere of this place, a traditional feel as you might say. The restaurant is a little small so it packs up pretty quickly as well.   What we ordered :  My group of friends and I always have to order a hot sake after a long day. So we ordered the house hot sake. It was stronger than usual, but that's always good! Haha. Ended up ordering two large ones. We always say that hot sake is a warm hug to your body.   Spicy tuna crunch was really, really, really good. I'm a sucker for crispy rice with tuna. The spicy sauce on it enhanced the flavor a lot more. The tuna and crispy rice ratio, very good.   The chicken karaage with mayo sauce was pretty good. Boneless and crisp to perfection. Very good  with the mayo sauce and squeezed lemon on the chicken.   The oysters were full of flavor. The sauce they put on the oysters completely blended well together. Only thing I didn't like about it was the oysters were a little too small for the price we paid for.   Ahi poke rice bowl was ordered by one of my friends. The rice bowl was a decent size. It could definitely fill you up. A good amount of poke in the bowl as well. The poke was completely fresh. Definitely melts in your mouth. Also comes with a side of tasty miso soup!   Super go crunch burrito was AMAZING. Consisted of imitation crab, shrimp tempura, and a few greens with avocado wrapped in seaweed goodness.  The portion of this is no larger than a chipotle burrito, but bigger than Taco Bell burrito as the waitress described it which was True lol.   Ramen burger was good too. Wanted to try it because there are barely any places that serve ramen burgers. Another reason why I wanted to try this place out. It was VERY filling due to the ramen noodles on top of it. The meat was very juicy and tender, full of flavor. To top it all off, the over easy egg with it. Just the yolk dripping down the burger.. Yolkgasm for real! The ramen noodles also had some sort of flavor to it too. So delicious. It also comes with a side of seasoned fries.   My overall experience with this restaurant? Definitely one of my favorite spots. A lot of variety and choices to choose from their menu. The service was vey good. They were very patient and helpful with our food order since there were so many to choose from! Will DEFINITELY come back to this place to try a lot more! Thank you izakaya go staff for the wonderful first experience!

W8X3_0MgEB64TaHxnyrV-w.text: I've been going to Izakaya Go since July 2015. My co-workers introduced me to this restaurant and it's by far my favorite place at the moment. Their food is always delicious and on point. Service is impeccable, and the owner is very nice. I love the interior because it's really cultural and authentic. They play Hawaiian music as well which is nice and soothing.    SERVICE Mr. Go (the owner) is always working when I visit and he's very nice and funny. Also the other employees are very friendly and attentive of a customer's need. If you ask your server about an item on the menu, they are very knowledgable about the dishes offered.   FOOD I have tried multiple dishes here, and each one I have tried are delicious. My favorite combo right now is the ten zaru udon (cold udon w/ dipping sauce & side of tempura) and chawan mushi (egg custard w/vegetables). If I'm in the mood I'll order a beef tongue yakitori (skewers). Unfortunately I did not start reviewing earlier and I couldn't take pictures of all the items I have tried. So far I have ordered: Deep fried corn flake halibut with homemade tarter sauce, Manila calm with sesame chili oil, Corn crime croquette, Spicy stir fried pork kimchi w/ pouched jidori egg, Half curry soba chicken, Chicken zosui, Deep fried baby octopus, Salmon flake onigiri, Salmon onigiri, Spicy cod roe onigiri, Truffle edamame, Seasoned French fries, California poki roll, Sushi Burrito super go crunch, Miso marinated salmon bowl. I have enjoyed every single item I have ordered.   TIP If you check in on Facebook and Yelp (I think) you get a complimentary ice cream.   CONCLUSION I will for sure be visiting again. Good authentic Japanese food, amazing service and great atmosphere.

jw4xzpBKg_YjD_Yj24Y9Ug.text: Delicious, everything is good.  I've been back over 20 times and yet, I've only ordered from a third of the menu, it's that good.  And I've actually ordered that much is because the owner and waitress actually pushed me to try new stuff.  When the food is so consistent that you do not want to "experiment", we have all been to those restaurants.  This isn't one of those.    Actually, one little caution, ramen is ok, there are specialty shops in town if you are into ramen.  Then again, I don't have to tell you not to go to an izakaya and order ramen.  That's like going to a Pho place and order rice.  Go with their specialties, izakaya, grilled, fried little dishes.

4xs5Y2dUpYFsbSIJQO-kdg.text: Very good and fresh fish, must order - special while fish. They will deep fry the bone after you finish the sashimi. Yakitori is great too. Chicken gizzard, chicken soft bone etc

uoSstgFDKjM6gtOnW_s4dA.text: The place closes at 3:00 am one of the best things to have in Vegas.  Our friend recommended this place to us her cousin is the owner.  It was a good recommendation since we were able to get there around 12:00 am.  The place was pretty busy considering how late it was.  I was surprised to find a happy hour menu.  We ordered from the happy hour menu.  There was three of us and we only spent 50.00.  We got s special hamburger steak Japanese style.  It was beef and pork patty it was thick about an inch and very juicy.  It looked like a loco moco but the gravy was different it tasted like they put Worcester sauce in it not the brown gravy that you get in Hawaii. It was not served with rice just carrots and potatoes.  This is yummy yum yum!  The spicy tuna rolls were yummy yum it didn't look like tuna color more like salmon but it was delicious. We also got the poke California rolls.  Then we also got the curry with pork tonkatsu, this was yummy.    We got the fried tofu and it was not as crispy as I had before but the taste was sweet and savory.  They put a lot of seaweed shavings and it was what made it delicious.    We got the pork ramen with miso soup.  It was not too spicy as requests.  The noodles were pretty chewy.  The soup had a taste of sake or something like that.  I didn't like it as much since I don't like alcohol.   The service was pretty good and they turn the lights for if you are celebrating a birthday.  They play a happy birthday song.  Reminded me of days when we w.rook our kids to Farrell ice cream.

WCa_JzDebobAGShvAyjovQ.text: A great selection of menu including home cooking style of food which was the best part of this place. Very tight seating and little hot there. Food tasted average.

4M1iCqCH3zX4iCBlzbWLxA.text: Very very good ramen. Probably top three I ever had. Rich broth. Not too salty. Well priced too.

GfmkCfUfBJZsWqTQPOdNoQ.text: Izakaya is a type of what Japanese would call bar food. It's the type of stuff you would eat with beer or drinking in general with friends. But they have more than just your typical Japanese bar food. They have full on entrees and other foods you can go for, but that's not what the purpose of my visit was.   Depending on what you get, it can start to add up. I think our bill between two people was around $90 hahaha but we also got some of the more expensive stuff on the menu though.   We got a bunch of stuff off the yakitori menu.....like one of each at least if not two. They were all pretty good, nothing too special to note, just really get what you like. This is where the price starts to add up, it gets pretty expensive when each skewer is around $2-$3 and they're not filling on their own.   We also got the delicacy sashimi plate which consisted of sea squirt ovary, wasabi herring roe, and salmon kidney. We were told to eat it in that order. All I can say is the experience was interesting and I'd do it again. It's one of those things you should try at least once in your life.   You can usually tell how good a place is by their karaage. Theirs was decent at best, I didn't really expect much but most places offer ketchup with it and instead they offered mayonnaise. Just note that Japanese ketchup and mayonnaise are totally different in flavor from American ones.   Overall it was a good place. I'll definitely look forward to the next time I go and try other stuff off their menu.

jC4CQ5hLhGKKkQGg55bC-g.text: Love this place. I stop her every time I am in vegas. The food fair is awesome as the owner. I've been to dozens of izakayas in the US and this is the closest that it comes to the real deal...even the unfortunate, "we are out of that..."

VXLUpv7rQILtBUOkeqb6ng.text: After so many visits, I can finally say that this is my favorite restaurant. I have introduced so many of my friends to this restaurant and most of them love it too! Since they are open so late, I always come here during their Happy Hour times which is 10pm-close (2am or 3am depending on the day). I always either order their half ramen shoyu or half curry udon with chicken. They are so delicious!! They also have another menu for skewers and I never miss the opportunity to order some beef tongue, it comes with a lemon to pour on your beef tongue and it's so good and chewy. Their California poki half roll is very delicious too, I occasionally order this when I'm craving some sushi.  When I'm not ordering from the Happy Hour menu, I either buy the tori udon or one of their combination dinner plates. The combinations are so fulfilling because it comes with so many dishes! My favorite side dish from the dinner plates is the cold tofu they provide.   The workers are super friendly and helpful but sometimes it takes a very long time for them to notice me calling for them and getting the check takes some time too.  Food: 5/5 Service: 4/5  Interior: 5/5

Xu90WRYBPVh_ZOsOOpFdBg.text: went there on a Saturday night was very busy but the service was on point. Food was awesome I love the salmon carpaccio.

O1i16AWr9sfQrBQvvd0rrw.text: I don't really understand how this place has 4.5 stars..I've been to many izakaya places especially since I am from LA area & been to most of the famous places around LA & I love good sushi, japanese tapas & ramen!...basically this place is NOT WORTH the money & the wait!!  Don't b fooled by the ratings..I called to 2 make reservation & they said since I was on my way I didn't need 2 since max wait time was 30 mins...waited an hour...ordered food & the waitress came back & said 2 out 3 items we ordered were not available...don't even think 2 order any chicken dishes since none are avail...just filled up my stomach w/beer & fried rice which I could have ordered at the Chinese restaurant next door for better taste & price!!!  Don't waste your money & time...I should know since I am asian..

Kmoh9oLqn_pcnYi4W8cDvw.text: This place is awesome. Their seating is pretty unique as well. Along one side of the restaurant, there is a line of wooden booths with separate seat cushions that you can sit on. And there are two larger wooden seating areas in the middle of the restaurant, where you are able to take off your shoes to enjoy your meal. We ordered the assorted sashimi platter, the teriyaki dinner combo and the ramen burger. The ramen burger took a while to come out, but they did let us know before we ordered. BTW THE RAMEN BURGER IS BOMB. I ate it with my hands as if it was a "burger" lol because I wasn't sure how to eat it. As I was eating, the juices from the burger kept dripping down my arm. Nonetheless, it was DELISH. RAMEN BURGER 10/10 RECOMMEND. All in all, it was a nice experience eating at this restaurant. Would come again.

The service, vibe and homey local feeling really makes you feel right at home. My girlfriend and I had the pleasure of being served by GO. You can ask him any questions you want and he will answer. Sj0AUwWzmPxxyoT1S6-7Lg.text: First time tonite-sooo many good things to choose from-three menus, incl. a fresh catch of the day menu for whole fish, a great list of management's favs, offerings incl. sashimi and sushi, poke bowls, tons of delicious sounding Asian-fusion type tapas, udon, ramen, salads...too many things to mention. You'd think with such an extensive menu food would be mediocre, as how can one do so many dishes well? Well they do! We selected several items which were so good-crispy pork belly-yum!, salmon Kama-moist , otoro sashimi with fresh wasabi, house fried rice, crispy rice spicy tuna w/avocado, fried soft shell shrimp-light and airy-all dishes were fresh, generous portion sizes, attractively presented.  It was a very busy Monday night but staff was super friendly and attentive which made the experience complete-we can't wait to come back and try more of the menu. A new favorite spot for us.

mUdk5UxFmPvIW1pVIrl2yg.text: Yay! I think I found another decent spot.  Open late, good food, happy hour, good & quick service all in one.   The only downfall is that I wish it was closer to my house.  I came in for a quick late nite bite after my 12 hour shift and 4 hour ER visit.  I was hungry and tired and had no room for patience.   Izakaya satisfied my hunger and made my night. I was seated as I walked in. The waiter, Travis, was very accommodating to my needs. I ordered the shoyu ramen and spicy tuna. Ramen came out in 5 mins. Spicy tuna came in 10mins.  Thank you Izakaya!!

L-SDPftGl3XrhLfKfp4Mfw.text: I had such a great experience at Izakaya Go. The menu was great especially they're happy hour which is from 10pm to closing! I had the Nebayaki Udon and my boyfriend had the half Shoyu Ramen spicy. They had amazing flavors!  From the happy hour menu we had the spicy tuna roll, fish and chips, and the half Shoyu ramen! We also had the chicken skewer, shitake skewer, poached egg, and bacon wrapped quail egg! Everything was amazingly delicious.  And also with a check in you get a free ice cream. Your choice of matcha or vanilla ( both are very tasty and refreshing!)  Shout out to Travis our waiter. He was very kind and helpful since it was mine and my boyfriends first time here. He was also very speedy and came to check on us and refill our waters without even asking!  Fell in love with place just after the first tapas! We can't wait to come back already and eat some more off of this tasty menu!

photos.caption: Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great time at Izakaya go. Loved the service, atmosphere, but most of all the food! First time here, but definitely not the last!

m9EZf7VkFihyLlCl18pqFw.text: Very casual Japanese spot to bring friends and family to go eat and drink. Staff is super friendly and the service is pretty good.  It's yakitori so tons of options to try and they're mostly pretty good. Their unique dish is their uni pasta. It's savory, slightly sweet and gorgeous. Have. to. try.   Love coming to this place late night to drink and chat and catch up. Keep your friends' sake cups full!

CpbBz9RQ3DIRBAa-H6Jakg.text: Food was good but the service was horrible. It took almost an hour to get our food. I asked our waitress for the check and never saw her again. I had to ask another waiter and he got me the check. Not sure the food out weighs the bad service.

lxX61Ay4tkIVHG9XSPMZ_g.text: Great value! Coming from the Bay Area, we expected to pay $12-$14 for one bowl of ramen, but the ramen options don't exceed $9 here!   In fact, everything here is quite decently priced, especially for the great quality of the food.  We started off with drinks--my friend ordered a glass of draft Sapporo, and I ordered a two-shot chuhai cocktail...and mine was only $6!!  Next we decided to try an appetizer we've never had before, and the first of those on the list was the Yamasen. The server asked us if we were sure we wanted it, and at first we were a little insulted because we thought it was just because we are white.  Turns out that yamasen is...unique. If you've never had it before, it's basically shreds of yam and nori in this cold, salty, thick, mucous-y liquid. I don't know the technical terms, but if that doesn't sound appealing to you, do NOT order it. I could only have a few bites, but my friend liked it so she drank the rest.  My friend ordered the spicy shoyu ramen, and I ordered the miso ramen with less spice. All of their ramen options offer custom spice levels, so that's a bonus for both those who like it extra hot, and those who do not! The miso broth was rich and tasty, the egg was cooked the way I like, but I wish the noodles were thicker. Overall, a great bowl of ramen. My friend loved hers, too.  I hope I have the chance to come back here in the future, and if I do, I want to try the other items! Ramen is great, but I feel like we missed out on a lot of their signature items.

photos.caption: Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yamasen
Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Less spicy miso ramen
Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy shoyu ramen

AAekcCgdARIe-As4oUuKfA.text: So i relied on a friend of mine to pick out a good place for dinner when we were in Vegas, and he chose this place. After asking him why, his reply was simply, "I dunno they were the highest rated Izakaya on Yelp in Vegas."  So it's great that Yelp was around and he did some homework. The reviews don't lie, Izakaya Go was pretty good for an Izakaya in Vegas. They have a wide assortment of dishes including deep fried goodies, Yakitori, steamed, grilled and raw. The drink selection is also pretty large. Don't be surprised if you take awhile to order or keep ordering things you just discovered on the menu. Go with the sushi and Yakitori morsels!

h29ZsmCHhMCB-gI3WMoWbQ.text: Food was delicious and service was excellent tonight (granted we got here at 1130pm). Still a 15 minutes wait but not too bad.  Even though they kinda forgot a few of our dishes til I mentioned it, the food taste and quality and nice servers made up for it.

Umns7PNWCIeid77ORH-FAg.text: Always and Forever! One of my favorite restaurant in Las Vegas for over 4 years. It's an authentic Japanese tapas, awesome service, delicious food with reasonable price and large selection to choose. The place gives out that vibe that everyone would like to be in when they want to dine in and hung out. Be back again and again!  Note: The owner just opened new tapas "Takopa" in China Town, can't wait to go!
