slLsE_Q5COiwEDZ2CbJMsg.text: I got food poisoning from one of the foods, not sure which one, but that's okay. I understand it happens, so no worries there. Could be a one-off thing, so don't let that keep you from visiting at least once here.  The vibe is cool, a little bit more of an open space restaurant feeling than a tight-knit/loud Izakaya you would find overseas.   The food is great for bar food and the variety is awesome. Tried a lot of dishes, nothing were standout spectacular, but all of them tasted great. So thumbs up on that. I don't think you'll find anything you dislike here, so don't hesitate to pick out something. Will say that the sushi style dishes smelled a little less fresh than everything else, but that's about it.  The thing that's a little off-putting is the service. Took an hour or more to get seated, took 20 minutes before a server even talked to us. We had to yell out to servers for them to actually look at us when ordering and even then they all looked annoyed. They forgot at least half of our order and we would have to continuously ask them about where the food was for over another hour.   Your most attentive staff member is Travis, he was the only one that helped us the whole night. The rest of the staff looked visibly pissed off or they were too busy talking to their friends next door from other shops. I mean, we get it, it's work, but at least take our order?

4sRZlhvRLBiw_NF1-cMsQw.text: Very very fun and unique menu of items. Spivey Edamame is highly recommended-as well as the seaweed  salad. Great Robota options and loved the Poke. Service was very attentive as well. Good value for the price !!!

2vAgMZ6KkhuLS-706lR4mQ.text: This place is super good! It was very clean and service was very fast. One the wait for the food wasn't long at all. It was about righting time for the good food. Oh my god, the food was amazing!!!! Like the sushi my brother and i got tasted good and everyone enjoyed each other's food. I'll be coming back the next time i'm in vegas

Xl_6db4RxJV654lxt93tag.text: Stood and waited 5 minutes for a table and none of the hosts/waitresses acknowledged me. There was at least 3/4 waitresses that saw me and not a single one tried to seat or assist me.

EGYG6J3MkremU-U7FMYtiQ.text: Amazing selection of tapas , soups & entrees!  The authenticity is definitely comparable to being in Japan.  I'm happy to stumble into this spot!   The place is intimate, bathroom is clean and the service is efficient !

hPKCkcvh-vAndlQ4xMcU9g.text: Solid value, chicken cartilage and meatball were both tender.  I also ordered their half bowl of spicy ramen and it was excellent.  The service was on top of everything and were very friendly.    I only ate some of their selection due to it being a late night meal, but I can definitely see the quality here.  I would recommend coming here, esp for their happy hour menu.

0HzxgPmAsxLueRzD2jkk4A.text: Finally reviewing this place after a handful of visits! Izakaya Go has become one of our go-tos for late night eats!  Two words : Japanese Tapas! I absolutely love small plates because you get to try many different things on the menu without being fully committed to a full, big dish!   Pretty reasonable prices for items. Some dishes, I'll admit, are pretty pricey, buuuut that's what Happy Hour is for!  Dishes are cooked right, seasoned right, and freshness is there! I've tried a lot of things on the menu, some which have me coming back for more : *Ramen Burger with Seasoned Fries *Crispy Pork Belly *Kimchi Pork Belly with Poached Egg *Truffle Buttered Corn *Truffle Edamame *Chicken Potstickers *Go Crunch Sushi Burrito *Scallop *Chicken Karaage *Scallop Carpaccio *Shio Ramen (Half Order is the perfect size for me!) *Miso Eggplant *Yakisoba *Curry Soba *Asparagus Bacon Skewer *Grilled Zucchini Skewer *Pork Belly Skewer Desserts : *Yuzu Cheesecake *Green Tea Pancake Sandwich Drinks : *Echigo Beer - Japanese Rice Beer *Spiked Calpico *Ikezo - Jelly Sparkling Sake *Kikusui Junmai Ginjo - Cold Sake (best one I've had so far!) - $20 *Orion *Strawberry Nigori - Creamy Sake   Few of my favorites from the list above would be crispy pork belly, skewers, truffled corn, yakisoba, curry soba, and ramen burger.. AND all of the above for the drinks! :P  Service is always on point for us and the staff are always friendly and attentive! I've yet to try the items on their regular menu, which means I don't have plans on stopping to eat at this place. We seriously might even be there tonight! Lol :D

photos.caption: Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BIG ass Oyster!
Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Meatball Skewers!
Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Unagi Bowl! Warning - hella rice!

4CDZgwmQvg8VLZ5s5pqv8g.text: What can I say about Izakaya Go?   First off, Go is amazing! He's always playing some Rastafarian music and yet, it feels really authentic in there. Go is seriously one of those owners you just have to appreciate. He works hard as an owner and as a server, etc. I've been here so many times, its ridiculous why I haven't checked in every time on here. At one point I made it to go here every week. Hell, sometimes when I leave and they greet you "goodbye" I yell back "I'll see you guys tomorrow!" And to no surprise, I do come in again the next couple days. HAH! I've told many many people about this place and every single one who has tried Izakaya has loved it!    I have too many pictures from this place that I can't post everything just yet. As a tip though, study that menu! There is so much on there that its hard to choose.   So as far as the staff goes, they all work really hard. I love how they all interact and check up on you constantly. They do get busy from time to time to where its hard to get their attention, but it's really not too bad. Also, the ambiance is quite lovely. I love the feeling I get in there. It's so calm and everyone's in their own zone.   Now, on to the food!  Ok, they have amazing food.  I'm not going to get to all the things I've ordered, but none of them have let me down. I promise!   Things I've tried (Anything with *** next to it is what gets me coming back):  Sweet potato crochet*** Crispy Pork Belly*** Pork Fat Cheek*** Chicken Karaage Vegetarian Gyoza** Truffle Edamame  Pork Curry Takoyaki ** Tuna Belly*** Chicken Heart Skewers*** Beef tongue  Chicken wing skewer Rock Oyster**  Dried Fish Over Charcoal Salmon Onigiri*** Poke Burrito Mushroom Zosui Porridge Jalapeno Bomber House Fried Rice** Soft-shell Crab*** Fried Squid Legs*** Whole Grilled Squid Deep Fried chicken Soft Bones Salmon Bowl Miso Soup Enoki Butter*** Dorayaki (Green Tea Pancake with ice cream)** Ramen Sausage wrapped bacon Chicken Gizzard  Fried Tuna Belly Asparagus Bacon Pork Belly skewer Yakisoba with fish flakes Most of their handrolls/sushi   Etc etc etc...   Oh, and don't forget the drinks! They have all types too.  I suggest coming in from 10pm until close because that's when Happy Hour happens.  Also, check in to get that free scoop of ice cream!

G35Jf4ExK4Cseqmm_Diakw.text: Love the happy hour specials my favorite is the curry rice topped with braised pork belly- delicious! They give you a bowl with white rice on one side and then a pool of curry gravy on the other side. You have a choice of topping like katsu, teri chicken, pork belly and we always get the pork belly , sometimes double portion. The pairing is amazing- the curry gravy is perfect, smooth, a hint of sweetness and a touch of Spicy finish the sauce. Mix it with the rice, pork belly and the diced pickled radish and it's Christmas in my mouth!

photos.caption: Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LbHZ95BCkBMLbG5HfIZm0g.text: I have lived in Japan and this Izakaya is legitimate. The owner/head chef is from Osaka and really recreates an authentic izakaya. There is even a tatami/deep table area where you have to take your shoes off.  The food was amazing here. I loved the uni pasta, screaming orgasm and all of the fish here. I went with a friend who normally does not like fried rice but he said that the cha-han (fried rice) was really good here.   Great ume-shu and cocktails here. I have been here twice now and it is awesome. I recommend making reservations because it does get crowded.

60d6CfVzD4OHlJSKdVhcNw.text: Izakaya Go is a relatively small Japanese joint designed for a drinking crowd. With a variety of food types and sizes, just about everyone from the extremely hungry to those just wanting a beer and some sides can find what they need.  That being said, with such an extensive menu, everything is about average when it comes to quality and flavor, which should be expected given the size of the restaurant. Just from a structural point of view, a menu this size in complexity would struggle with a crowd that they serve. Don't get me wrong, I was reasonably happy with the food we received but wasn't blown away enough to signify a higher rating.   The drink menu is also quite extensive, so everyone you are with should be able to find something for them.   Granted, this place is quite busy and I expect that reservations should be made if you're hoping to get in without an extended wait. The staff is definitely friendly, although could be a bit short-handed sometimes with the few people covering the whole restaurant.   Bottom line, Izakaya Go is a good choice for those with groups of people with varying food desires or a group wanting to try a variety of Japanese style foods. Don't expect the best version of anything you've ever had, but I think few places can match this restaurant in terms of selection options for the size.

mn64VDKO7bSr2MJcsC6jiA.text: The white, rainbow-esque, shiny pearl bed of the grilled oyster sitting in front of me, littered with diced scallions like the end of a Game of Thrones battle scene is a testament to the grandeur chef behind the line, sweating no-less, and his skill that would vault him to the seat of any throne. Bravo!   I'd like to empty my stomach for a 2nd go-around, please.  My wife and I endured the brutal, laboring task of consuming a bill totaling $100 (which should have cost $500 based on taste and experience!).   If you dare to come to the City of Sin, A La Vegas, I-z-a-k-a-y-a G-o!

JKp1mFhbrl5uuUCi2es7xg.text: I did a to go order of the salmon ikura and just from that I can say that it seemed very fresh and price was affordable. I will definitely be coming back for all the other goodness on the menu.

WSR0NH3zcPZA9mzhBsIMjA.text: This place is decent. I mean I've been here twice waited about 30 minutes both times for my meal to come out which was literally okay at best. Can't say much about this place. The only reason I give this place 2 stars is just because of the sake jello. The sake jello is really good decent price but the rest is pretty god awful

LE77dBxjpZZfnVFKgS-q9g.text: Came in around 5:30/6 on a Friday night with a couple of friends. The place was pretty empty so we were seated right away. The restaurant is a little small so I felt squished at our table. I felt claustrophobic. Lol   I think they have 2 different menus? One is the regular one & the other one is for specials, I believe. I ordered takoyaki and a poke bowl. My bf had the tuna belly steak with a side of rice. The takoyaki was delicious. This was my favorite dish of the night! The poke bowl came with miso soup. Miso soup was alright, nothing special. I didn't care for the poke bowl. It didn't really taste fresh & i couldn't finish the whole thing. I had a bite of the tuna belly steak and that was pretty good!   If you check in, you can redeem a free scoop of ice cream! You have two options: vanilla and green tea. I had the green tea and it was good! Service was also pretty good. Though I thought she gave us a glare when we wanted to retrieve our free scoops of ice cream lol. I'll probably come back for the takoyaki but never order the poke bowl again haha.

ANbYQXxJ00GZwJSyXo0KPg.text: Was extremely disappointed. The servers don't even explain the dishes, they don't even pause when bringing them, are already looking at the next table as the set the plate down and run off. THE SUSHI DID NOT TASTE FRESH! It tasted extremely fishy, fresh sushi shouldn't taste fishy everyone knows that. The server said it's tuna so it will taste fishy, as if we have never had actual fresh and good fish before. The rainbow roll looked awful, avocado was brown and oxidized (see photo). I'm absolutely terrified we will get sick from the fishy taste. Avoid this place. Food looks nothing like the pictures. Service is bad. The good reviews are either fake or they have went down hill.

ejEbyC0VBTrJJDNDPgUbQw.text: Great place! Great happy hours!! Must try when you are in Vegas and want casual dining and drinks

wTTGnCXsT3AoTKiqBUanbA.text: Great late night and decent service for a restaurant that constantly has so much foot traffic. But for a restaurant that offers so much menu-wise, it would be a lot more inviting if the interior itself didn't feel like the inside of cramped soccer van.   Our group of four felt like we involuntarily became best friends with the group behind us with all of movement that happened during our meal between the servers and the diners.  With that being said, I love a good squid so I would recommend their yakitori just maybe for carry out instead.

photos.caption: Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled Squid

9OTK_lUN3SoGDWPgUnRcBg.text: Izakaya Go has really delicious food, I highly recommend the Pork Dumplings (fried), and the late hours are really great for late night cravings. However the service is a bit annoying. The servers are kind, but either to pushy or not at all super attentive. The green tea ice cream was also very "meh". It was not terrible-- just okay (which is not how I want to finish an amazing dinner). Overall I still highly enjoyed this place! Super delicious meals and appetizers.

DkcqVj-51BsCSTAy5kOClw.text: After being turned away at Raku up the street (they had tables empty) and going to an AYCE Japanese  Buffet and reading their yelp reviews in the parking lot and calling Kaysatsu at SLS who was closed. I ended up here.   Parking is never  an issue.   I ordered a cold Sapporo beer and started off with deep fried fish cake in broth garnished with hot mustard, Shigoku oysters on the half shell, pork belly, beef tongue and, shiitake mushrooms tapas, combo sashimi, and lastly Korean BBQ ribs & green salad. Everything was spot on delish and perfectly executed along with friendly stellar service.   I finished  my incredible  meal with green tea ice cream - which was complimentary and refreshing!   They say thinks happen for a reason and after this experience I can't agree more!

photos.caption: Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Perfect ending - green tea ice cream
Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Korean style ribs &amp; greens
Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sashimi

PDpAiTMXULTQIOpdeliBXg.text: This was a great Yelp find in Vegas! After walking around the Strip for a few hours, dinner was on our minds. My niece didn't want anything fried, so we all agreed on sushi. Living in Hawaii, I tend to be cautious of eating fish when land-locked. Not wanting to use up all my winnings on one meal, we took to Yelp. And as always, Yelp was spot on with Izakaya Go. It's located in the Chinatown area, don't know about parking, it was pretty full for a week night,  but we ride-share when in Vegas.   The food, prices, and service were fantastic! They have an extensive menu, prices are good (compared to the Strip and Hawaii prices), and the entire staff is friendly. We got to say hi to the chef and thank him for the best meal we had in Vegas.   Every thing we tried was delicious and fresh.  Squid legs in garlic butter, Poke "nachos", sashimi, salmon and ikura roll, grilled chicken livers, gizzards, and hearts. And when you check in with Yelp you get free ice cream, green tea was our choice, it was perfect for the end of a perfect meal.   And I still had money left to gamble with!

rEWTIljJKBJBRC-uiMMrGw.text: A fun restaurant with lots of little plates of food to try and good to share. Reggae music is good and the staff is very friendly and helpful.

J0mFmlRkzM2ji6hc1tfpSQ.text: Great place. Authentic Japanese food in an intimate atmosphere. Be sure to follow their Facebook page so you can see when they have special dishes. They have big screen TVs, so this is a great place to watch football, basketball, and other sports events. I believe the owners are Japanese, which is always a pleasant surprise.   Highly recommended, and high quality dishes.

95tmwHiwMYkJuK1vkP7jSw.text: This is my new favorite Japanese joint in town.  The menu options were many. Fresh uni,  Whole fresh fish sashimi style, Ramon, amazing grilled selection okra, Chicken liver, hearts, and a new selection for me sashimi octopus.  This place is super yummy with great service.

lVi52ZzNhGvnt0SglC4gDw.text: Excellent late night happy hour.  Service with a smile and great food without pretense.  Little bit loud, but in a good way.

iNeSGcZtZVGWGnOMenoP0g.text: Came here after seeing absinthe. 10pm hh begins, and it's awesome! Everything we ordered was excellent! Poke burrito, truffle edamame, urchin dumplings, and sushi rolls... Can't wait to come back the next time we're in Vegas!

n9h03x4VFk1vmys8h6stdw.text: My friends took me to Izakaya Go on my birthday during our May Las Vegas trip. I enjoyed the yakitori and fried pork belly appetizer dishes with a beer. The restaurant has so many appetizer offerings it was a little difficult to select my dishes. I like the Izakaya styled atmosphere.

TreQ4c9Bt5vMRouNQ_lirA.text: This place is amazing! We spent a few hours here going Izakaya style drinking and ordering dishes. Everything was excellent. I can only urge you to peruse their "Fresh from the Market" menu and order one or two of the excellent sashimi dishes (our favorite was Breem) where the sashimi is served on the fish it came from. After you eat the sashimi they deep fry the remains of the fish, which makes for an excellent crunchy snack. Perfect for drinking black and tan (made from Asahi Black and Kirin or Sapporo)! Go for it! Much better than going to these overpriced buffets on the Strip watching sad people stuffing their faces with all-you-can-eat crap!

tgDcTAH_dg7faAnGlHTxvw.text: Tuna sashimi came out warm and slimy. Yellowtail sashimi had half edible white meat and half pink tissue and skin.  I thought maybe I'd give it a chance and try something new but my common sense kicked in quick after the first bite... Not happening.  Server, although nice, disappeared for 15 minutes ... Not sure if it was a dinner rush at 11 pm or just understaffed.

MavoJ1zM3IL1-b5fwhyK9A.text: The only problems were with timing.  We made a reservation for 6:30 and they kept us waiting for about 15 minutes after arriving on time.  Then, my daughter's dish came out well after all of the other food even though it was all ordered at the same time.    To make up for it, they gave us free edamame and ice creams for the children.    The food was excellent.  We had the udon tempura soup, bacon asparagus, garlic spinach, miso soups, sashimi bowl, soft shelled crab tempura, buttery corn, grilled shrimp and cucumber rolls.  This was almost enough food for the five of us.

UKHiVYhCND9a-MZQH44JNg.text: Hands down, one of the best places in Vegas. Service is amazing, the food is delicious. The ambiance in general is great!

Bg4MvaymNi4cNyY2-8cLzQ.text: Love this little joint. Recommend to anyone that is in Vegas and looking for a good Japanese place to grub without paying Vegas price!

OKhdjcfSwb_vB8EFpTnN3g.text: I've been to many Izakaya resturants in America, but the new Izakaya Go tops them all.    The atmosphere here is very nice and chill.  Not too loud like most Izakaya resturants but just right.  The design of the resturant is very Japanese so for those who love Japanese culture will want to experience this.    The food here is amazing!  A couple friends and I almost ordered the entire menu.  Even though there are so many great choices on the menu I recommend the Tuna Belly.  It was just amazing.  It might be seasonal so get it soon!!  Definetely coming back when I come to Vegas.

qmh-oz1P23LgbsacAxzSKQ.text: Stopped in here looking for a variety of Japanese food to satisfy some Asian cravings. Service was lacking in at tentativeness and timing, needed time to review the extensive menus and they stopped multiple times then but once we had had a chance or needed refills on beverages the waitresses were really hard to 'find'.   Our party of 4 in the end was satisfied and full from our variety of selections lots of yakatori options and a few set meals.  I will say that this is the first place in Vegas I have found/had Japanese potato salad and it was so awesome to see that small scoop on the set meal plate.  Thankfully a friend and my other half who ordered the sets let me indulge; missing small slices of ham and a bit more salt but it sent me to the Asian market to get some Kewpie mayo to make one of my favorites :) We will continue to search out our 3rd Japanese place since we've been here the last two have gone out of business, perhaps they should have had higher all be it reasonable prices like this place and they would still be round; but we wouldn't object to coming back at some point.

zQO4w0sl4YeJLVywV0WBww.text: The overall service was excellent. The dishes came out really quick, though the portions were small in my opinion. I'd recommend pork belly, sasami wasabi medium rare and fatty tuna skewed. They are really good!

G_J3RFM-w5_1iu928PLGKg.text: Overrated.  The Shu Mai was frozen,  we sent it back...warm and still gross.  We ordered 10 things and only were good.   The otoro and garlic shrimp.  Pick the things you can do right and narrow down the menu accordingly.  Also, the service was less than stellar.

iISuqtM-IMBDdtmJrYBdZg.text: Came here with a coworker as we've heard a new japanese restaurant near our working place had opened.     We were greeted warmly by the workers and was allowed to choose our own table !   There is a wonderful and broad selection on their menu , wether you're craving burgers , noodles , rice etc and the portions are generous and well worth the price!     My favorites are the karaage and tempura that are nice and crispy , ginger pork which has a unique flavor  and esp the Salt Salmon combo which is grilled to perfection and boneless ! The entree is accompanied by a bowl of rice and chef chosen healthy side dishes which are delicious !    Definitely dying to try their ramen burger and crab cream croquette burger , which may not be for a while because I am forever addicted to their special combos which leave me ever so satisfied and not grotesquely bloated or sick when we finish.      The owner is very friendly and always checks up on you to see if everything is ok. Everything is EXCELLENT! He and the other workers even recognizes us as regulars x3

photos.caption: Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Comfortable seat cushions !
Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lovely lanterns lovely ambiance
Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Interior

pLPBwAOw-yBIE2UHPrCkvQ.text: jfc this place is great and I accidentally came here half my April. "What do you wanna eat?" my friend asks. I usually replied with "I dunno. Izakaya?" What I love about this place is Go. He's the owner and he works hard as a server and an owner. I respect these types of places a lot and it's part of the reason why I keep coming. Obviously the food is great.  I get a lot of food here for $15 during happy hour. The quote "can I get veggie dumplings, two avocado rolls, and two pumpkin croquettes?" is etched into my brain since I've been saying it all month. This place is soooo good and is constantly good aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa.  Service is great. Every server I have gotten is extremely polite and treats you like a guest in their home. Go's hair is heavenly too. His hair is so beautiful and it's the real reason why I keep coming. Yeah, that's right. Forget about the food and the service, just come over, pay for dinner during happy hour and admire Go's luscious hair (Im kidding, dummy. Although, Go's hair is pretty gosh dang amazing).  My bill that comes after my inspirational quote I said earlier that mentions 2 avocado rolls, 2 pumpkin croquettes, and veggie dumplings comes out to be $20 (with tip) during happy hour. Pretty cheap considering I leave dying from eating so much. Sure, I can easily stop eating or ordering so much so I can avoid those post I-almost-vomited-from-eating-so-much burps; but the food is so good when it's fresh.  I have tried other dishes in the past besides my usual. I only remember having the curry with cheese. It had acceptable taste and was a huge portion. Izakaya Go is an izakaya restaurant, so it's not like them having an okay curry really affects them. Them only having okay tasting non-Izakaya foods matters as much as okay tasting chicken fingers at Cheesecake Factory.  Tips: Don't you dare disrespect the servers or I'll cut you. Order izakaya dishes, its their best ones considering it's an izakaya restaurant. Come here after work or during late hours for happy hour (DUH. ITS AN IZAKAYA RESTAURANT, DOOF).  Pros: Nice staff, the owner is a server himself and is a leader rather than a boss, great food, amazing prices during happy hour, Go's hair (so dreamy).  Cons: Uuuuuuuuuuh?????????? their curry, a dish that isn't specialized here, is only okay???!!! ugh!! If I could rate 0 stars I would!!!!! grr only okay!!!!!!!!! I can't believe this non izakaya dish isn't as good as their izakaya dishes!!!! 0 stars!!!

VcEeVnL8zcdh7NfUKROTQA.text: Slowly becoming one of my favorite izakaya restaurants in Vegas. I love their specials menu and their grilled skewers. I pretty much just order everything off their specials menu as I haven't found a dish I was disappointed in. Their truffle butter corn with cheese is delicious, the tuna steak is grilled to perfection, and their skewers are deliciously fresh off the grill. The restaurant is a bit small, so there can sometimes be a little bit of a wait. Other than that, I recommend giving this place a try!

rCQwA1O64bD637tFJ90JFg.text: We went there for a late dinner during our vacation in Vegas. We were lucky to find this place. It's not too far from the strip and the neighborhood was ok too. The service was excellent. The waiters were very polite and thoughtful. The food was excellent, authentic and priced right. We got to try different new dishes and we all loved them: spicy tuna cracker, octopus ball, cawanmushi, house fried rice, grilled tuna belly, and crispy pork belly. I recommend them all. We will be visiting this place again whenever we visit Vegas.

LZtO4Xtt5rK2IhzX6jgoIQ.text: I love this place. Its not too fancy or hip or trendy Just a great place to go to for a drink and some bites after work or on the late night. Their happy hour is awesome and the uni pasta dish is a great deal and even better quality. They have pretty much everything that I crave for in regards to japanese food, and everything I've tried has not disappointed. All at very reasonable prices. Izakaya Go see for yourself.

photos.caption: Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. For 10 bucks you can&#39;t go wrong. Tempura bento
Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Squid legs on point

JEXe8RK0hjXQaJ-eAsoZBw.text: If you haven't made it here yet damn your missing out on what this foodie calls Vegas most hottest spot in years!

ejtXMC8jNB2utVy6eHHyHg.text: This place is amazing!!! I can't stop eating here. They got the best pickles. Great rolls and the curry with the fried chicken hit the spot perfectly. The curry soup was also really good the curry isn't over powering like in other places. Had the green tea and vanilla ice cream for dessert both were good.

A5ipnOwtHbr9cRkHZuqIgw.text: Place is small but appetizers are awesome. Ramen was OK for me. I've had better Ramen at other place...

w7tUVxhfBDlxSkv-wo3sUw.text: The Uni Chawan Mushi caught my eye on here and was the main reason for my visit. It definitely did not disappoint. I also had a grilled tuna belly which was cooked to perfection and seasoned elegantly. My tummy left very happy.   The only reason why I hesitate to give a full 5-stars is the service left something to be desired. I asked my server what he would recommend to accompany the Uni dish, which he could hardly create an answer for. He just directed me to the specials board, which worked out fine. But I was hoping for a little more guidance on the very extensive menu. Maybe a starchy dish to complement the egg custard?   The other note on service was about 7-8 minutes after I had placed my order, I was looking around the restaurant (dining solo tonight) to soak in the authentic and homey decor. My server must have thought I was being impatient as he then warned me that the specific dishes I ordered do take a while to cook. I was not concerned about the time, but you think this warning would be better suited as I'm placing the order not 8 minutes after.  Regardless I definitely plan on coming back, with more people, to enjoy a better variety of the awesome menu.

16HoHgTGWNInCThCz-rJBw.text: I've been eating here since it opened and not sure why I didn't give it a review sooner. If you enjoy Japanese tapas aka "Izakaya" you have found the spot. Look no further, this place offers some of the best Izakaya in town!

oUaKRdMcXVKk4RkoxlKCTA.text: The food is delicious! Also the ramen noodle spicy level is just delicious! It's a good place to go with friends and chill. Good music.

photos.caption: Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Very delicious Ramen Noodle Soup

tnPNKkZboe3I__LQLNckjw.text: I think I found my place! I accidentally found this new restaurant, but I'm in love!  They have the deep chicken cartilage which sounds gross, but in Japan this dish is super popular to go along with some alcohol.   There are many popular AUTHENTIC Japanese tapas at this restaurant which I am excited for! There are tons of knock off Japanese dishes at other "Japanese" restaurants in Vegas, but this place is the way to go.   The decor and the set up of this restaurant is pretty cool too. Old school Japanese Izakaya environment forsureee.   They said they haven't got the liquor license yet, but I'm thrilled to see how this business will turn out like! I hope not TOO busy so I can enjoy my dinner here and there from now on ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy tuna on crispy rice. Server told me this is a popular dish, and I&#39;m glad I ordered it!

1KEgE_2-f3XkeVqVq_31og.text: I come here often after work for the late happy hour, and I must say it's one of my favorite newer places in town. Go and his staff are always helpful and friendly. I have my favorites but always seem to find something new each time through friends selections.  The enoki mushrooms in the soy butter sauce from the main menu are my standout must have, and they always have a daily fresh sashimi selection. Whether I am craving meat, fish, or veggies, Izakaya Go has something delicious and unique to offer every palate.

j_bR7c-Xas5id09pM8UYDg.text: Food was good, but food service was not.  Two of our 5 meals were magically ready after we asked for our bill.

-mJnHeJLq6zN0BJmykq6Ag.text: This place is amazing! Food is great, atmosphere is great, and not too loud.  Its like I'm in an actual izakaya in Japan. The only thing this place is different from popular izakayas in Japan is that you can't smoke cigarettes indoors(of course), everything else is top notch! I went with a couple friends and had a great time with tasty food and ice cold beers.  Now this is how a izakaya should be!

uBU_vPiyWABpNOEwi61ptg.text: Came in at around 1:30 AM. Got seated right away. Server greeted as as soon as we got seated & took our orders. Great atmosphere & decor was great. As for the food, I would have to say it was superb! Got baked mussels for appetizers & it was the fresh! Also got a beef yakisoba & tonkatsu dinner plate. Wasn't expecting the dinner plate to have so many side dishes. Definitely recommend!

NAGDsSUczuyTIfnYfrrMFg.text: We found this place while looking for a sushi restaurant that is open until 3 AM. The food was amazing!!! It is very authentic Japanese and they had a late night happy hour. It is a small restaurant but quite cozy and the staff were very professional and friendly. The menu is extensive and the prices are fair. The sushi rolls were good but they really specialize in Japanese dishes. If I lived in Vegas I would be here all the time.

MEDBYbMHuPA7L1b1HnYQKQ.text: Best place for happy hour. 10 pm is when it starts. 3dollar large sake and 6 dollar pitcher beer. Food is just amazing. Haven't tried anything yet that I haven't liked. First time I tried it just got me hooked. Like to drink and eat with friends here expecially  to start us off for the night. Great servers. Make sure you try reserve a table if your going with a group.

rTHZGkm1mzTYHxR8g3YNfA.text: Solid izakaya place. Good taste, reasonable prices, friendly service. Didn't have reservations at 8 on a Friday but still was seated within 10, 15 minutes. Recommend and would return.  Stand-out dishes for me: clams in butter, chawan mushi, fried rice (omg just what I was craving!), kara age. Shoot even a plain California roll is great here! All skewers were good especially chicken meatball, pork belly, and items wrapped in bacon. Wasn't too happy with the goma ae (too sweet) and that some of the salads felt too sugary from the dressing.

2-oQ9NyQV9PgtpfeaRcOuQ.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE!!!The best place in Vegas!!! Love everything here. Clean, friendly, Food is fantastic! We go here almost every week sometime twice a week.

cLuCKvjkVBM40gvlAyLYmA.text: Excellent Japanese Restaurant in Vegas. Delicious tapas and other finger food. Generous portions. A little pricey (4 boys-$115) but we liked most of the things we ordered. DEFINITELY coming back here next time I'm back in Vegas

8pnDBEhLwWz14JnHO1wRDg.text: always always amazing food and amazing service. Yuzu chuhai was the best drink I've ever had in long time. One of my favorite place in LV. A Korean girl who can speak Japanese was a server. She was super friendly and brought us food right away. Thank You and thanks to Izakaya go for a great time and food! i will be there soon!

N6r15SO7quEVDP8enxX0Uw.text: 2.35754 stars to be exact. Everything was just okay. Nothing special that really wowed me except the crispy pork belly and uni chawan mushi.   My boyfriend and I came in on a Saturday around 1 am for a late dinner. It wasn't busy at all and there was only one server.   We ordered:   CRISPY PORK BELLY: honestly my favorite dish. It was crispy and chewy. I liked the salt that was sprinkled on it. It brought out the savory taste!  CHICKEN KARAGE: Felt undercooked and needed to be more crispy.  UNI POTSTICKERS: hmm I really wondered what I put in my mouth. I think there was only a smidge of uni at the top and the rest was weird mushy stuff.  HALIBUT AND ABALONE: okay seriously for $15 I expected a lot more. The halibut was seriously the size of my two fingers and the abalone was very tiny also. They just serve it with a side of ponzu. GO WINGS: were drenched in some salty teriyaki sauce. The breading was hard and I didn't like it at all.  UNI CHAWAN MUSHI: very savory! I love the seafood that was in there and how it's served to you in a small cute cup. BEEF TATAKI: very small portion. Only five small pieces. I did like the sauce and topping they pot with it. The meat was tender and chewy! SPICY MISO RAMEN: the noodles were very undercooked and came out warm. The broth was light and just okay.   The owner Go was nice enough to let us try his small clam dish.   Don't think I'll be return though unless it just take out of the Crispy Pork Belly.

yQQBwsFy-GSE0ORgFv9D0w.text: Really good place, fresh sashimi, great girls, love the agedashi mocha and pumpkin croquettes! Better make reservations ahead of time, will be back!

bUwHVh6_dJWBmcptau7gZA.text: I was pleasantly surprised with the food here. Don't let anybody tell you about it.,it's worth to try and see for yourself.

MNtt6yl4n-q8Hga2Q60EiQ.text: Place is small but cozy. Definitely like the privacy you have with your own party. It's decorated in a unique way and I really like the reggae choice of music. Staff is phenomenal- my water was immediately filled every single time. Bar is well stocked. Food is unreal. Everyone walked out satisfied, however apologies I cannot recall the names of the dishes. Definitely recommend making reservations if more than a party of 4. I recommend the udon shrimp tempura soup!

l4ZWV4eARhT9RP7PMDFQ7Q.text: Izakaya Go was a huge let down.  I went for lunch the opening week and got the salmon teriyaki lunch.  It came with your standard miso soup, salad, rice, soft tofu, and creamy potato side dish.  The food itself was good and what you would expect from a Japanese restaurant, but the long wait killed it... not on it's own.  The long wait to order, to get tea, for the food to come out, and then needing to ask for a spoon for the miso soup.  I understand this was opening week and some kinks were probably being worked out so I decided I should come back during dinner to see the full tapas menu and give it another shot.   That day and the next they were doing 50% off the bill so the next day at dinner I recruited a friend to check out the tapas menu with me.  It was more of the same regarding service, despite having more than one server interact with us throughout the experience. This happened the previous day.  The other funny thing was the same primary server who tended to us at dinner was also the one who was taking care of me at lunch the previous day.  I understand when it's stupid busy and a lot of people are coming through, you can't remember everyone, but she didn't recognize me from the previous day even though she invited me back to check out this particular menu, and the place was never packed the both times I happened to be in.  The dinner menu is large and easy to get lost in, we got the chicken yakisoba which was great, the halibut roll, a couple other dishes that weren't memorable, my friend wanted the bacon asparagus dish, which had a hair in it.  We let the server know just so they could make the kitchen aware.  They apologized and offered us ice cream.  Overall the decor is very traditional and I can tell a lot of thought and care went into it.  The staff is friendly and I feel like they're trying but there has to be some disconnect between the front and back of the house.  The food was good but was coming out very slowly and sporadically, I think that's related to the previous statement. Oh and they have been picking the weirdest Pandora channels for music, it was mostly some super slow r&b and a couple Pandora ads. Some people might find it petty for me to mention it, but I noticed it and kind of found it entertaining.   I'm not sure if or when I'll try this place again because I feel like I got burned back to back, especially with the other reviews being so enthusiastic about this place.  Maybe I had bad luck both times?  I'll give it some time before taking another shot here, there are so many options explore in Chinatown alone, and all around Vegas.

aAc9PXuEPMGXCGXguA45nw.text: Absolutely love the sushi, always fresh fish and quick service. Beef Tataki is a must try, one of my favorite things on the menu. As well as the yellowtail collar. Some of the friendliest staff in the city, always consistent. The music is also good for the atmosphere, nice chill reggae vibes. It's definitely a good stop, wether just for a snack, or a full service dinner.

rV7lJm8KKdA2_0ztbqdRNQ.text: Great restaurant to eat asian fusion and traditional.  He has authentic items and not so common dishes.  Definitely recommended

yhgMwlmS5bDHp1UfwLzuew.text: Excellent sushi spot. I love their tuna it's some of the best in the area. Easy parking and not too crazy inside. If you want be best service sit at the bar, chefs will just keep it coming

O6dSM6XM8T8q1y-Kz115Iw.text: I walk in the location with my friend expecting lets try this new place and see if we like it. After sitting in the front still awaiting to be seated so we can even glance at the menu it took about 15 minutes before we started trying to make sure that the servers were aware we were there.   Finally we got seated. It probably took a server about 5/7 minutes before she asked what we would like to drink.   The food did not take long to serve but the quality was a disgrace. I felt like I was eating salt. Like someone though it would be funny to pour salt into each sushi roll.   Finally when I was ready to leave after being seated so long with my food being complete I forgot the server had not yet given me the check and almost got up and left.   So overall, staff needs work. Chefs, they definitely need work.   And those mints.... were a lie! They were cinnamon!!

UnHFyxRslKtX0xi7Q1i9BQ.text: Daaaaamn ! That bang bang chicken was on point! Very delicious and genius! Our server Boram was amazing she recommended the dish and I trust her with my life!!! lol The crispy pork belly.....HEAVEN IN YOUR MOUTH! Kimchee Tofu....LIGHT

photos.caption: Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. As simple as this looks...the crispy pork belly was Heaven in my mouth!  #goodcrack

JJcpr1HovwYvfBeJXMma1w.text: I haven't heard much about izakaya go, but I have seen so many pictures of their food online so I was excited to try it out. It was oddly cold this night so I decided to get some miso ramen to warm myself up. It wasn't as tasty as I wanted it to be. Too many green onions were placed in the bowl so that was all I tasted. The noodles were plentiful but a little too soggy. I wish it wasn't cooked so long. The opposite was True for the bean sprouts, which were a little too crunchy for my taste.   My friends and I came here for an early dinner, 6pm on a Saturday night. There was no crowd when we got there but it got busy after a while. Once the place filled up, it was hard to get service. The food also came out very slowly, one at a time. Probably 10-15 minutes in between each person's orders. Typically, this wouldn't bother me, but it's a little awkward when only one person has their food and everyone else is waiting for theirs. At the end of our meal, we looked at the wall and saw a sign that said free ice cream with a facebook check in. We asked the server about it and she seemed hesitant to give us the ice cream but after checking our facebook pages, she took our ice cream orders. I know this place has a lot more to offer. I'm excited to come back and try some of their other items!

photos.caption: Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Miso ramen

lFdLaUQVLjwg2n4MBhGMsA.text: The Skinny: the street food is great especially the takoyaki but fried items are just okay(3.5) the service was fast and efficient (4), value: very generous serving sizes for the price (3.5 bump up to 4 stars)   I was coming off a late night shift and hungry as hell. The hubs said why don't we try this izakaya in Chinatown. I am all in.   So we head to Izakaya Go which is tucked away in a small plaza behind a Starbucks.  Parking and is free but has a 80 minutes maximum in front of the restaurant.  Seeing how it was late and there was not much going on there,  this didn't bother us too much.   We were promptly seated and orders taken. Service is solid with complimentary hot green tea. (FYI -  iced green tea is never free... Don't ask me why but it is a Japanese thing).   Like most izakayas, the menu consists of many small dishes that go well with alcohol. Surprisingly,  there aren't any kushiyaki or yakitori on the menu. I also found it funny that they offered ramen and soba  First visit: takoyaki,  yakisoba,  tonkatsu dinner, buta kakuni.   The takoyaki was on the mark. This is the closest I've had to the takoyaki you get in Osaka's Dotombori district.  The batter is fluffy on the side,  crispy on the outside. Served with shaved Bonito flakes, mayo and takoyaki sauce,  it is totally delish and a great value for the price.   Yakisoba was another favorite.  The stir-fried noodles had a nice chew to it while the slightly charred (in a good way!)meat and vegetables gives a mild smokey flavor.   The stewed pork belly (buta kakuni) was a generous portion without too much fat. Marinated in a sweet soy base and served with a bit of mustard,  the meat was moist and delicious.  The tonkatsu dinner was a good value. Only thing is the tonkatsu crust is a bit too thick and heavy. Overall it was okay but nothing we need to order again.   Round 2: stir fried mushrooms,  sauteed spinach, miso glazed eggplant, California roll, crispy pork belly, karaage.   Stir fried mushrooms were great. Loved the buttery flavor with a nice sear.   California roll was pretty standard stuff. Okay but nothing to write home about.   Crispy pork belly texturally was too hard and a bit too salty. The karaage had similar problems plus was served with an aioli which was too heavy. Pass.   Miso eggplant was very sweet and could almost be categorized as candied eggplant. Pass.   Sauteed spinach was okay but really nothing special and a small portion to boot.   Given the food overall,  there were some hits and misses. But given the good items are so good,  it is enough to have me coming back for more. (3.5 bump up to 4 starred review).

photos.caption: Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled salmon dinner combo: great deal!

HC0AMnVcWX9dBShdRxkCnQ.text: Items Selected: Matcha Green Tea Takoyaki Hamachi kama Unagi bowl Salmon skin salad Miso Soup Battera Agedashi tofu Chicken Karaage Tuna Belly Steak Chawan Mushi Mushroom Zosui porridge Ten zaru soba with tempura Tororo Udon with grated mountain yam  Located just off Spring Mountain Road, cattycorner to Kuma Snow Cream, it was as part of a group of seven that a baker's dozen plates were ordered amidst the cozy confines of Izakaya Go and although palates I trust have recently offered the freshly opened space high commendations, our experience would prove to be just short of a disaster - the sort of meal that left one wondering how anyone could find such a place palatable, let alone worthy of praise.  Admittedly jam-packed, each seat in the house filled at the time of a 7:30 arrival, it was with advanced reservations that the group squeezed into a makeshift table best appointed for six, and with Izzy and Katie playing a bit too loudly from behind the bar a large menu was surveyed as water and hot tea were filled freely - the restaurant fresh out of green, but offering matcha or black over ice at $2.50 per glass.  Optimizing orders so as to cover a large swath of Izakaya Go's offerings it would not be long before first plates arrive and with creamy balls of fried octopus beneath bonito setting an extremely high bar it was unfortunate that no other plate would even come close to the quality of those tender fried orbs - least of all the grilled collar of tuna that was essentially charred dry leaving one to wonder whether the kitchen possessed any skill or integrity at all.  Essentially ruining a unagi bowl by burying the eel under too sweet a sauce over dried out rice one could say that the crispy salmon skin atop greens mixed with more bonito was the star of round two and with two small bowls of miso soup no better or worse than any other the box-sushi battera was additionally quite good, the savory smack of mackerel finding balance in vinegar and shiso, both.  Admittedly impressed by lightly fried agedashi tofu in more of the miso broth, but less so by fried chicken that was nearly as much batter as bird, it was onward to par-for-the-course egg custard that the meal progressed and with the previously forgotten tuna belly arriving with texture similar to the collar at the meal's beginning a single bite was more than enough for most - nearly half of the $12 order remaining on the table at meal's end.  Rounding out the evening in three bowls, the soba literally flavorless even when dipped in dressing while tempura served alongside was fairly competent and entirely full of grease, it was only at the meals end that both the mushroom porridge and hot udon topped with sticky yam would approach the level of the Takoyaki, but at this point bored with belabored service and annoyed by so much mediocrity all one really wanted to do was 'go.'  Perhaps suffering from high praise begetting a full house, maybe besmirched by a grill burning too hot, or - and I hope not - possibly deeming our table expendable as we were the only Caucasians in house the only real positive of dinner at Izakaya Go was the friends involved and $30/pp price - nothing save for the Takoyaki better than can be found elsewhere on Spring Mountain without the pop music, sub-par service, or overall lack of quality control.

pNTgppQNPVQfeagQMY1l5g.text: Tried this place on late night on a weekday. I was trying to make a list of the things that would fast good since the menu has like 1000000 things.  I was very very happy with every dish that i ordered. The beed tongue and Pork cheek skewers were amazing.  I actually went back the next day just to order the Uni Pasta again.  That plate melts in your mouth and is absolutely 100% one of the best dishes I have ever had.   I highly recommend this place. All dishes are made fast and the quality is very high.

zHun7PGlLQd5vJHA0cj-ZA.text: "New Izakaya Kid On The Block"  ATMOSPHERE:  Tucked away in the former Koraku Ramen Spot, Izakaya Go is fast becoming a force to be reckoned with in the Izakaya arena. We stopped in for a quick bite and perusing the menu, it is an interesting spread with your usual lunch combination specials, as well as a section for Curry, their take on Asian fusion burgers and burritos, and an entire page of noodles. Clean inside, and no distracting TVs, but the counter full of congratulatory flowers kinda gave me the heebie-jeebies thinking I was in a funeral parlor...YIKES! Thank goodness that's temporary! The owner, Chef Go approached our table during our meal to see how our lunch was...always a plus to know that the Chef/Owner is actually in the restaurant cooking.  BITES/BEVERAGES:  I went with the Tonkatsu Lunch Combination($9.95) and we also decided to split a *Poki Burrito ($9.25) *should be spelled Poke, and is pronounced Po-keh, NOT Po-key, FYI...Hot tea is complimentary, just ask for a pot...Out of curiosity, I asked to see the dinner menu, and my eyes immediately zoomed in on the Uni Chawanmushi($6.25) which sounded pretty slammin' , so our waitress was nice enough to check with the kitchen if they could fire one up for us, and sure enough, they were able to! The lunch combinations served here have got to be the biggest ones I've seen! House salad, miso soup, tofu, takuan, and potato salad are included with your entree on one massive tray! My Tonkatsu was cooked to perfection, crisp, juicy, and not greasy at all. Poki Burrito(Think Jogasaki) was good but there was something HELLA SPICY in there! I grabbed a bite of Wifey's Enoki Mushroom and Shrimp Tempura from her Tempura Combo($9.95) tons better than that disastrous tempura at that Michelin starred chef's place... Oh man, the Chawanmushi? Money! loaded with mushrooms, shrimp, and uni, I would definitely devour this again!  CLOSING STATEMENTS:  Same plaza as KUMA Snow Cream on Valley View and Spring Mountain...  Remember, the lunch menu is totally different from the dinner selections  . The more traditional Izakaya items and Japanese dishes, and seafood specialities are on their dinner menu. However, if it's not busy at lunch and something on the dinner menu tempts you, just ask...they might just make it for you!  MASSIVE portions, great prices...you won't leave hungry here. Trust me....  Still have yet to explore dinner here...it's kind of a mix of Kyara, Soho, and Ichiza... Speaking of Ichiza, This may be a better option after Ichiza's constant run-ins with SNHD.  ALOHA!!!  Shaka Meter:  \uuu/  \uuu/  \uuu/  \uuu/  \uu  4.5  Will I Return??? Oh yeah!

RsM4KlhbwXOlzaPvLgtT8w.text: Izakaya Go (Pronounced "Is-A-ka-ya") is located in the same plaza right next to Krung Siam in Chinatown. I was lucky enough to have dinner here on Grand opening night even though it was packed and busy. The first thing you notice once you step inside is how well decorated the restaurant is. It just feels very welcoming and comfortable. The menu (sitting on the wall on strips of wood written in Japanese) brings a nostalgic feeling in me as I lived in Japan for almost 3 years.  Once seated on our table. We proceeded to order a vast variety of appetizers and entrees. Izakaya Go specializes in small dishes called tapas similar to what Ichiza offers. We started off with the Miso soup and Edamame (the staple starters in Japanese meals) the Miso soup tasted great and was authentic and the Edamame was a good snack. Then came the Kara Age "KAH-rah-AH-geh" which is a Japanese style fried chicken. It is traditionally marinated in soy sauce, ginger, and garlic. I would highly recommend the Kara Age here as it was a perfect balance between flavor, texture and richness.  We ordered the Crunch roll, California roll, Spicy tuna roll, Spicy tuna crackers, Tempura Platter, and Chicken Yakisoba. Everyone loved every dish that came out of the kitchen. The Chicken Yakisoba was one of the best versions of Yakisoba I've ever had. The quality of food is what I would expect as the head chef here has over 20 years experience as a chef from Kyoto Japan.  If you're in the mood for Japanese food, don't hesitate to give Izakaya Go a try. Once they acquire their liquor license (in process), they will be open late as well.

cjcEfcjValoQzIV1NO9r7w.text: I like this place for their large menu and reasonable prices. I've usually ordered off of their daily specials and most popular sections. A couple of my favorites are their Takoyaki (fried octopus balls) and Okonomiyaki (Osaka pancakes). The first time trying their ramen burger I thought it was great. But the next few times trying it I actually didn't think it was that good. The ramen noodles on the burger tend to be a little tough and hard to eat. I liked their mushroom porridge, it has a good flavor but nothing too out of the ordinary. The service is great and staff very friendly. However, I have mixed feelings about the taste and quality of their food so it's usually not my go-to place for Japanese tapas. But I like the fact that they stay open pretty late, so I'd definitely stop by for a midnight snack.

photos.caption: Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. osaka pancakes, mushroom porridge, ramen burger

2-XGNbrjcoakjI6vBT2pBg.text: Some food are good some are not. It's mediocre. Staff are great tho! Yakitori is ok. Although, I feel like they cook it with an electric grill or something because there is no smoke flavor to it.

KhQpU2yKoyZBnTx7IT_zKw.text: This place is a must-go every time we come to Vegas. Off strip prices, great service, amazing food, huge menu. The staff is super friendly and you can tell they are into what they are doing because they are excited to explain items on the menu and always make great saki recommendations. A meal like this on the strip would be 5X the cost.   Typically very crowded on weekends so make a reservation. If soft shell crab is on the specials, get it.

sHArD5w-nZPIpZd91s73bA.text: We took our client from NYC who's also been to Japan, & he thought it was the best Japanese he's ever had. We agree! Uni was fresh & perfect, they made custom nigiri for me that was phenomenal. Rolls, miso & dessert were also excellent. A hidden gem in a strip mall of Chinatown! Very reasonable $$ too!

LhYgpKoeSBSGXd7u1-CQ5w.text: Love this place! This is THE place to come if you're looking for an authentic Japanese food in Las Vegas.

1Lh_qyvSF2tk_XFJdeov7g.text: Giving this place 4 stars. The inside looks like a nice little Japanese restaurant/ bar. The food is very delicious I would give the food 5 stars, apparently the service wasn't the best but I'm not going to take off a million stars for that.  They have this happy hour from 10 pm-closing and they have AMAZING happy hour options. If you want a bowl of ramen you can! For only $5 or if you wanna order some salmon handrolls it's like $5 too.  They also have this deal you can get a whole tray with katsu as the main dish with side dishes like salad and a miso soup for like $14 but guaranteed to fill you up.  The thing I like most about this place is that they have variety, it's not just like all Japanese tapas, I mean there are tapas, but there are also sushi or sashimi or ramen or katsu or fried tuna belly on a skewer.. and etc. plus did I also add this little place is also a bar? And they close around 2 am so you can eat/drink here late at night when almost everything else is closed.

QNG1fCutosTJVGtmvO3R9w.text: Three times in 2  weeks... it's our new favorite spot to unwind to tasty dishes Izakaya style. Here is what I've tried so far and what I think of the dishes.  Takoyaki - a ball shape dough cooked in a special pan stuffed with a perfect piece of octopus, this place by far serves the best one I've ever had in Vegas. 5 stars  Grilled Tuna Belly (from the special's board) top quality fish grilled to perfection and lightly seasoned so the natural taste of the tuna stands out and with a not so over powering Ponzu Sauce was pretty good just unfortunately ours was a bit raw on the side almost made it felt like we were eating a seared fish but we still ate it all because it was still tasty. 4.3 stars   Uni Chawan Mushi is their egg custard with veggies topped with sea urchin was just amazing. Very gentle and subtle to the palate with the combination chosen. Better word for it... comfort food like a Japanese version of chicken noodle soup for the soul 5 stars  Deep Fried Chicken Cartilage might not be for everyone. But if you're like me who loves that part of the chicken then this is a must order! If you have eaten this before then you'll know what the texture is all about but it's battered and deep fried so it's masked and once you eat it... it's so weird in a good way. By far my favorite thing to order every time I go here 5 stars  Deep Fried Octopus it's octopus and it's deep fried... need I say more? The mayo dipping sauce was a bit too much for me I prefer it with just the lemon and seasoning in tbh 4.4 stars  Karage Chicken at the time when I ordered it, I felt it was a bit heavy on the salty side. I had to squeeze 2 lemons to balance out that sharp salty taste from my tongue. Maybe I just had a bad batch thay night.  I'll order it again to see if it changes 3.4 stars  Still have more foods to review... will post when I get the time .. lol  Don't forget to say hi to Go, he's amazing and I believe owns the place. His soothing choice of music to play reggae in his restaurant has me coming back for more because it's just so laid back, perfect lighting,  good vibes, alcohol, no tv so you can actually conversate with people you're with there and you can't go wrong with his prices. Let's just say I've been going here once a week and it's definitely not my last :)

VvctIN0zFgLJMHrgkKH2iw.text: Second time came here, all waitress service so bad,  we sit down like 10 minutes they didn't even ask for drink even we already took the order! And never clean the table ! This restaurant the food is not so good already , plus the waitress this kind the attitude! Will never come back here again!

IYs2aHsp6Xqpwrr1OEyGtw.text: Awesome find while visiting Vegas. True izakaya place. Fresh fish, small pupu/tapa plates. Asian gods at its finest!

ywgjrXDYlGOUSnQwasAsUQ.text: Ate there last time we were in Vegas. The food was excellent. The atmosphere is small and intimate. Portions and prices were great. The service was excellent. Will be sure to go there the next time we visit in November.

O5KzkcoqnVVgh1_yw68GnQ.text: A little piece of home when I am here. Servers are attentive & fast, and the food is so authentic & delicious!  Definitely a must for me while I'm here in Vegas!

Tr5e7B-RTVqPdbWuGcd9xg.text: The best meal we had while staying in Las Vegas. We just kept ordering more! The fish was deliciously fresh, and my parents are SUPER picky about that kind of stuff, coming from a country with seafood-heavy cuisine.   Some highlights from what I remember: The dessert we had (yuzu cheesecake, mille crepe) were perfect, my dad especially liked the mille crepe because it wasn't too sweet. The uni was sooo creamy and not fishy at all!  I HIGHLY recommend going.

ZYPASwGEBXNEpeG77rJViw.text: Ramen burger is a MUST TRY!!! I'll definitely come back. Everything was delicious, great value and great servers!!

1pu4gZJi7_qaH4ZhA4AGNw.text: Authentic and super fresh sushi. Great service, we skipped the Las Vegas strip, took an uber, well worth it. All locals in the know. Happy hour great prices!

SlWMU_OkMHR7WLFnY9Gecg.text: I love this place.  I didn't think sashimi could be this good in a non-coastal city.  Lots of sashimi choices, including oh-toro.  The salmon was wild and fatty (not the orange farmed stuff).  The aji was perfect.  The yellowtail left me licking my lips to capture all of the buttery fatness.  The unagi was more tender than usual, which lent to more emphasis on the flavor, rather than texture (and the flavor was exceptional).  Sashimi aside, the sunomono, especially the ume and the kyuuri were full of pop.  The kalbi ribs were ok.  Probably a little too much char.  The yakitori were all above average, especially the chicken liver and the pork cheek.  I'll be back.  Probably tonight.

n8_a4TW7h8LUeL2hgn8Qug.text: Very disappointed in the quality of food served at Izakaya Go after I went in last night. The presentation and quality of the spicy tuna and ahi hand roll was severely lacking. Granted it was happy hour during Sunday Night Football but don't offer happy hour if can't maintain the quality. I tried the Shoyu ramen off the menu also and that had no flavor. Obviously the time and effort was not put into creating the ramen.   How this place received 600 plus reviews of 4.5 stars is beyond me. This has to rate as one of worst sushi and Japanese restaurants I have been too. Look elsewhere before dropping any hard earned coin!

-t_IojmLuYagPu8UaTx-gQ.text: The Uni rice is amazing at this place and seems to be made and owned by authentic Japanese folks. It also has a wide selection of grilled items which I found pretty decent. The ramen burger was a bit too sweet for my taste. Matthew Tartare was a big hit for us. Poke roll turned out to be disappointing since it looked more like a standard cut tuna roll.  Service was generally good though i did feel a bit of impatience from the waitress since we took some time to decide what we wanted even though the place was still quite empty (since we came when it just opened up.). The ambiance was like a sports bar with the World Series playing loudly on at least 3 big screen TVs. Beer is cold.  Overall we would come back and I'm glad we tried this place out.  Dont forget to ask for the free ice cream when checking in on Yelp.

xC8k2ghk6bmo1pBw4K6JHw.text: Delicious, cool decor, awesome service. Our waitress was overworked (her coworker had called out, she said) but diligent and helpful.  And the food was really, really good-- reasonably priced, especially for the quality. Get the takoyaki (octopus balls) and the mussels for the best twists on seafood you've ever had.

PMQCAMMg8-UEledFOHDjsw.text: The host is terrible. We waited for an hour and half like all people who wait for seats. He gave the table to a group as big as ours. He said he called my wifes couple times for our table. He lied and called a Cathleen instead of Celeste. Dont go here for bad service and they dont have common sense. Takes one bad employee to mess it up for this restaurant.

hgyaWAleswlAstgwuAQqQQ.text: Pretty decent place, the service here is very good.  Servers check in with you often, patient in answering questions, detailing the menu.  We went late night, they have a HH from 10PM - close, great prices. We got a bunch of stuff to share: - Tonkatsu & shio ramens (come spicy so if you don't like spicy request mild. These were ok, your basic ramen soup. Nothing special) - Yaki soba (way too sweet, wasn't a fan) - Poke hand roll (basic, pretty good) - Tuna Tartare Yukke (surprisingly pretty spicy, great flavors w/ imitation crab meat underneath and chunks of avocado, raw egg on top) - Pork belly yakitoro (very basic. Grilled pork on a skewer w/ a lime. No special seasonings) - Bream sashimi (not on HH menu, but best thing we ordered. Very fresh, then they take the bones and deep fry for you and bring back. You also have the option of making it into a miso fish bone soup)  All in all - pretty good place. Would come back, especially for the HH prices!

Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tartare Yukke

DqnoI3yDRjOf4km09G1Wfg.text: A hidden gem in Chinatown.  Environment: The restaurant itself is located almost in a hidden location in the back of a plaza near the main Chinatown center. It can be a little hard to find, and the restaurant itself is not too big. However inside they make use of their small allotment of space and have booths, tables, sushi bar seating, as well as a large middle area which could be used for big parties. Additionally, the decorations and lighting make the restaurant fun and cozy.  Food: Their menu is very expensive and ranges from sushi and sashimi to kushiyaki. We could try carpaccio, skewers, oysters, rolls, and much more. The sashimi was very fresh and the oysters were delicious. Additionally, we tried chicken heart skewers which were surprisingly good as well.  Service: Service was good as well, with our server being sure to stop by periodically throughout our meal to check up on us and ask if we would like to place anymore orders (which we usually did).  Overall Izakaya Go is comparable to my favorite Japanese restaurant in Las Vegas, Ichiza, and I see myself coming back to dine here again.

4pgAQQhSbphDxwBJJSS0ag.text: I love sushi and was craving for a place to go as soon as I got into Vegas. We arrived later and was able to find something that was open late on a Sunday night.  The ambiance was small intimate with great music.  The staff were friendly and helpful with recommendations. We saw pictures that other people posted on yelp and was very pleased!  The food was amazing and everything we ordered came fresh with hardly any wait time! The price was very reasonable considering it was sushi. I wish we were able to try everything!

ybW6Ikw5PDGB06a2yO1VsQ.text: Wow... what else can I say? This is a small little restaurant that is easy to miss. We walked in and it was very cramped with the tables close together and very little wiggle room. It's a tight but very pleasant atmosphere. The first thing they do is give you a LOT of menus, I think we had 3-4 on our table for both of us. It's really confusing at first, but once you sort through what each menu is for, then you can start to make decisions.   We started with the Octopus Carpaccio and it was absolutely amazing (see picture). It is pricey, but worth the experience. It was thinly sliced and not chewy at all. Whatever they do to it makes it well worth the price. For our main course, we had the ramen and it was wonderful as well. Lasty, we had some Eel yakitori which was heavenly (see picture).   Another thing worth mentioning is the Green Tea. I don't know what they do to make it taste so good, but it's the best Green Tea I have ever had (and I usually don't like Green Tea).  Lastly, don't be in a rush here. When you order something, keep in mind that they are making it from scratch and you may have to wait a bit. When we ordered the Eel, it took about 15 minutes to get it (at it wasn't very busy). So... have some patience and you will be rewarded handsomely with some of the best food.

Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Can see The Strip from here.
Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Octopus Carpaccio, expensive but amazing!

P21S8-kCQOf7aQGv_W5sGA.text: I come here at LEAST once a week, sometime thrice. The taste and flavor will never fail, Go knows what he's doing. The staff, the food, the Karatamba Sake is all amazing. Their menu is extensive and I'm excited to try new new dishes and be exposed to dishes I would never usually order. If you want awesome food and good company for local price you must visit.

ZJ1bM3FB5eBsJ5xCI-d9Jg.text: We were in town again and went here for dinner last night. We were disappointed because the food was not the same anymore. We asked our server and she mentioned that they change their happy hour menu all the time. And that explains why we didn't find some of our favorite food on it. None the less, service was great.

UPUu2_IvHU5JAtpbs6P4Lg.text: Disappointing, overrated and near disgusting.  We live in Vancouver where Japanese restaurants are plentiful and having been to izakayas in Japan, this place is just wrong.  The texture of the fish in the Poke Chips was tough and did not look nor taste edible.  The bluefin toro was chewy and I had to spit out a piece which I could not fully chew down.  Grilled smelt was bitter and meat was mushy, stale.  Never been to a Japanese restaurant where they put Korean sake on their wine list.  At least the waitress was honest and told us their fish is really not fresh. The decor looks legit but sadly every dish that came out was really off; quality and ingredients not genuine Japanese cuisine.

tkl1jh7MuhfVdj093KCw2g.text: Husband and I went on a Monday night so it wasn't too busy and a lot of parking was available. Upon entering, a nice gentleman welcomed and immediately seated us. It's a small, quaint restaurant, a lot of booths and tables that can seat more than it looks. My husband was surprised the horigotatsu could seat more than 8 people! It was both our first time there so we weren't sure what to expect. The employees were very fast, our orders came out almost immediately. And that was awesome because I was starving! lol. I was excited to try the uni pasta, chawan mushi, and well...pretty much everything. ;) their uni pasta was $17 and it came in a generous portion. It was creamy and filling. They gave a generous amount of uni topping. The chawan mushi was really good as well. My husband enjoyed it (it was his first time). I enjoyed every single dish that we ordered. We will definitely be back again. Checking in on yelp also scored us a free ice cream! I opted for the green tea ice cream and it was the perfect dessert to end our date night.

Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wqCfhg-_3xyTmQO6tJxM3Q.text: Holy snaps!! Did I just walk into Japanese heaven?!? This place is so Amazing!!! Taste & service is over the top!! Kind of regret moving out of Vegas since finding this spot!!

4PLlgXgJye1gy75arkxQlA.text: Decided to go off the Vegas strip to grab some food, and I do not regret it one bit! Izakaya can get pretty packed (especially during their happy hours) so be sure to come early! They do not take reservations.  High quality food esp for the price and the size of the menu, I was not disappointed. I can't wait to return to Vegas for this! Currently, if you check in on yelp, you get a free ice cream!! YUM! The ice cream was very soft and yummy. (They had vanilla or green tea as flavors for you to choose from).  Lots of small plates to share (or order for yourself, TREAT YOURSELF! LOL) We went with 4 people so we ordered quite of bit of food but everything was pretty good!  Takoyaki - yummm Octopus fried flour balls with sauces. It is so good! There's actually decent amounts of octopus in it. The texture is not for everyone because it is squishy with pieces of octopus in it.  Eel fresh water skewer- MUST MUST MUST At first when someone asked me if I wanted eel, I quickly said no thinking it was just like a piece of eel that you get on top of rice. I thought it was a typical eel sushi. I WAS WRONG. This was SOOOOO good. It def tasted fresh, juicy, flavorful.   Fried Chicken Skin skewer - Yes!!! Whatever sauce that comes in it, is pretty good as well. This was so crispy! It was like... bacon! If you love bacon, you'll def love this. Same sort of texture. It small of course, but def so good.   Ramen Tonkotsu -  Skip If you are normally a huge fan of tonkotsu, I recommend you skipping on this. The pork that comes in it tastes REALLY REALLY good, however the broth of the his ramen seemed plain with no flavor. I also asked for it to be spicy.. but again no flavor. I will not order this again.   Ramen Spicy Miso - good. My husband ordered he Spicy Miso to try and much to my surprise it was actually really flavorful, creamy and had way more taste than the other ramen.   Chicken Karrage - Would order it again over Ramen. This was not as crunchy as I had hopped, but it was still good. They had big pieces of chicken thigh. I like to dip it in the sauce and squeeze lemon on it. Chicken Karrage is one of my "i always order it if they offer it on the menu" no matter where I go..   Fried Baby Octopus - MUST Tastes very fresh, very crunchy, squeeze lemon on it. It is like.. calamari but.. octopus. A whole baby octopus. Whatever flour they use to fry it , made it not too hard. Just the right amount of fried.   Pork Belly skewer - good cooked just right, smokey, juicy, even the sauce on it is good.   Fried soft shell crab - so good  - it is fried and soft all in one. It was really good. one order has two soft shell crabs that is cut in half.

photos.caption: Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ySBtVD8hw0V7_urO4GOhVA.text: Such a wide variety of menu items and all very high quality and great tasting food! Typically when restaurants have a large menu like this one, the quality is average... but that's not the case here!  -Yummy sashimi bowls -Yummy skewers -Yummy noodle dishes  -Great service -Great atmosphere  Highly recommend this place!!!

W6MjGvQRNs_mSXGbJafxgg.text: It's no wonder this place has people waiting for a table on a Monday night.  Everything is so good, the sashimi, the fried food, the wagyu carpaccio and also the sake list is very reasonably priced with low markups.  You really can't go wrong at Izakaya Go!

0MY-4nqs_bpdBtVr1lZ7zw.text: Not bad, pretty good Japanese street food, but not the best. We went here because Hot N Juicy was too pack. A lot of tapas. The sea urchin was great and cheap here! Fried stuff was okay, but not rememberable. Limited item on the menu. I don't believe hey had any ramen or udon but I might be wrong. The grilled squid was really good and the cartilage skewers.

RztlZxwcgs3j4kT5_0MWPw.text: A competing restaurant that starts with a H was closed due to a good problem. Came here specifically for Tonkatsu and a poke roll.  Tonkatsu: 3 star , cooked well, but too thick in the coating  Poke Roll: 1 star, dry  They are also quite slow to prepare and serve.

upg88TS2S5LEsb48sHXkZg.text: The food here is phenomenal, I come here somewhat frequently. Rolls are great, salmon collar is to die for. They have a good happy hour too. The service can be pretty bad some nights. But I feel like since I have first been coming here, the service has improved somewhat. I will keep coming back for more tho when I have 90-120 minutes to burn.

R-jxRLb9bmc_HMuID-kKfg.text: Absolutely come by this place. Unfortunately, the lighting is dim. Which is great for ambience but not so great for pictures... haha. So forgive me for the lack of pictures. I got one of the takoyaki at least!  So I thought the takoyaki was pretty good! I would say that the only downside was that it had a little too much dough. But it was crispy on the outside and piping hot on the inside. Just the way I like it :)  The tempura was great for the price. They give you like three pieces of shrimp and a wide variety of assorted vegetables including sweet potato, mushroom, etc. it is a little on the lukewarm side though.   OKAY - now the real reason to come here. THE SKEWERS!!! Yes!!! They do the yakitori so perfectly here. It reminds me of the shops in Japan. Absolutely get the chicken skin, chicken cartilage, and pork cheek. Seriously you will not regret it. Seriously worth the trip here, just to get those.   A couple of downsides, they ran out of the okonomiyaki and the tuna belly skewer... and we were the first customers on a Friday night. So it's a little disappointing. However, this place is still worth the visit, because the meat skewers were really THAT worth it. Yum!

photos.caption: Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9WoTFx7GMzZwVbeyRpFA6A.text: Summary:  Reallly great and fresh sashimi. Came here and was blown away by how great the food was. By the time we finished and left there was a line out the door waiting for ppl to be seated. This was definitely a local favorite and I'm glad I found it!   Parking: 6/10 good parking lot with decent parking   Service: 10/10 great service and friendly staff. They recommended all the local favorites as well as items I have never heard of but said I needed to try.   Pricing: 10/10 for being a quality restaurant the pricing was very reasonable. I think being off the strip allows them to be real with their pricing bc they don't need the glam of Vegas. This place is honest with their prices and it shows with the amount of ppl who come here.    Trend level: authentic Japanese style! Even had tables where you can sit on the floor !   Overall: if I had to come back to Las Vegas this would 100% be a place I come back to.

XvC-MuVcb_GxwVKK3ZBjyQ.text: I love this spot. The decor and the ambiance is spectacular. The menu is unique and fun. Prefect place for happy hour or a date etc..

awm_x0xbmYr9IGWoQfmHrg.text: Im excited to write this review as our last few days have been eventful! Let's start off with  Location: it's conveniently located away from the busier side of the chain of Asian stores and restaurants.   Exterior: plenty of parking spaces as it's on the end of a  shared mini plaza.   Interior: Japanese themed, with low tables and mat for seating, we had our kids so we sat at the booth tables that can fit 3 per side, pretty clean inside and a bar for drinks.   We started with our order of drinks and quick view of the menu and were surprised by the selection! There are so many to choose from I didn't know where to start, everything sounded so delicious and more on the exotic side which is my type of menu. We ordered Tako Wasa which is a very strong scented wasabi raw octopus, miso soup, & edamame as appetizers.   For our mains we ordered soft shell crab, New Zealand green mussels, truffle butter corn, chard pork belly skewers and quail wrapped in bacon.   There is so much to offer and we were very very pleased with the few selections we made and plan on 3+ visits to complete the want to try list! The truffle butter corn & mussels were def a highlight for us. The rush of flavors will give you a  face without disappoint!
