HukD2lQAGYbpWLI4eH8KRQ.text: First time coming during happy hr (starts @ 10pm). We came with a large group.. we called to make reservations for 15ppl and they were accommodating! I didn't think they'd take reservations during happy hour. We actually ended up only having 10ppl show up. We fit comfortably in the middle area where there's a horigotatsu thing going on. We had to take our shoes off when we entered that area. Cute Japanese style. We ordered a bunch of food from the happy hr menu for the table.  We got oysters, truffle edamame, albacore handroll, uni bowl, gyudon, & shumai. Everyone enjoyed the food. No complaints. I ordered the salmon ikura donburi for myself (not part of happy hour). So glad I did, I LOVE their rice! It's True sushi rice. And their salmon was so soft. And I'm glad I liked their ikura. Some restaurants have different tasting ikura that has a chemical taste, in my opinion. But I liked theirs :)  Service was great and they were able to serve a big party. Atmosphere was fun; everyone around us were enjoying themselves also. Great place to come and chill with your friends and enjoy GOOD FOOD!!

1u0wI1qj8SB7tc0nrkWpsA.text: This is a small spot tucked away behind Starbucks and Halal Guys off Spring Mountain. The menu has a smorgasbord of Japanese food, anything from ramen, street food, with sushi rolls, sashimi, and whatever else is on their specials menu at the time.  I don't think they excel on any one True dish. I ordered a variety of things and everything was good but not excellent. I tried the takoyaki, okonomiyaki, yakitori, baked mussels, and more that I can't remember. I've had better versions of each dish in other restaurants. Their uni chawanmushi (egg custard with seafood) is very good, and something that not many restaurants offer.  But if you're here to grab a few beers without overpaying on Japanese food, and you don't want to be too far away from the Strip, this is a solid izakaya.

zpzvpH2o6V5pmZsnQjlS-w.text: I ended up returning twice since my last review; service has been much observant in those two visits. And I've been happy with what I've gotten for food--I've stuck to sushi and grill items, which have been consistently solid. The chutoro nigiri is very, very tasty--good quality fish. So, this is back to being a thumbs up.

BLchBuoxaIwM61v9gwuJMA.text: Great spot for sharing lots of dishes and a bottle of sake with your gal pals.  Grab a cute wooden booth and drink and eat the night away.

r-0TMrYihO6lTFGKaq4RYw.text: PROS: open late, good location to the strip, tontoksu ramen good, cheap prices  CONS: food is average, oysters had a bad smell and were not fresh and were room temperature, ate one and stopped didn't want to get sick, the chicken yakitori with plum sauce was plain and dry, the spicy tuna roll was average at best...they don't have king crab, only imitation crab

jJrV49kyxfNklcLbN3jCCw.text: First night here in Vegas, I arrived at night time and looking for a place where we can have small bites. Their fish was very impressive but the oysters were just ok. Great customer service. Good place for late night Izakaya.

8qhSA9wCbg_IL3J_pwpLgw.text: A great Japanese restaurant that I just found out today. Variety of selection is great, price is reasonable. On Top of everything else, service is beyond expectations. We did not make reservation, but instead of waiting for 10 minutes, the server quickly found us seats in less than five minutes.

Cdl8XHUBnOka3MyYS5UcyQ.text: This is a great Japanese place to go to! Came here for a night snack of tapas and wasn't disappointed. We ordered five things: the takoyaki, pancake, teriyaki chicken, New Zealand lamb skewer, and the night special curry udon. Everything was super flavorful and the right side of crispy. I especially loved the curry udon. It was more soupy than I was expecting, but it was a pleasant surprise! It had rich flavor, perfect saltiness, and a decent amount of meat and noodles with spinach as a topping.   The only con was that the seating space is a little tight, but the establishment is a little smaller. No one was close enough to knock into me or anything though, just a personal preference for more space.   Overall, the service was good, the food came out in a timely manner, and most of all, it was delicious! I would definitely recommend this place to other people.

photos.caption: Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Takoyaki, pankcake, and teriyaki chicken.

aV-ur9R7s-924QWCaVTnuw.text: Always go-to spot after work hours during lvcc market week! Service and food is amazing!!

_fiIhvYkGRM3xlX52ICtXw.text: This is our favorite Japanese place whenever we're in Vegas. Pretty authentic, and reasonably priced. Not cheap, but good Japanese food don't come cheap. We usually stick to the traditional menu, chawanmushi for me, okonomiyaki, takoyaki and some kind of grilled fish for hubby. Tried some of the new menu, not much of a fan there. There's usually too much mayonnaise, and strange fusion of ingredients. Chef is trying to be innovative, but we are just conservative and like the standard stuff.

AniMWUtj9WV_fOKUKFt3FQ.text: We just left this place without ordering.. Walked in. Mentioned it was our first time. Waitress with some-what orange/bleached hair immediately ignored us. Had to mention twice we were new and we're not sure how to order. Just got an "okay" and she walked away. It was obvious she was uncomfortable with us being there. Immediately turned us off. We left.  Never again. How hard is it to explain a menu? Or to smile?   Customers remember the greeting and the good bye.  Going somewhere else.

sufBXsK1pm4rpCHGLblxSQ.text: I came here based on the 4.5 star yelp review. Ordered 8 plates and the Toro had lining which was tough to chew and the sweet shrimp was not even fresh, I could go on and on. The only decent dish was the grilled pork belly. I will NOT be coming back. Only reason for one star was the service, but the food was far from good.

M9Pg1rZUDVYLy_Ohs_4Mhw.text: What a great find!   They have all my favorites.   Unni dumpling was new for me.  Definitely worth trying.   Just wished they had regular hour happy hour.   It doesn't start till 10pm.

photos.caption: Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tako wasa, yellow tail collar, ankimo, sea urchin dumpling, mushroom zosui, chicken meat ball, gizzard, beef tongue, toro.   Yum!!!!

wLUpIrM-rVz6yzT6hZMgSA.text: Great food for late night! Cheap beer, great cocktails, and lots of small plate food to eat. Definitely recommend it for smaller groups. I love the fish and chips and curry rice with cheese.

aaMLXi-010o0owhMYhhCBw.text: This is a really neat place. Especially notable is the truffle butter corn which is amazingly savory. I like to order the shiitake mushroom skewer and add it to the corn. The fish is always fresh, flavorful and great service..A great value for the dollar.

PLt35KCJoxaoeI-5Tz6Bnw.text: Great place!!!! Clean, nice lighting, great great great customer service!! The food was fresh and awesome and if they don't have what you want on their menu they will make it for you!   They had a ramen burger off menu that was huge! It tasted just like a bowl of ramen right in the form of a burger. The meat is soy sauce pork like in typical ramen.   I also had a dragon roll which is also off menu that came out great! The eel was fresh and cut perfectly. It's a great place to come anytime!   It's open from 5am to 2am Monday through Thursday and 5 to 3 am the other days.   Choi was definitely a great waitress that kept me and my company entertained. She definitely lighten up our night.   I definitely recommend this place!

fmr8gPEbZPXUCf65XKiCeQ.text: So the gf and i decided to give this place another try, since our first visit a few days ago was subpar. It wasn't that we had shitty service or the food wasn't good the first time, it's just we never got all the items we ordered...   I must say tho we are glad we came back. We got everything we ordered this time and all the food was excellent. The service was great our server Khiet was really nice and made sure everything was going well... The other two guys that took our other half of our order and checked in on us where awesome aswell...   We ordered the grilled pork cheek with gingered scallions, that was really good!!! Definitely a Must order!! Another dish I really like here is the Garlic squid fried rice, imo it's a must try aswell!!!  We also got the standard Truffle edamame, spicy and California cut rolls. Half ramen with spicy miso, and a bunch of yakitori items...   The happy hour that starts at 10pm is great and I highly recommend giving this place a try!!!

r91GGeFlFz3y1I-FZdRq6Q.text: Love it here. Foods on the cheaper side but super fresh!! Cant ask for much more! Will be back when I come back! Super friendly service as well!!

DB04tMn4X5BBDyOPGnLdqA.text: Just stopped in because of the good reviews and I was in the area. The waiter, Adam, was very sweet and helpful. The dishes he recommended were delicious and the Edamame was the best I've had anywhere!  The atmosphere was fun and lively!

VYhPYpNhfwwSWgtiYfTI8A.text: Arrive early before dinner hour, or call ahead to be certain of a reservation. Everything on or off the menu is a certified delight.  Need to close a sale, or pitch an idea for a movie blockbuster, there is a great variety of beverages and the beer is served Ice Cold...

JMT8htrSz9M4JmeiYm1XMg.text: It was obviously greater restaurant than others. I was here with my business partner during CES in January and had authentic Japanese food as if I were in Japan. Nice  and quick service.  I would return if have next chance to be in LV.

EeNA-0E2kA5iPagxEaz5ew.text: Food was good, but serving sizes were not commensurate to the price, especially the sashimi platters--would list this place as a 3 $$$ vs the $$. The combo platters are good value though.

5m8X5HPy2LE9_A_gDvpz3Q.text: WOW! Great food, great service, great prices. We will definitely be coming back next time we're in Vegas!!

CISXuvQYoL5FCi58VhTkrA.text: Excellent service and food. This place is one of the best Izakaya restaurants we ate at.

ft4ps4m9OFAn4QQXAh6FgA.text: If you go here to have drinks and tapas, you will probably have a good time.  We had done our drinking already and just wanted some tapas.  The seasonings, broths, and sauces were all a bit watered down and our chicken was a bit under-cooked.  The service was very busy serving drinks, which, after all is the main idea here.  So, if you are coming here to party, you will probably have a great time; if you are coming here to eat then you might be disappointed. On the plus side, they are open very, very late and parking is okay.

LZ2Ovof1H34V9P2KL4jjOA.text: Came here for the first time tonight with my husband. The food was wonderful. The sashimi bowl was outstanding and the mixed tempura hit the spot!

9os1bU8ShR4Ys5ZOMf6uKw.text: Amazing selection of food. Everything was incredibly tasty, filling, and surprisingly cheap, all things considered. Will definitely be returning.

oy-z6lXvDW_egQ9czogvAQ.text: This is my new favorite Japanese tapas restaurant. Came here on a Saturday night and only waited about 15 minutes for a table. What really got my attention was their happy hour menu. They have a pretty decent variety on their happy hour menu, which makes me a happy camper. We ordered the fried squid legs (my favorite), spicy salmon rolls, salmon handrolls, half a tonkatsu spicy ramen, chicken meatball skewer, tomato bacon skewer, pumpkin croquette and many more items. Oh my, I was quite surprised by every dish. The service was really good. I will definitely be back!

xwjChNLTE3RyNcK62TVIMQ.text: The aesthetic, atmosphere, food and staff here give this place a good reputation. If it looks crowded don't hesitate to wait, it's usually not that long.   What I order: Buta kakun 5/5 very generous portion. It's not a dry pork belly, its kind of in a sauce but its sooo goood!  Ramen Burger 3/5 Picture worthy yes. Mouth worthy? You can try it out yourself.  Dinner plates (back menu) 4/5 Crazy good portions for the price!   Sushi burrito poke 3/5   Ramen shoyu 2/5 Definitely had bettter ramen but it's decent to get during happy hour.  Pro tip: 10pm-close is happy hour! Don't miss out their selection is huge.

aDo0TFSRn1eEoUFKm4-4DQ.text: Skewers are very small. My husband ordered 7 skewers including two types of chicken wing (not much meat and kind of dry), okra (good), pork belly (delicious), chicken skin (also very good). I had the unagi bowl, while the flavor was ok, there's just not enough eel for the amount of rice. My husband had the ton Katsu ramen, there were literally two pieces of meat in it. The broth was a bit salty. We were 70% full after finishing our food and it was about $25 per person. The ice cream with yelp check in was a nice touch though!

sguY2ejrmnMmd8QsY5-qiw.text: Ramen soup addiction cannot be countered by anything else. Okay well I haven't given any sushi a chance here. I don't even know how extensive their sushi menu is since my eyeballs search directly for the ramen noodles; aside from their skewer apps since it's on a separate piece of paper.  Shiyo and Miso ramen are checked off my list. Next up Shoyu and Tonkatsu. The waitress mentioned they have Tonkatsu ramen now ooooooh :D. I was able to order with the hot oil on the side. It's a killer spicy level and didn't need much to cause nose dripping... No not in my bowl thilly wabbits.  I save the egg for last. Not sure why I do it but always eaten after all my noodles are gone. Please don't watch me too closely when I eat ramen. Uuuuh you'll find me sifting through what's left of the broth trying to get every last bit of noodle. Warning: it might annoy you.   On their skewer appetizer list, we've stuck to the greens: okra, asparagus, zucchini. For a chubby treat we tried bacon wrapped okra. Seven seconds off our lives for each bacon strip? I dunno, then there goes almost half a minute. I think swallowing chewed gum is worse.  So cute in this place. The center of the seating area has a large table for traditional Japanese dining... I think... Cuz guests removed their shoes. But then again I might've seen them sitting properly as if on a bench. It's a cool addition to a dining experience here. This particular table area in the center is like the centerpiece to the rest of the restaurant.  Haven't tried sake yet - surprising myself with that since I used to go sake tasting in the OC quite a bit. So they've got an assortment of bottles displayed on the corner wall and behind the bar. The beers are Kirin and Asahi.  We've been served by the same two people each visit. Just want to acknowledge their hard work. Service is good considering how busy. Keep up the friendliness and smiles. You're doing a fine job.  Looking forward to the next dining splurge. I almost went again tonight. However I didn't want to bore my appetite even though I kept thinking of their ramen noodle soup.  The current Yelp rating speaks for itself. Diners love it - always full house every time I've dropped in. Yaaaay full bellies!!! Stay happyyyyy!

7UCeRvD0pOBboCaokC3tqA.text: Best meal I had in Vegas. Good prices, interesting dishes. I highly recommend the uni pasta, truffle corn, and fatty heart skewers.

PeENd_PhretT48KOlu4Bpg.text: Izakaya is the place to GO ! Food and staff are superb. Their menu is quite huge and always gets me on what to get Becuase of the majority of selections. Such a tiny restaurant and they do get very busy. I ordered their popular dish of Uni pasta which had so many pieces of uni in it.   Also ordered the Tuna belly steak for happy hour which was a lot with a side of rice. My girlfriend ordered the Slamon dinner combo which came with so many side dishes for only $11.   Everything was great and the staff took great care of their customers. Will come back for my late night cravings since they close really late Til 3am on weekends.

oteZjM3uRmBnRsFQgiHu-g.text: Great ramen and okonomiyaki. Not exactly easy to find the latter, but the one we split was delicious. Cool layout and atmosphere for the space they had to work with - perfect for sake and good Japanese eats.

cOzMSV3VpKhFne5EWJLvBg.text: Very good place for Thai food so nice place too open all night I love it good service too

dgA1Yp7TJieXVf0Wf97kbg.text: JUST LIKE HONDAYA IZAKAYA IN CALI  **2017 Yelp 100 Challenge LV #12**  I have literally been WAITING to try this place out and I FINALLY got the chance this year & it was great!!  It was just like Hondaya in Tustin, CA which I have been really wishing would come to vegas so I didn't have to keep choosing that place every time I go back home.   Service was an INTERESTING start.... not too friendly... but once I started to order things got different. All the staff were smiling & coming by to check up on us. They all greeted us bye very loud & genuinely.  Atmosphere is just how I would have imagined it. Wood furniture w/ cushions & has that whole Japanese late-night bar hangout place. Plus they are open late so it's my go-to after a hard day's work!!!   Now since they are a tapas style.... this is what I ordered.  PUMPKIN CROQUETTE $1.50 AGE DASHI MOCHI $3.95 DEEP FRIED SOFT SHELL SHRIMP $6.50 GRILLED MOCHI W/ COD ROE CHEESE $5.95 SAUTEED BUTTER MUSHROOMS $4.95 LIVE FRESH OCTOPUS $14.95 - ehhh I wouldn't order it again   HALIBUT CARPACCIO W/ UNI $14.95 SEA URCHIN PASTA $- lots of UNI flavor yummm TRUFFLED BUTTER CORN ON HOT PAN $4.95- definitely pass on this one cuz it has NO TRUFFLE taste at all DEEP FRIED SQUID LEGS - their squid legs are perfect! GRILLED HAMACHI KAMA $10.95 QUAIL EGG W/ BACON $2.50 CHICKEN GIZZARD $2.25 CHEESE DUMPLING $3.95 DEEP FRIED WHOLE HALIBUT SALMON TARTAR $3.95 GRILLED ROCK OYSTER - these are freaken HUGE!!!JUICYY GIANT CLAM SASHIMI $8.95 SEA URCHIN SASHIMI $18 - they give you this cute little wooden plate filled w/uni!! Love it   There is so much more but I will post in pictures instead.

vjOzCUmilwD-PMgqRjr1JQ.text: By far my favorite casual Japanese restaurant in Las Vegas....hands down....so many items, great pricing, great food.  What I have ordered:  Ramen Burger - Instagrammable as fuck...better than most "Ramen Burgers" i've had and they have slabs of pork belly in the middle instead of a burger patty like most places.  Gindara - One of my favorites with that fatty, buttery, sweet flavor of the Alaskan Cod. Fire.  Okonomiyaki - not the best i've had like the now dead Gottsui in LA (RIP) but respectable enough to get it every single time i'm there....  Omakase Delicacies - 3 small tastings of 3 different delicacies for the adventurous mothafuckas...all i can say is that two are ok but the shark cartilage...fuck that...  Miso Marinated Salmon Bowl - another item we basically get every damn time...fire  Deep Fried Soft Shell Crab - not a fan of soft shell crab because of the texture of basically feeling like you chewing on your nails...  Spicy Fried Rice w/ Jidori Chicken - it's a given, if you fuck up fried rice you def should not have a restaurant...again another item we order almost every time....  Tuna Belly Steak - Good fat portion however lacking flavor and would rather eat most seafood raw....  Skewers - Great selection and flavor  Curry Rice & Beef Steak - Not the best curry in town but the best steak that is paired with curry for sure...especially for the price for happy hour...  Karaage - I grew up on this style of fried chicken...not the best but good enough to satisfy my craving for it...  Dango - Dessert mochi balls that are fire...  Yuzu Cheesecake - subtle yuzu flavor...  I know there is a lot more items we have ordered just can't remember them all...  Highly recommend if you fuck with Ichiza cause between the two you can't go wrong....

KwjEd3_rKMkhBQAiBioqrw.text: Food was amazing, I would recommend the sashimi dinner plate was such a amazing deal. As well got the happy hour salmon tartare and it was delicious. Only reason give this place a 4 Star is due to ordering the grill salmon belly they forgot to put in the order and as well it came out really salty. But over all would come back when i come to Las Vegas every year with my group.

My teriyaki salmon was good just a tad bit over cooked. Overall, I love the atmosphere and its intimate setting.

XIZvBn7vZqa1eFK7C4x6ZA.text: I really enjoy this place.  The variety offered on the menu, they friendly staff, the quality of food.... all terrific.  I'll keep coming back every trip to Vegas.

mwwFOC_kNGqZcYVlea_bcg.text: I legitimately wanted to give this place a bad review SO NO ONE ELSE GOES HERE BECAUSE I WANT IT TO BE ALL MINE!!!! Man I seriously love this place. It's got a quaint atmosphere and is a great place to come watch a Golden Knights game or just sports in general. Their Ramen is superior to every other ramen joint in the valley and they are actually making authentic yakitori which is phenomenal. I have yet to have anything bad from this restaurant which is legitimately my favorite place in town. These people legitimately need to expand their foot print and open up a few more of these joints. This is just a really chill nice place to grab a beer, watch a game and eat some phenomenal food. Don't miss out!

7G38VFq4jTogg04T0Gef0Q.text: In search of an Izakaya Resaurant in Las Vegas, *Izakaya Go* popped up and so I thought I'd check this place out. This is located in Chinatown in a shopping center that's not as busy as the other parts of town. The server who helped us that evening was very nice. The food was pretty tasty and everything I ordered was good, as well as the other orders I sampled at our table.   My order:  ~Pumpkin Croquettes: MmM! ~Crispy Pork Belly with a side of white rice: delightful :) ~Goma-ae: Boiled Spinach in sesame dressing: great side  The only reason I deducted a star was the weird order of the food coming out. First and foremost my food came out first which was cool, but then no other orders were coming out for a really long time. The orders were coming out at random timing with really long gaps.. so basically we all could not eat at the same time. By the time the ramen came out everybody was done eating except for that last person. That was super sad and strange, I don't understand the back up and it was really awkward to watch the last person eat while we were all done.. it's like the last order was forgotten and never placed to begin with.   Overall, a decent spot, with a great variety.. however just beware of the interesting service. (:

H9IlutR1OhyLcz5UDztd4Q.text: Super fun mix of Japanese sushi bar and tapas that have a Asian flair. This was a great discovery. It's open late but we were here early and had lightning fast service and food. Great concept great execution.   Don't get the wings. I got them for fun and they were good but overpriced and maybe the novelty wasn't worth the cost. The tongue, meatballs, pork belly, and yaki soba noodles were awesome. The charm of this place is that you can sample lots of great dishes. Good service. Clean bathrooms.

BgIdsgVrFvx0kRa8SnccTA.text: Loved it!!!! The whole atmosphere!!!! Our waitress- K! (Sooo pretty) My group of coworker/friends/family!  And food was awesome. We are everything so fast, that o couldn't take a picture!!!! Came for a happy hour. Had freshest uni and galore of amazing food. Will come back for sure. Maybe another happy hour? IzBtx4zrXXtoz_TMGPnImQ.text: The worst Japanese food I've ever had.  In addition, the food took forever to come out. We  made reservations, were seated at 5:30p before the crowd, yet sat for a good hour before any food came out. The tempura was heavy & greasy. It is evident that the oil used for tempura is recycled and used for an array of dishes. You can taste "animal fat" when you bite into your vege tempura. No Bueno!!! Everything tasted the same...I guess they have one sauce and use that on all of their dishes. The beer and water were the best things we ordered.

6TofaHFi2b7H7d3ISWfcGg.text: I would not recommend this place, totally way below expectations.  Our chicken gizzards skewers came out in extra petite size. The whole skewer about 1/4"x2.5", smaller than my pinky finger (and i have small hands).  Our fatty chicken hearts (2 skewers) both came out 1/3 burnt, smoked like used up matches  Hamachi collar (grilled fish) was drier than chicken breast, almost shattering that we needed spoon to make any scoop of it.  Foods (there were many others as it was ordered for shared) were very dissapointing: from sushi, salads, fries ... heck, from entree to desserts.  I am awed how they could mess up at ice cream! Like how cheap do you have to go on ingredients that ice cream (vanilla and green tea) could taste so  poor?!  Also, we ordered crepe cake, which came out only after we waited so long that we told the waitress we want to cancel it.  It was also funny how different waitress brought out the cake and the bill, pretending the cake came out before one of the waitress canceled it per our request... there was about 5min waiting between the cancel and the cake and a little less for the bill. The restaurant was not busy at all, and it's a small place.  I m being very generous giving them a 2 star :-(

i5_kGjRSKZi2k48ghGQsvw.text: I was looking for a place outside the touristy area off the strip and I found this gem thanks to Yelp. I was seated quickly and looked over the menu. The server came not too long afterwards and offered some suggestions and I took her advice. The place was small but had a nice welcoming feeling. For such a small place they had a lot of entrees to choose from so I picked a variety of them from each section. The food arrived slower than expected but was definitely worth the wait. The server was very attentive and made sure our water and if anything were needed. Also the person that sat us in the beginning came by quite often to make sure we were doing okay also. Definitely a place to visit off the main strip to eat and relax!

0wgov73yj0FqeuJqcG0JrQ.text: Lost Wages has tons of Asian eateries in the Chinatown Spring Mountain corridor.  Blocks and blocks of Asian strip malls with many opening until late, late in the night.  IG is one of those Izakayas opening until 2am with happy hour(s) special from 10pm to 2am.  This town truly does not sleep.  Their menu is extensive with a large variety of imported fish for Nigiri traditionalists in addition to modern, hip, menu items for those Asian fusionists.  OMG...  stupid comment by me, Las Vegas ain't near any ocean so it's all imported...lol.  Arrived at 9:40pm and grabbed a table with no line.  Took a picture around 9:45pm and wondered what all the Yelp fuss was about as the Sushi Bar and the center Tatami seating area were empty.  In 20 minutes the place was filled with happy hour peeps.  Lots of regulars.... three menus (regular, specials, happy hour) and sushi list brought to our booth table (establishment seats around 60 at most).  Ice Water brought to the table with ice melting before we even ordered (100 degrees outside and comfortable 75 degrees?? Inside) as it took awhile to peruse the various menus.  You'll find something....  Our foursome had: - Imported Omakase Four Fish Nigiri Special (Fresh) - Uni Pasta (Creamy) - Salmon & Ikura Don - Sushi Crunch Burrito - Grilled Salmon Bento - Takoyaki  Overall, a foodie and drinkie place that you should check out on a visit to Lost Wages.  So many choices!!!  Liked the Uni Pasta the best.  Please note -  don't have any belongings visible in the car... they have had break-in problems.

_z50HlOJHZ1gw9vCAl_spQ.text: My friends took me here to celebrate my birthday. What a cute little restaurant in Chinatown. It is very small (maximum 70 capacity) so go early or bring your patience to get a table when it's busy. It was packed by the time we left so it was a good thing we arrived early to celebrate. If you have to, the food is definitely worth the wait!! Everything we ordered was delicious and came out on a timely manner. My favorite was the ikayaki. Perfectly cooked and fresh.  Great service too. They played "happy birthday" music and put candles on my bday cake when they brought it out to the table. Definitely a special touch to a specific occasion!!

S3el2YUxcFatyxdmvay3cg.text: Great izakaya spot without The Strip prices! I ordered the mini uni don, which was deliciously fresh creamy Santa Barbara uni and ikura on a bed of sushi rice, wasabi octopus, bluefin tuna handroll and a vegetarian udon soup. Yesss, this was all for just me and I was one happy and full camper.   The sushi here is fresh and affordable. Can you believe all this and my bill was under $34? Do yourself a favor and take a uber off the strip to grab some amazing Japanese food without making a big dent in your wallet!

86j8OjJLO_HvHam2jM5JEw.text: I'm a fan!   I recently had dinner at Izakaya Go and I cannot think of anything that I didn't like.  The space is small... But that's okay with me. I was comfortable and really enjoyed  the vibe in there.  The menu is pretty big. Appetizers (cold and hot), sushi, sashimi, fried dishes, steamed dishes, stir fry, dinner plates (teriyaki, etc), salads, noodles, and my favorite: grilled dishes and skewers!   We ordered a lot of food: Rock shrimp (fried), grilled beef short ribs, grilled eggplant, chicken thigh skewers, chicken skin skewers, chicken wings, agedashi tofu, crispy pork belly, and an unagi bowl!   My favorite item was definitely the chicken skin skewers. Cooked over coals, they had a slight crunch and a drizzle of sauce.   The service was awesome. Our drinks were never empty, and the food came out at a good pace to keep us "busy" the entire time.   I highly recommend this restaurant. It does get crowded at dinner time so if you don't want to wait for a table, make a reservation or show up earlier in the evening before everyone else shows up!

tB-h2RroAkfsFdrSrALwzA.text: The most recent visit keeps me still a fan of Izakaya Go.  We visited only an hour after they opened on a Thursday so we didn't have to worry about a dinner rush.  Our server was very friendly, kept our drinks fresh and checked on us frequently.   Good stuff  All the pork, shashimi, and salad dishes the table ordered were on point as usual.  Flavorful and fresh all around.  However, this visit I discovered the truffle buttered corn which was fantastic.  I love all three ingredients that make up this simple but flavorful dish and it's a definite must order on future visits.  Izikaya Go continues to be another great food option on Spring Mountain Blvd.   Arigato!

4h9CkWLklJ2TsKIBv0fG9A.text: Quality sashimi here, including amazingly good toro. And Izakaya Go also has Santa Barbara uni on tap. The uni shumai, sea urchin wrapped in soft dumplings, looked great at the next table. Something I should try next time. Another interesting option is the torched uni, it's supposed to arrive with a slightly smoky sear.  Despite being located in a blah crackerjack strip mall, the interior design is nice but it's due for a little facelift. There's also a communal table for large parties with seiza-style seating. The menu is extensive, with ramen being only a small part. Here, your choices are shio, shoyu, or miso ramen, all spicy and all made with a chicken broth base. They also have an excellent sake and soju selection.  I really liked the uni rice bowl. It had about three nice pieces of uni on top of a small side bowl of rice. Really great value at about $11 or $12 each and the taste was good.

ZVrspvcodp4LvpKdYS5T5g.text: Working late and I was in the mood for Cold Soba. Found that this place was still open, so I took a chance. Delicious! Only thing is I wish it was a bigger serving or that I ordered 2. Will definitely recommend! Great place!

UC5H9LF4GMiED0wwc2PBpQ.text: My friends introduced me to this place and I had a great experience.   Sashimi Platter (5/5): 3 pieces each of 5 kinds of fish, all the cuts were very fresh and delicious. Good pricing at $20 too.  Beef Tongue (5/5): no complaints here, good quality.   Chicken Heart (1/5): was disappointed with this skewer, very dry and no taste.  Yaki Udon (4/5): pretty good stir-fried udon.  Overall I had a tasty dinner and would definitely come back the next time I'm in Vegas!

WwV5DkMg7AwxgPWWtiPG1g.text: This place is quite delicious. The yelp wait time said 0, but we waited about an hour around 10:30pm to 11:45pm to be seated. By the time we got our food it was around 12:30am.  The food however, is amazing. The appetizer buta kaku (dunno if i spelled it right, the braised pork belly) was by far the best.   I ordered Ikura Chazuke which was alright, halibut carpaccio which only came with 4 pieces was good but not worth it in my opinion.   Gf ordered Unagi Don which was also expensive but tasted good. Not enough Unagi considering the rice ratio.   Steamed sake clams was yummy and came with roughly 9 clams.  The $1 oyster was awesome and a steal considering they are roughly $2+ per oyster in Hawaii. Maybe it was cheap because of the Happy hour.   Plenty of options here with a big menu and skewer options.  Gave it 4 stars because the wait time was longer than waiting for a pleasant old person who is handicap getting off the bus.  Try it! And my pictures are nice, don't lie

wmWZXDsCDJuJn3vhwx-Khg.text: Went here while in Vegas with some local friends. Got to admit, that this place had pretty good authentic Japanese food. Everything we ordered was delicious and the service was pretty fast too. Two of us had the tempura soba (the tempura was crispy with a decent selection of shrimp and vegetables), a sushi roll, fried rice, gyozas and edamame. My husband said that the fried rice met his approval and believe me, he is an expert on it. One of our friends ordered the beef teriyaki combo-it looked good and he said that it was tasty. The meat was not overcooked and was tender. The edamame was cooked perfectly and had some salt sprinkled on it. Just the way I like them.  We'll definitely go back there next time we're in town. And an added plus is that they are open late and takes reservations.

vSqczd6aSZGRylV8nyCv0w.text: The food was soooo phenomenal that we went back the next night!  We went during Happy Hour and ordered over the course of both days the following: $5 Fried Oysters  $3.50 Fish n Chips (meh) $5 Miso Ramen () $5 Shoyu Ramen (Soy sauce based) $7 Bluefin Sashimi Atari() $4 Salmon roll $5 Shrimp Shumai() $6.50 Curry Rice $3.50 Beef Steak (add-on price) $3.50 Chicken Cutlet (add-on price) $3 Spicy Chicken Wing Skewer (too salty) $4 Chuhai Yuzu Cocktail FREE Hot Tea  The only 'meh' was the Fish n Chips. That was nothing special but EVERYTHING else was great. The Shrimp Shumai was absolutely melt in your mouth. Their Ramen omg is on point. Curry Rice was so good I ordered it again.  Anyway, the emojis and all my photos probably will tell you my rating. But my 10yr old summed it up best in these 2 sentences.   Her belly complained: Why are you giving me all this food? And she replied: I actually want to eat more but I'm so full I can't.

photos.caption: Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $2.75 Spicy Chicken Wing Skewer (too salty)
Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Day 2 repeat orders
Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $5 Shoyu Ramen

EkxgD55tqZOwZyfI53WIgg.text: It's been quite some time since I've been back to Izakaya Go, mainly because it's not the best place to bring your kids. :) The staff is welcoming and the restaurant environment is very chill but it can get a little tight in there.  As far as variety of food - this place has a lot. They have a daily specials menu which is always good to try. The chefs do know what's best for the day, after all. On to the food!   We started with the fresh shigoku oysters - super fresh, meaty and clean tasting. Perfectly dressed and lightly sauced with ponzu. Highly recommend it if you're into raw oysters.  Ankimo- monkfish liver - every Japanese restaurant seems to have their own way of preparing it - this one was delicious. It was not gamey at all and had a great texture. I just wish there was a little bit more for the price.   Next up - omakase nigiri of the day - uni, rock shrimp, yellowtail and tuna - all super fresh and of high quality. A good value at $15 for these 4 pieces of heaven  Skewers (aka yakitori) - you can't go to an izakaya and not get some skewers! Beef tongue was marinated nicely, not gamey. Great texture. Okra hot off the grill is amazing if you've never tried it. I figured I'd try chicken breast with (fresh) wasabi and it was quite delicious.   Black pork sausage - very good. Perfectly seasoned, grilled to perfection. Served with ketchup and mustard.   Stir fried chicken liver - slightly gamey but full of flavor and delicious if you're into it.   Uni risotto -  that's all I have to say. If you like uni and you like risotto, you better just order it.

j1LGcA3-sBe4fm6iwGUztg.text: I am a regular in Vegas and visited numerous restaurants (especially Japanese restaurant) there.  In short, this is THE BEST authentic Japanese resaturant in Vegas.   The style and taste resembles the ones I had tried in Japan.  Some of the fishes they serve are from Japan as well.  I would recommend to order their "special of the day".  Now, they don't always have everything, but that's just very normal when it comes to sea food.  Tip:    If you sashimi a whole fish (it's like $20, for now), you can ask the server to take the head and make it into miso soup (cost extra) after you finish the dish.  It's worth it.  Also, the wasabi comes with whole fish are top notch, must try.  The only thing I am a little bit disappointed is the sting ray fin (no, this is NOT shark fin).... the quantity has been greatly reduced lately, but quality is still decent...oh well...  Note that this place does not open during the lunch time, and you better go early or late.... unless you are willing to wait in line.  Uni (sea urchin)'s origin can be different from time to time, check with Chef or owner if you are a very particular/advance Japanese foodie.  With that being said, so far I haven't had anything disappointed by their uni or raw food, not even once.

Y6Sgeycg0K1bdrIZEab_1Q.text: Izakaya Go is the best Happy Hour in town. Food is bar style and prices are pretty much all under $5 to get you full and under $4 for drinks to get you drunk on a budget. Make a reservation (pro tip) for a 10pm happy hour and people watch and eat and drink some great food. I've had good and not so good experiences here over the years but I keep coming back which says something about the people working there and the whole vibe of the leg night crowds.  Izakaya Go is always a a go to and a recommendation for any late night diner visiting this great city.

18Ul6KTv99gOmJgStQoCRw.text: This place was very relaxing . I loved the environment. It was chill . The workers were super cool and helpful . The crowd was chill . The place is very small . So we sat @ the bar which was great !!! The food was good .

WLNjQ8YE9JaV1dh0VO75ag.text: My friends and I wanted some good sushi off the strip. After doing a search on Yelp, we found Izakaya Go. We showed up right as they opened at 5 PM and that was a smart move as the place is not so big and it was fully packed by 5:30. We ordered a variety of dishes. Keep in mind, this is like a tapas size portion which makes it perfect for a group to try out a variety of things. We ate sashimi, beef tongue, pork belly, pork cheek, ramen soup, and a few other things. The food was phenomenal and the service was just as great. The prices were very reasonable. Be ready to wait a little as you sit back and enjoy your beer, cocktail, or sake. Don't worry, they take their time to make sure you are getting the best possible product from presentation to the explosion of flavor that comes with each dish. Highly recommended!

eP_zbLjeW1E2l-Dl13NsjQ.text: Excellent, Good Price, Fresh Food  Izakaya is excellent.  The service was good.  I would highly recommend this place.  I was a little hesitant to try it after experiencing Kyara and being let down, but it was a great experience.  The oysters were fresh and tasty.  The sashimi was excellent.  The small dishes were great!  I'm looking to coming back again and trying all the other dishes.  So far, I've tried the corn, enoki butter, oysters, sashimi (5 ways), uni dumplings (yum!), asparagus with bacon, and probably some other dishes that I'm forgetting.

LSgBLxqNKxruthy6xE9Uqg.text: Food and service is excellent. Had stir-fried squid legs in garlic butter, okonomiyaki,  stir-fried chicken gizzard with garlic greens, sashimi salad, yakisoba, and grilled mackerel. :)  We loved everything. The grilled mackerel was the highlight for me.

GVElrsMCxQWU-qMobCV3-Q.text: Good came early and beat the dinner crowd everything was delicious. Otoro was awsome along with the kamakazi roll

Cu8y0HGGDRZX5IR9c2FJGw.text: My friends brought me to this place for the first time and I fell in love with the aesthetic atmosphere and the type of food they serve. I finally got to try the pork belly but it was great! Pork belly's usually doesn't last long so take that into consideration. Another great thing about this place is that they are open late. Also happy hour is 10pm - close (2am or 3am) It's a perfect after work type of place! Staff has been always friendly to me and even make me laugh at points. Very enjoyable experience and I would recommend anyone that loves tapas, sushi, great backgrounds and a nice environment to go check out this place.

QR4Dsa7DGri_KvlA3iFyTw.text: If you are looking for a home far from your home, you can come here to feel warm welcoming hospitality by people working here and its food.  Nothing to do with Teppanyaki, they serve Sashimi and Sushi truly based on seasons and a "real" grilled chicken, Yakitiri that you can experience authentic Nippon!! Also, you can enjoy Sapporo draft beer from tap in order to refresh the heat in Las Vegas.   !!

Br-MSvKOfNGwtUvNQrBY1g.text: This is one of my favorite restaurant in Vegas!  I probably come here at least once a week or more.  They have the most extensive menu.  Love Poke Chips, Fried Pork Belly, Shishito Peppers and Shoyu Ramen Spicy is to die for... Try it, you won't be disappointed..... And the service is exceptional.

4QhOJE-5FyZFcCYBE8JYTA.text: All around great experience. Very warm and welcoming environment. Good service. Excellent dishes. Well crafted and thought out menu. Eat here.

hoP672DDm8Cdj0O__ipSUg.text: I went this place with my best friend and we ordered Tako wasabi, Beef tataki, Tanuki Udon and, Tonkatsu go combo and shared. I'm glad I found this place and definitely gonna go back again if I ever visit Vegas again.

QeVKELDqjPWH1CEJkVhzxw.text: Cute little restaurant to stop by if you're looking for an affordable meal in Las Vegas. My boyfriend had the salmon combo meal. I opted for a poke bowl. Their miso soup is so good! The combo meals are a great deal. There's plenty of dishes in each combo. The poke bowl just came with rice and some seaweed. Wish it came with some veggies.

hYiKJje5eua6kRPqSaKv9Q.text: We liked the ambience, food, service, menu depth, price... There is not much not to like about the place! Sashimi is amazing and lower priced than competition. Braised pork belly is amazing. Server was very helpful. One of the best Japanese places we have been in a while.

4yxcNNCptEdBOhWGoEEyLg.text: Authentic Japanese not far from the strip. It is very crowded during dining hours. I waited 30 minutes for a spot at the counter at 8:00 pm in January. Service was okay. Only checked on me a few times, but when they did check on me it was courteous, kind, and prompt. The food was great except for the ramen. I love ramen and it tasted like Americanized ramen. The noodles were like spaghetti and the broth didn't taste like it had been made from scratch. On the other hand, the takoyaki is the best I have had in America.  Come here for me everything but the ramen. For that go up the street to Ramen Sora or Monta Ramen

IFGiUQKmCvpWozVJpEWA5g.text: Incredibly fresh and amazing quality! Ordered the Chu Toro sashimi, which was a steal at $13.95, and it was the BEST buttery tasting piece of raw fish I'd ever had!  Was so delicious ended up ordering 2 more orders.  Also had the Amberjack Sashimi and the quality was on point.  I'm a big fan of Naked Fish because of the quality, but Izakaya Go had fish just as fresh and high quality at a fraction of the price. Firefly Squid- YUM! tiny itty bitty baby squid served raw with a miso sauce.. To die for.. So amazingly fresh! Poke bowl had high quality tuna, Ramen Burger was savory, the pork cooked to tender perfection.  Seriously considered ordering extra noodle "buns" to take home with me to snack on later.   Huge menu selection, lots to choose from for everyone, had so many intriguing items.   Owner himself took the initial order, staff super friendly and accommodating, great atmosphere, comfy seating.  Honestly wish I found this place earlier.  Been going to Ichiza for years but will definitely make the switch to Izakaya Go for Japanese tapas!   Recommend that you go now while they're still in their initial stages of opening- this place WILL have a wait once people start realizing what a great little restaurant this is.

oEf7_ZvudrR13PRyK92ZUw.text: We have found our go to Izakaya in Vegas!  Don't miss this place sitting in a corner of a strip mall hidden behind another just south of Spring Mountain.  Once you find it, you won't regret it.  Love that it's bustling with crowd, servers are efficient although dishes come quite slowly, and the food is favorable to Ichiza.  Battera was better than Ichiza although not as good as Yu-Yu's, and I found other items to be fresh and quite good.  While I only had a hot sake, they have a good choice of bottled sakes to choose from.  Be prepared to shell out some $ for those though...  Table-for-1 Factor:  It's an izakaya, so I don't think you'll want to sit here alone.  But they do have bar seats.

-xQchIkmIYVQxRQ-aVH-nQ.text: Best Japanese food in Vegas! No questions asked! They have a huge menu so coming here never gets boring. Love the music and vibe in there. The Chef, owner (Go) and staff do a wonderful job.

i7C3YJOVNqyD3Jg8G18oNw.text: I was actually a little disappointed in izakaya go, the interior was a little small but didn't pose a problem finding a seat. We ordered the Takoyaki, cooked ika tentacles in butter, uni pasta, and the ramen burger (both their most popular dishes). The uni pasta when it came out had a funky smell which was not appetizing at all, but the smell was deceptive. The pasta was rich and creamy, and tasted of a light fishy version of an Alfredo with onions and..who'd of guessed it? Uni. The Takoyaki was okay and came with 10 pieces, but I really didn't see anything out of the ordinary in this dish. The ika had a good flavor of light citrus and butter, but had a crunchy uncooked texture rather than the tender texture like the ika butter at kyaras tapas. I wasn't a fan of the texture since it was a little more difficult to chew and digest. The ramen burger wasn't very much impressive either. It just tasted like soggy ramen smothered in pulled pork and onions. The sauce was too strong on it, and the ramen buns had a very unappetizing texture and plain flavor. Service was mediocre, our waitress was nice but when our food came out, our chef looked very annoyed or uninterested and spoke very quietly and monotoned like he just wanted to leave and go sleep in the corner.  Over-all, for a fine dining establishment, I didn't feel the fine dine experience at all and left a little dissatisfied. I probably wouldn't come back, but i suppose it's worth a try if you haven't ever been yet.

_G1jnP06mr1X7rDbi-FoCA.text: Went to this restaurant on a road trip back from colorado with my gf and my bro. We were all pretty hungry as we had been driving all day in an effort to get back to LA ASAP. My bro and I split an order of the albacore sushi and the spicy tuna rolls. I ordered baby octopus as we all finished eating since I was still a little hungry. He ordered a poke sushi burrito. My gf ordered the shoyu ramen. We also ordered a few beers.  What I enjoyed about the restaurant: -Awesome fresh tasting sushi at a pretty reasonable price. The amount of food and the quality are both definitely worth what we paid.  -My gf enjoyed the meat in her ramen and we both enjoyed the texture of her noodles. -The beef ponzu was seriously on point. The texture of the beef and the umami flavor of the ponzu sauce was pleasant while also not being too salty. It came with two dumplings, rice, and two edamame-looking peppers, and a light salad with a pretty flavorful dressing (again, not too overbearing flavor wise).  What is left to be desired: -The service is definitely wanting. Other customers at one point felt kind of dissatisfied with how long their food was taking. I ordered a small order of baby octopus while still in the middle of our meal and it took over twenty minutes after I ordered that dish until it finally came out. It's a relatively small restaurant; sorry, but I view that as poor service. -The broth of my gf's ramen did not taste particularly appealing. It had a slight fishy taste even though the ramen she ordered came with pork- I find this a little strange. She also ordered the ramen extra spicey; this ramen was not even remotely spicey.   Overall, I enjoyed my experience here and left satisfied and full. It definitely hit the spot. There are SEVERAL amazing restaurants in Vegas however, so it may be a while before I come back to this restaurant. Considering the value for my money, I don't see why I wouldn't- just not anytime soon.

oJtmun4J6mDCAP6j4M2b_g.text: This is one of the best Japanese tapas joint I ever had.  love the wide range selections.  Definitely coming back.

csJrdBV_axMeKw08kxLDWw.text: Very relaxed easy-going Japanese tapas stop. A good variety of sake, happy hour prices and extensive menu.

jKU0TmUBkFcCfHHUaLDc0w.text: I had a great time.   Daikon salad, shishamo fish, tako wasabi, softshell crab and more. The service was great. When a mistake was made, they were quick to apologize and always thoughtful.   The only advice to the business, you shouldn't spread out the timing of the food delivery.  We were finishing everything and two more plates were nowhere to be seen.  I would be hesitant to order several plates for this very reason. Keep them all coming.

Ac1D2ALifDABtGELS0HHTQ.text: The only reason I give this place less than 4 or 5 is because we were there earlier than just about everybody else but our food came later than everybody else's buy a while. The food was quite good though other than the sushi burrito, that I could have done without. The ramen was cooked to perfection and the large sake for $3.25 was quite a deal.

E1XVMeXWYwiNuM4JPhxluA.text: My boyfriend and I ordered ramen here and had mix emotions lol. I liked it but its just not as creamy as the other ramens that ive tried. But the flavor was alright. The broth was salty and spicy and pork was on the sweet side. We were not really an fan of the sweer pork tho. But it was a good blend to the spicy and salty. My bf ordered Spicy Miso Ramen and I ordered Spicy Tonkatsu Ramen. We also ordered soft shell crabs. Its not very crunchy compared to others that we tried tho.

dP49Pir4lAKKEW5C-HuVnQ.text: Great place, good service, all the servers had a positive attitude!   The food was great. We tried the appetizers clams and soft shell crab.  Main course was some udon soups and the yakisoba noodles. Their rolls were just right with just amount of rice.   Will definitely come back!

nJuCRn6euj_rxtvhZT22SQ.text: ***DO NOT COME HERE. IT'S NOT SANITARY***  I hate writing bad reviews but this one was a must. Found this place on Yelp and wanted a change from the food on the Strip. First of all, parking was terrible. It's in a little strip mall with limited parking as all the competing storefronts were vying for the same spots. When we walked up to the restaurant, we weren't sure if it was even opened because the storefront was so dark. Upon entering, it didn't look too busy and we were quickly seated in the booth.   Let me start of with I love izakayas. I've been to many in New York City and always had wonderful experiences. Japanese tapas-styled restaurants that let you try a little bit of everything and provides for a casual and comfortable dining experience, what more can you want? Having said that, I really wanted to like this place due to all the glowing reviews it had.  The menu was very vast as expected with a regular menu and a board with the specials for the day. I came with my family so we for our appetizers, we ordered a rainbow roll, a salmon avocado (Alaskan) roll, sashimi platter (3 kinds of fish), takoyaki, and beef tataki to be split amongst the four of us. For entrees, we got the shoyu ramen, kake udon, and yakisoba, and poke salad.   The octopus in the takoyaki was a little cold but nonetheless it wasn't bad. The batter was nice and light and the sauce and dried bonito shavings were good. None of the fish for the sushi and the sashimi seemed fresh at all. The beef tataki was forgettable. Now onto the entrees, the portion sizes seemed a little smaller than I'm used to but that's fine because we did have a lot of appetizers to fill our bellys. The broth was ok but wasn't super rich with flavor. A little on the bland side. But right as my mom started eating her kake udon, she but into something crunchy in the spinach. She split it out to see what it was and it was a aphid in her spinach! She didn't want to make a scene so she just pushed it away and stopped eating it. But one of the employees came and wanted to see what was going on. We told them what happened and showed them the bug and they just stood there staring back at us. Then the waiter brought over another waiter to examine and they both stood there as if they were unsure of what they are looking at and walked away. Even if you aren't sure, good customer service is to try to correct your mistake. Not that we wanted it but to offer to make my mom a new one or take it off our bill would be the right thing to do! It's the thought that counts instead of standing there gawking at us and not doing anything. It just ruined the meal. Even with the terrible service, we still decided to give the 15% standard tip, which I believe they definitely did not deserve. I know how hard it is for waiters to earn money but still their behavior was unacceptable.   Food was less than great here but still it didn't warrant a one star rating until my mom found that bug in her food. If there was better customer service to fix the situation than that would have helped but the service here is inexcusable. They need to clean their vegetables better. If my mom found this, I wonder how many other things they have done that were unsanitary that went unnoticed. AGAIN I REPEAT DO NOT COME HERE. I don't understand how it got such a high rating.

4h6MsnsCVflCEM7DPyXafg.text: I thoroughly enjoyed stopping here for dinner after work one day. I love that it is small and reminds me of those small restaurants that you seen the alleys of Tokyo. The food was very good and the selections were great. There's some things that you crave that aren't on every menu in a Japanese restaurant such as cheese corn done right. I would definitely come back here again.

kk9KEMApgKk2IHh6PcsvaQ.text: Owner was nice and showed us some of his prized dishes. Lots of variety and a korean dive bar atmosphere. I would come back and try some other dishes

6nFAZLLuR3DVIZva5AMKEg.text: Authentic food , good prices.  Staff very friendly , and they speak Japanese if needed.  You can reserve the big table if you call ahead with a big party.  I had a good time with my group, I can't think of anything I got that I didn't like.

7SdSF9aP4h12lA4IdR8ARw.text: Came here twice. Had the yakisoba and takoyaki (fried octopus balls). It was good. The prices are good too and they're open till 2 am if you're hungry late at night. It's just a few minutes off the strip. This will be our go to place when we visit Vegas again.

1SXHY006UnffPDbqmLSkyA.text: I love love love this place. My favorite is the salmon sashimi, and the uni tray is so fresh! I always come here with my husband and friends every week. The atmosphere is so casual and you can spend hours here without even realizing it. The staff is always so friendly and attentive. They always greet me by name when I go! Brian is the best ever! He's so nice and funny! Hahaha. I'll be eating here for years to come!

EbJgN7tblzS7IrmgaO8AYQ.text: Everything tasted fresh and delicious . I'll be back soon , FOR SURE !  Worth to try it out , not expensive and such a welcoming small place .  Thank you!

J4gjCZJL1G8MCryTronPnQ.text: The food here is good and well priced. The happy hour has great deals but you can always score a deal off their ongoing specials. On my last visit I was really excited to order some yakitori skewers but I waited over an hour and had to ask if they were ready and hadn't been started yet. The restaurant was really busy so I understand but a heads up would be nice when something is going to take over an hour. The restaurant could've used another waitress. It's very small and tight space but it is always packed. Good prices and good food. Great for HH and drinks and tapas - as for a True dinner I'm not so sure.

hgngRVNJSCURMnc-o4ePUA.text: One of the best Sushi quality for the price I have ever had. Very good atmosphere, great beers, great desserts (did I say it's cheap!). Easy parking outside, happy hour and close late, I can't ask for anything more.

Yy5guBFFWzxBSh9d2TBqDQ.text: Love the tofu yakisoba. We came here twice within 3 days. If you don't want all you can eat buffet or pricy food on the strip, here is definitely the place come. Their takoyaki is tasty and crispy. Love it.

FDSOYFwASfddnH4BCEBPeA.text: Amazing foood!! Fresh fish all day! Good happy hour specials and friendly service! Literally so good were only half way thru our plates and i had to make this review

41MWbHfVF1DtE742UrpvQA.text: Fabulous, just fabulous. The sashimi was fresh, generous portions and everything was tasty to the palette. My girlfriend who lives here in Vegas took us here tonight and we will be back!  Service was excellent, our waitress was polite and always came around to make sure we were happy.

photos.caption: Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sashimi combo platter. All this food for less than $19. And we left stuffed!

pJVcKmbFzwN7Lg0wG4rteA.text: Just found my new favorite Japanese restaurant!  In Vegas there's so many  so called Japanese restaurants and their main attraction is sushi, not Izakaya Go. There's so much selection, that I'll definitely be going back and back again to try them all!   Salmon and Tuna Sashimi: One word. FRESH! Presentation is on point too.  Kara Age: fried chicken here is delicious! Cooked perfectly.  White fish tempura: Japanese friend of mine recommended it to me. If I was by myself I would have never ordered it. So good, the fish is so light and fluffy. My favorite so far.  Beef carpaccio: it is slightly cooked, not entirely raw. This too is delicious, the slight crunch gives it so much texture that you have to have more.  Enoki with butter: another dish that was recommended to me by my friend. And am glad I tried it. I've never had enoki before, it does have the mushroom consistency we all know, but it is a bit chewier than I expected. The richness of the butter and the chewiness of the enoki go hand in hand.  Yaki Soba: by the time the dish came I was so full from all the rest! The noodles were cooked great, and has nice flavors.  Black sesame mochi: I've never had black sesame flavored mochi before and had to try. It was delicious! It was sweet with little sesame seeds inside. I loved it.  Presentation: all the foods are pretty to look at. The beef carpaccio looked like a work of art! The chef makes sure it looks good, as well as taste good.  Service: service is excellent. If one of my waitresses was busy with someone, another waitress made sure we were ok. Drinks were constantly refilled, and our waitress' sometimes stayed and chit chatted.   Chef: I spoke with the owner and he said their chef has 10 years experience in Kyoto! This food here is as authentic as they come!

photos.caption: Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Asparagus with bacon. Everything is good with bacon!
Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Enoki w/ butter. Soooo delicious!

Z2-UZVFvDLgA7iDnGZHTiw.text: The uni pasta was hands down bomb. All the other stuff was good according to my fam--poke chips, crunchy roll & takoyaki. I had the 3 fish sashimi platter...couldn't go wrong with tuna, salmon & yellow tail. The salmon skin hand roll did disappoint, b/c I'm used to some salmon on my crispy warm skin even in a no-carb hand roll. This was straight up super crisp falling apart salmon skin only. Maybe just not the style I was accustomed to, but now I know! Good service and would love to try the big party table in the center with floor seating like in Japan!! Looks like it would be a cool experience. Next time

x2qz5R_9PTHXFcwdT-FJQA.text: Their miso ramen is one of the best ramen I've had in the U.S.  Definitely hits the spot for a hangover.

8jExHmA1NjHXMvmJIldSWA.text: I been to this location a few times. The beef tongue is great at reasonable price. The oyster is very fresh. The fish is also fresh..will come back again and again...

hCb5_Rg_RrqDQfiItAgCGQ.text: So we went here because we were in Chinatown looking for supper.  Trusted my Yelpers and went here for Izakaya.   Sadly, we ordered items that we weren't to our liking...the only dish we really enjoyed was the poke, takoyaki, and the chicken skin yakitori.  What wasn't didn't taste great were the uni dumplings (a weird paste filling), and pretty much all the yakitori.  All the yakitori needed salt, and all needed a bit more char.   The menu is huge, so maybe we ordered the wrong things, I'd like to think if we gave it another shot, it might be better.  In the end, for 4 of us with 2 pitchers, the bill was $250.00, definitely pricey for what we ate.

kGmkLuLvFyCdueYgzJPBBw.text: late night dinner before driving home  so many things to choose from! had chicken skin, fatty heart, ramen, and sashimi platter.  everything tasted good and so affordable! would come here at least once a week if i lived here

CIPrZJKK7gOJ6oTTAJA_0g.text: We went off the strip for dinner. It was really good. I didn't even know that there is a "chinatown" in Vegas. We were a group of 6 and checked all in to the restaurant, so we got free ice cream as a dessert. Unfortunately they only had green tea and vanilla. how about chocolate too? We will come back!

J35VjE3FMjIpPy9-IwlJRQ.text: Great place to enjoy authentic kushiyaki. Reminds me of Japan,  $ is very reasonable for the great quality of ingredients. Thank you Chef Go I got to meet him he is a laid back dude.

Z1tIIUWvhDxT9JrLjVmPEg.text: Worth the wait for happy hour!  hubby got the tuna steak which was delicious! He also enjoyed the deep fried shrimp skewers. Half bowls of ramen are always good. That's what we got our daughter  best believe mama got a Kirin draft!  lol I also got the tako wasa but it's not on happy hour. Anyways I like it for happy hour.

BuXfAH0Em7E5kQYIt6YL8g.text: Came here after attempting to eat at my favorite place on Spring Mountain and they appear to be closed permanently.  As far as Izakaya Go, their food was good.  I had the Karaage Chicken dinner with miso soup, salad and rice.  Everything was good.  Service was a little lacking but not a major deal.  The chicken gizzard yaki-tori stick was really good and the crispy pork belly was awesome.

XDLca7yyU2teNlm-ZH8Lfg.text: Favorite Japanese restaurant in Las Vegas. Everything is very authentic, and best of all, affordable!!  I would recommend this to anyone and is very close to the strip.  Great service and better food

Rdf4v0rOzDxeh1jV1o35dQ.text: This place is the business. They have such good deals on their happy hour menu. I got a table worth of food with my friend and multiple drinks for only $15 per person at the end. Although their happy hour menu is limited to those items, you can still order from the regular menu if you're really craving something. Also, the Japanese decor of this restaurant is awesome. I really felt like I was in a little village hut while I was in there. Finally, they're open until 2am! I literally didn't show up for dinner until 10 and hung out til they closed. This place is a gem.

pIj1bGsUu6uE8PkuZV2yyg.text: So good!!! I would definitely love to come back here whenever I visit Vegas. We ordered a lot of dishes and everything was really good. Everything came out in a timely manner, and they checked up on us regularly. This place has a lot of variety on their menu. You def need to come back a few times to try everything that looks good!

55wM8oKHVgcpPnP2NSF2bA.text: This place was just alright for me, but it's probably only because I tried a small part of their menu since it was my first time here.   I got the Ton Katsu, which tasted okay. The "salad" under it didn't even have any sauce so I didn't really eat it. I feel like having it served with rice would have been more appropriate.   We also got skewers: Pork Belly and Tuna Belly. Get the tuna! It was pretty good. I also stole a few bites of my cousin's Yakisoba and that tasted nice too.   I had a good experience overall, I just wish I got lucky with what I ordered. Service was great, too.

JPeUEpbQTLymUJ-9CkiXgg.text: I came here because I was looking for good Okonomiyaki in Las Vegas. The Okonomiyaki here was excellent. Everything else was really good too- sashimi was fresh and I could tell that food was prepared with quality in mind. I will be back!

4bix-PAPyfvBQuZKJfboxA.text: Who would have thought you could get such authentic Izakaya in a strip mall off the Strip in LV?  The setting itself is cozy and reminded me of a Japanese restaurant, not some linoleum covered fast food joint.  We ordered a variety of dishes and all were very tasty.  The service was excellent.  It wasn't busy but you could still tell they wanted us to enjoy our meal.    Restaurants like these are the best reason to rent a car in Vegas--get out of the casinos with their overpriced food.  I would definitely go back.

eSBCxzbOsFpUPHdKMTyJeg.text: WOW! Talk about food-gasms! Tucked away in the far left corner of chinatown, this restaurant is a hidden gem among the many asian establishments on Spring Mountain Road. It seems like they have everything here in terms of Japanese cuisine! What initially attracted me to this restaurant is that their menu is very unique. I can promise you that you won't find many of the dishes here at other establishments. Prices are affordable and realistically reflect the quality/quantity of food that you are getting. I love the authentic atmosphere of the restaurant. It feels almost like you just walked into a restaurant in Japan! The entire staff are very courteous and polite which only adds to the restaurant's ambience. I must have seen the waiters/chefs bow their heads seven or eight times to other guests throughout my entire meal. I also love how they have a large dining area in the center of the restaurant where there are no chairs available and guests dine by kneeling on cushions laid on the floor (just like in Japan!). My brother and I were feeling adventurous tonight so these are what we ordered: 1. Sea urchin dumpling: Fish cake with some sea urchin on top, wrapped into a dumpling; steamed. Creamy. Tastes great with their signature soy sauce. My only complaint with this dish, of course, is: it could use more sea urchin. 2. Chutoro: Simply fresh & delicious. A bit fatty but much leaner than otoro.  3. Ocean trout sashimi: Reminds me of salmon, tastes like salmon...but it is not salmon.  4. Ankimo Ponzu (steamed monkfish liver with ponzu sauce): Light, creamy, a bit salty. Not as earthy as you'd expect from your regular liver.  5. Beef Tataki (beef sashimi with ponzu sauce): This dish was a bit disappointing because we were expecting raw beef but instead we got over-seared meat. Still good, but could be better. Make sure you let your server know that you're expecting sashimi style. 6. Tako Wasa (raw octopus marinated with wasabi): This dish surprised me! The spiciness of the wasabi really enhanced the flavor of the octopus. It is not as slimy as I expected (which is only a good thing).  7. Sea urchin sashimi on wooden tray: Don't let the picture fool you, there's not THAT much sea urchin because the sea urchin are thinly sliced. It is definitely the go-to dish if you need a little sea urchin fix. Sweet & creamy in flavor. 8. Vanilla ice cream: We got it for free by checking in to Facebook.  Definitely the best vanilla ice cream that I've ever had. No joke. Rich & creamy, reminds me of Haagen Dazs ice cream, except much... much better.

Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our complimentary scoop of vanilla ice cream!!!
Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef tataki (beef sashimi with ponzu sauce)

If you're on the braver side and want to try something u never had before, just ask the owner GO what's he's got off the menus  ENJOY!!

TVJkbX0DX1rL_3sTcfEgGg.text: They took very long to serve me and my family, food was okay... portion size and price were bad as well. I would not come back here.

-SvTXaSvC1HcGc5wdWzvlw.text: I used to love this place, but the other night my Gf and I waited 25 min for a table. We were waiting for a Table for 2, cuz I despise eating at the bar.  Alas our table for 2 was called, and we were stoked cuz we were both starved!  10 min after ordering one of the servers came back to our table (that seated us), and said I responded to the wrong name.  I'm like "Dude, I wouldn't respond to a name thats not mine..." so than he switched it up, and said oh well I made a mistake, I have to move you....  I'm like Okaaaay, I need a table. He's like we only have the bar. Wouldn't have waited 20min for the flippin table to end up at the bar; the bar seats were open from the beginning.  All you have to do is apologize and comp drinks or something.  Last I checked, this is F&B, its only customary..... My average check in there is $75, so there lack of empathy, no apology, means I'll take my biz elsewhere.

hQmkKeMBK5lLCky-lHpKEg.text: Izakaya Go somewhere else for great Izakaya! Lunch was okay but dinner was a huge letdown.  Service (from the owner) was great the first time we came in for lunch! We shared tempura, salmon and chicken lunch combinations, and while nothing wowed us, the service and promising looking dinner menu made us want to come back right away to check out dinner. Our first time in for dinner we were eating light and just came in for a few items at the bar...nothing was bad, but nothing would bring us back. We were the only ones in the restaurant and service was inconsistent as they had just opened and were still preparing for the evening shift. Our server (and the small staff in general) was in the back of the house the vast majority of the time, but the specials board as well as a few menu items sounded too good for us not to return. On our third visit the service was horrible. Our server was new, had not been trained properly, and she didn't know anything about Japanese food or the products being used. We ordered several items and once again, we were not impressed by a single one. Not only that, a few dishes were rather bad.   Items that let us down: Spicy Tuna Bowl Uni dumplings Crispy Pork Belly Hamachi kama Battera Tuna Belly Steak Chawan Mushi Tororo Udon with grated mountain yam   Lunch certainly saved this from a 1 star review in my opinion...but I would not have gone out of my way to eat lunch here aside from the bad dinner experiences. I've heard that they have improved recently, but I will have to hear that for a while from some trusted sources before I want to venture back.

_hfyQjQlA3JxViD8EEYYBQ.text: This place is awesome !!! Great place to eat good food!!! And more selection to choose!!!

This place is close to the Strip. It's on Valley View and Spring Mountain near Kuma.   I love everything I have tried so far. My favorite being Deep Fried Chicken Cartilage, Garlic Spinach, Uni Pasta, Uni Dumplings and lastly the Kim Chee Tofu! Try this place! But it is a smaller venue so expect a wait during peak hours.

YU9Tm87BhtzhQ92LXVtvfg.text: You can't have high expectations. I give it 5 stars cause of the owner, hospitality and his creativity. He creates such chill ambiance for a nice dinner after work. Or even if you're coming for the food.   If you know what izakaya defines. (is a type of informal Japanese drinking establishment that serves food to accompany the drinks. They are casual places for after-work drinking.) -Wikipedia.  It comes off a really authentic feel with a bit of island music ambiance lol.   The owner Go offers the typical sushi you could be looking for. Down to the creativity he offers of japanese tapas. They also offer a pretty good happy hour, if you're looking for a cheap beer and sake. I come about once or twice a week. And he knows what I like to get and offers the the fishes of the day. Cause I LOVE sashimi. His fried baby octopus is one of my favorites also.   If you come after 10 the have skewer happy hour. Which comes with my favorite beef tongue skewers . I love the tuna belly cutlet. Beef tataki. And etc. Try new things on this specials menu if you're up for it :) happy eating !

SFdvndjjlZ2nhbPcQKqC0Q.text: I don't write review on yelp. But this is the worse experience I ever had. My first time and my last time. Food take forever to come out. I can't find my server. She never checking on us even she came and dropped the food that we order awhile ago.

MVQrTAVnZ_yqGdu4lsxUkw.text: I think we came on an off-night because the food wasn't as amazing as the photos I perused on yelp prior to coming. We ordered the sashimi platter, the Hokkaido scallop sashimi, beef tataki, and the shoyu ramen.   Their sashimi pieces are tiny; They're a little over the size of a quarter. The tuna wasn't very fresh and the scallop sashimi looked like they took one scallop and cut it into slices to make it look like there was more than it really was.   The beef tataki was small too, and their dressing is so sour, which offsets the flavor of the beef.  The ramen was delicious, however, so that was their redeeming factor.   3 stars for the ramen and excellent service, but I left the restaurant still hungry.

nZ_C33f9WJOsU9JMZgClmQ.text: Great place for late night ramen and Japanese tapas. Can't wait for next visit to Las Vegas! Small place and quite busy, but it was worth the wait because you get good food and great service!!!

ouZnD49CGOl2HcnLiYhmqQ.text: Great spot for small plate eating! The restaurant itself is small and they often run out of items so I would recommend going early or make a reservation. Try lots of things and you won't be disappointed. Full bar!

2BrISutHSgRlYjQL-w0wtw.text: I lived 6 years in japan and so am always on the lookout for real Japanese food (don't get me started on "hibachi" places!). This place is LEGIT, a True izakaya style restaurant owned and operated by a Japanese person, a Mr. Go. The menu is truly Japanese, though there are a few dishes added for the American audience (when in Rome). The ambience is right out of Japan with perfect izakaya decor. Even the draft beer is done using a Japanese style beer dispenser, which chills the beer as it's being dispensed and leaves the keg at room temperature. It also has a "horigotatsu," a traditional Japanese table that is on the floor but which has a well underneath for your legs.   I can't recommend this place enough. Go to Go!!!

B9_-6a6C66Zj17On7iuNOA.text: Great food. Good vibe. The food is delicious and a lot of taste. I like their Orion beer flavor

4xkzx-2F3kVBo2wBagoFdA.text: Stopped by as first stop on way to check in to hotel...I wanted to adore this place so much...but could not...it just wasn't as good as I wanted it to be...I was excited by the reviews and pics but the food was not as good as the pics appeared...we started with great sake called karatamba...super dry and tasty...also had the sparking sake which everyone always loves. Then had the beef tongue which was tasty but not amazing...then had some crab tempura...they put a leaf in there that overwhelmed the crab taste...not sure why they would do that but tempura was very well done...but overall taste did not hit the spot at all...then had the whole sea robin which was tasty...then had the scallop bbq which was good but not great...the chicken cartilage which was pretty good!! The omakase 4 item dish was good value with Japanese shrimp and toro and wayugu beef but it still was not great...then had the uni with egg and that was fantastic!!! Ended with grilled squid which was served mildly cold...it was soft and tender but not outstanding. So maybe my standards are high from eating in LA so much but this definitely did not live up to the hype or rating on yelp. 3.5 stars overall...cannot say I will come back unfortunately!!

9IPZyiy9wWqOB6xOwOmtsw.text: Went back to Izakaya Go Thurs. night (Dec. 20) after a looooong day waiting for our new range to get installed at the house. Luckily we found one of only a handful of non-30 min. max spots this time. Restaurant wasn't as full as the last visit, so we were able to get a table. Of course had to order the clams in garlic/butter broth. However, this time, it wasn't as "holy crap this is awesome" as the last time, but still gosh darn good (4/5). Husband got the teriyaki chicken dinner and said it was good, but not great. His favorite, so far, in Vegas is Sushi Takashi's version. But he still rated it 4/5. Our favorite order, by far, was the crispy pork belly. As close to meat candy as possible, without actually being sweet. Little pieces of perfectly seasoned pork belly, then fried, and served with a sprinkle of salt. When we squeezed some fresh lemon juice on it, it was deeeeee-licious. Small crunchy porky bits, kissed by some salt and with the freshness of the lemon juice (BTW, the lemon juice didn't make the pieces soggy at all - just make sure to use a light hand).   Can't remember the other things we got, as we were starving when we got there and inhaled quite a few of the grilled skewers, but I do know they were goooood. Can't wait to go back and try yet more stuff!

Ld80PyAS3k4DC6fT1jeHJg.text: Great place for a group! Reminded us of an izakaya in japan. Great food  totally recommend

x36T-PRTgW49DgO0KS_jGw.text: Good variety of izakaya. Typical suspects here from edamame, yakatori, tempura, sashimi, udon and sushi dishes. Food is ok and fresh. Restaurant is a bit cramped and service us fast paced and rushed, not a place to relax and to have a causal meal. A bit loud to hold a conversation, ample parking.
