78o8cd2rWzEDz4aYvfV29g.text: Good late night Japanese tapas food in Las Vegas! I love dining like this because the dishes are small and you can try a variety of different things. AND, the prices are reasonable! I wish they opened for lunch though. But I do like the fact they open late night.   Everything looked good, so we ordered a lot of food! My eyes were bigger than my belly. We ordered (pictured): sizzling sauteed corn, pork belly skewer, beef tongue skewer, tempura, California rolls, beef tataki, cold soba noodles, deep fried octopus, buttered enoki mushrooms, ramen, miso eggplant, and edamame. My favorites were the sizzling sauteed corn, buttered enoki mushrooms, beef tataki, and miso eggplants (soo good!). Will definitely come back and try other dishes! I highly recommend checking out this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious meal! We ordered a lot!

swhScr53pEwHHnct8cDHsQ.text: Went here on a Friday night with some friends and I have to say it was a pretty good experience! The atmosphere was lively and that positive energy just made the experience even better. We got to sit on cushions on the floor and even took off our shoes which was an interesting experience lol.   I ordered the Tonkatsu dinner plate which came with a bunch of things like: tofu, 2 pieces of gyoza, rice, miso soup, potato salad, salad, and obviously the tonkatsu lol. The tonkatsu was really crispy and flavorful and it left me wanting more! The gyoza tasted different compared to other ones I have tried, but it was tasty for only having vegetables inside of it. One of my friends didn't like it because of a weird tangy taste. My least favorite component of the meal was the tofu because it just tasted like a bland, firm block lol.  There is also a check in deal for free ice cream so I definitely took advantage of that and got a scoop of green tea ice cream. It was a nice finishing touch a delicious meal (who doesn't love free dessert?!).  Overall, you guys should check this place out if you have a group of people looking for a lively place to have dinner. I only paid about $15-16 for a bunch of food which left me full afterwards. Considering that this is an izakaya, that is pretty good. I be back next time to try some other dishes!

photos.caption: Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The tonkatsu dinner plate! Get this if you want something filling and tasty!

4niVhxYNO-umod4FNRu_Ug.text: Ramen was great. I enjoyed a bowl of miso ramen. All the appetizers we ordered were also yummy. Can not to come back and try other goodies

photos.caption: Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PVgo-I3txZ6SEdTMBUOB3g.text: Very nice place to eat.  We came when the door first opens at 5 pm so there was no waiting.  It is a smaller place so it looks like it can get crowded quickly. The food was excellent and priced very reasonable.

mck8DFgiUgYdIWVEM26goQ.text: I came here for sushi being local and all. And I have to say I was a little disappointed. They had few special rolls if any, and the fish quality wasn't great. The rolls also had way too much rice for my taste. Prices were relatively high, and to get full it would be way more affordable to go to Yama Sushi or Sushi Kaya up the street, which also have better sushi. This is bar sushi.

POgapIxaTaiBQo_wj3W2NA.text: When it's National Ramen Day, getting ramen is a must. My friend saw that this place has good reviews so we tried it out, unfortunately they didn't have too many ramen options, but they did have a large variety of menu items (from ramen to udon to sushi to takoyaki). Of course I got my usual ramen order, the shoyu ramen, in honor of this national holiday, but it wasn't all that I had hoped it would be. The takoyaki was very good and they have a jelly-like soju that is awesome. I may have liked this place more if I had something else, but based off of the ramen it wasn't my favorite. You get free ice cream when you check in, which is great, but the green tea flavor had a strange taste so I would go with the vanilla instead. I would give it another chance, especially since it's the only place I know of with the jelly-like soju.

dmfo2hIn_ryQd5ERqtct3A.text: Good food and nice atmosphere, the place is small though and the wait was longer than I anticipated. It was a good place to get away from the strip to have a decent meal.

edI3QmmHJkKt8r6ccBVNHA.text: This place is AWESOME! They have so many things I have never seen at any other restaurant. Excellent service too!

X7E3t-YjDR3kkiKJDbAcfA.text: This place is expensive but if you enjoy Shabu Shabu, it would be a great place to go.  My British and American friend didn't enjoy it as much since they aren't into soup at all but their appetizers are great so they got full on that.  With great baked Mussles, chicken skewer, and gyoza to start.

zUHBPJbIPUq5SyMdgYXGzQ.text: I absolutely love this place. The food is all amazing, it always comes out relatively quickly and it all tastes delicious! My boyfriend and I always go here for happy hour, but their menu is pretty big and affordable regardless. Their spicy tuna is one of the best I've ever had, and that's our favorite roll in general but some other places manage not to make it anywhere near as good as Izakaya does. I've tried all of the ramens and like every single one of them too. The owner has been at the restaurant every single time we've been there. I respect that SO much from a business standpoint, AND he is really cool! There was a party the last time we went and the people had gotten a little rowdy, and not only were the servers and the owner totally accommodating and cool with it, they joined in on the fun all while maintaining the rest of the restaurant successfully and professionally. That balance is hard to do and again, I really respect it! It makes for such a positive atmosphere from many different angles. Overall even with that, the restaurant isn't crazy loud, it's totally reasonable where you can talk easily to one another and still enjoy the buzz of a busy restaurant.  Bottom line: the food is delicious, the happy hour deals are amazing, the atmosphere is fun, and the staff all around is fantastic. This is an absolute must-visit!

OyBUvN1eFT93uFuju3tASA.text: Cool restaurant with awesome food. I had a chance to talk to the owner while I waited for my food. I was there solo and he make feel very comfortable and shared about his restaurant. Two thumbs up!!!

AQnKBBhnq96tpL1bawB0Tw.text: Really liked this place. Service was very good. The food was fresh and well prepared. I had some sushi, grilled fish, eggplant and seaweed/cucumber salad. Everything was excellent. Nice beer and sake selection as well. Will be back next time in Vegas!

ql9S6WEZ7HHZyZCDmDxZhA.text: This place has pretty much everything under the sun. Plus they're open late so I don't have to resort to eating at a fast food place or generic casino cafe when driving into Vegas after work. Had the shisto peppers, tempura, ramen, karaage, and yakitori with friends and it was incredible. Staff is very accommodating as they know their menu is extensive and also gave some great recommendations.

Fs-qZC3L7qrxzfZlo5b1aA.text: This place is amazing! Everyone on staff is at the top of their game and the food there is exquisite! This is the top 3 places to get fresh well prepared and presented and traditional Japanese food, with a creative splash, in LV. The owner plays reggae so the dining area has a great chill ambiance.

zL1npUCHBq_ajbj5-e8mhA.text: Sitting here, unable to move from how awesome this meal was .... So good!   Oysters, sashimi, yakisoba, beef tongue, beef tataki... When you go out with your boss & the team after a good quarter ... you get to order whatever you want :)!

ja6RaQpQSWKfZV2lykWhzw.text: This place had fantastic "melt in your mouth" tuna sashimi... The slices of sashimi could be cut a little thinner.    I had a delicious salad. They have clams, in a broth, that is amazing. We ordered about 14 items off the menu and it was all delicious. The portions are a nice size for tapas. The decor was very elegant. I enjoyed my experience at Izakaya Go.  Let's get Lil Soya in Izakaya Go!!

YkeftbWQIdFzd3f8XopSlA.text: This is my probably my 6th visit for the past 6 months and always an excellent experience. Great food with so many choices!! They are getting so busy that you need to make a reservation now!! Owner GO is always so friendly!! Highly recommended!!

YrmpP7cDA2hO9jq-F3u8KA.text: Great tuna steak & the marinated miso salmon bowl were great! Bathroom clean, but service was slow despite going at 5PM and not being busy.

GEuYrWTJe2EohNyQlPWcvw.text: Delicious meal! First time here, in from LA, enjoyed every bit. I got the tororo udon and it was great. It's a simple dish, but they prepared and cooked everything perfectly. We also got the ten zaru soba. The tempura was extraordinary! It was so crispy and even when dipped in the sauce had a perfect crunch when eaten! They were very accommodating and helped us get extra tororo (grated yam) for the ten zaru soba. Great service as well. Never had to ask for a refill or call them to get their attention. Excellent! Will be back when we come to Las Vegas next time!

lRcJnxIYxJupwlhsQFk61w.text: Had late night sushi and ramen with the wifey and we loved it. Cool feel in the heart of China town. A must try.

m9W_KFiMT2OVRr7Ijkp48w.text: Pros: Good food (authentic Japanese Izakaya - tapas), good service. Reasonable price. Variety of food.  Cons: Limited parking space but this does not stop me to come back.   Try Tonight's Specials.   Thank you so much for spreading the goodness of Japanese food other than sushi!!

OvR1dN0ZzgK_W6H6cfhJlA.text: Super friendly and quick service. Food was on point since we were hungry and ordered 15 items for 3 ppl. Much better than Raku up the street. Btw, when did a traditional izakaya (which is what Raku is) become snooty and self important? Beef tataki was the best item we ordered! Giving 4.75 stars as the gindara and buta kaku were a little salty. Will come back again and again!

21SdNejtph9zwJxYSrv7pw.text: It is very beautiful Japanese restaurant. The decoration reminds me while I was in Japan.  The food is delicious . I like that salmon sushi. It is very fresh. we also ordered the set my boyfriend like that beef set very much. The waitress is very polite. I like it. I will go back again. I would recommend this restaurant to friends also.

CfbFePfnFUeTqw-8slioAQ.text: Loved the food! Pretty much everything we ordered was yummy. Menu can be a little bit overwhelming, so much to choose from, maybe do a little research before you go. Seats were a little bit uncomfortable, wait staff was very nice, but seemed a little overworked. Loved the manila clams in garlic butter sauce, green mussels, the oysters were very good but it was about $10 for 3 oysters so its pricey. The spicy cracker tuna and poke burrito was also very good. The chocolate cake for dessert was just okay.

gQrBLEHWbNn5ab1lDUwK-w.text: This place a great place. Food was delish and the ambiance was relaxed but very high quality food. I will definitely be back.

AJqxSTUfcM57S8OqzK1PpQ.text: The service is great, just be prepared for a louder atmosphere, super friendly staff, good food.

xsuaKOYcjyUytIzJGu8oVw.text: Had to entertain some cool people while in Vegas for business, so I decided to take them out for drinks and Japanese style tapas at Izakaya Go.  What a cool name!  When we arrived, the initial response was "I feel like we're back in Torrance."  I didn't know what to think or say, but once we all sat down and started with the beers, I knew it was going to be a nice evening!  Located off of the strip, this drinking spot looks like it attracts more locals than "others."  This is fine with me since a $4 beer off the strip tastes better than a $12 beer on the strip - especially when you're buying!  Izakaya Go isn't a huge place, but it's not a hole-in-the-wall by any means.  Decorated nicely.  Music was a bit weird but after the third pitcher, the music started sounding all the same.  Food was better-than-good.  We had a few beginner sushi eaters with us and the Uni Shumai was a hit or miss.  Spicy Tuna Rolls, Yakitori, Kim Chee, Tako Yaki, Noodles .. I think we ordered plenty for all to share.  Beer kept coming and the conversation kept flowing.  For a while, you almost forgot that we were in Vegas.  Consensus agreed.  Food and drinks were good.  Service on point.  Plenty of parking.  Highly recommend.  Enjoy!

0fkqkceOk5N6scSlO6tmbw.text: First review on my Yelp since my other account isn't usable anymore. So I thought to make my first one on a restaurant that I consider my favorite as of right now.   I have been dining at this restaurant for about 3 months now and I come at least once or twice every week with my best friend. The atmosphere makes me feel like I'm at home and the staff is very friendly. What makes me happy is that some of the staff remembers our faces and makes us feel so welcome whenever we come in.   As far as food goes it takes a while to look at all the menus they give you, but a handful of items are my favorite out of any Japanese restaurant in town.  Pork cheek with scallion: $6.25 and the dish I get the most. You get several of slices of meat for such a low price! Fatty, crunchy on the outside, and the lean parts are just as tasty.  Beef tongue skewer: $2.75. my favorite out of the skewer list they give you. Very juicy and they pack the meat onto one skewer.  Enoki butter: $4.95. Enoki mushrooms drowned in warm butter. They give you a lot for less than $5 and goes hand in hand with the items I listed above! Salmon/yellowtail sashimi: both less than $6 and they give you 5 pieces for each fish. Fresh fish and decent sizes.   Service, food, atmosphere, everything about this place is amazing and that's why it is my favorite restaurant in Vegas so far! Also, if you check in on Facebook you get a free scoop of ice cream! I still have yet to try a lot of things on the menu but I highly recommend everything above!

pJnxYxKUPxUFayo_lytCFw.text: Love this place.  Been here many times in the last 2 years and it's one of my fave izakaya place in town.  Smaller venue compares to some others, but it gives you almost better service in a way because it's easier to manage.  The servers are always friendly and helpful.  The robata items are flavorful.  The menus are very extensive... it's a bit overwhelming at times because they literally give you like 4 or 5 menus with daily specials, special seafood, menus after menus.  Most of the things I have there are good.  The only thing I am sad that they've taken off the menu was the white fish tempura.  I think it'a halibut they used and wrapped in shiso leaves with the light tempura batter... too bad it's no longer the menu.  Their ikamaru (grilled whole squid) is not my favorite item from there.  Seemed like they poached the squid first then grilled it..or something, the texture isn't as bouncy as it should be.. or maybe just frozen squid and thawed out.. something isn't that right.  But other items are all very solid.  I wouldn't go for sushi burrito there either...   Even with a few minor things I don't particularly like there, still my go to izakaya place and easy access in the complex.  Highly recommend this place.  The chicken wings, the chilean sea bass, the beef, hokkaido scallops are my favorite skewers there.    They do have one big tatami table for larger group party.

f7vGQoIk9taajZb9Z774lA.text: This place is so fantastic. Great atmosphere. Huge menu. Everything is amazing. Love tapas style dining. Try the Uni pasta, amazing. Giant clam was fantastic. Crispy Pork Belly was so good. Poke is another solid choice.

ML0aU2RFOWptVUnCgwotKQ.text: My first visit to this new spot in Chinatown felt like a quick trip back to Japan. First of all, the atmosphere of the place was exactly what I'm used to see in my hometown. With all the decorations and spot lights surrounding the entire restaurant, the first thing that popped in to my mind was this is what an real Izakaya should look like. While I was impressed of the decor, my next question was, will this place have the right quality food that matches the place. Oh yeah they did and honestly it exceeded my expectation. Sashimi (raw fish with no rice) no doubt was as fresh as it gets, fried chicken (karaage) and kimuchi tofu went so well with beer. Moved on to drinking sake, grilled black cod, king crab legs, sea urchin dumpling, and tuna belly steak was so yummy, I couldn't stop drinking..... I closed it out with their Shio ramen. Their chashu was tender and flavorful and the soup had a nice kick spice in it, and liked it for the fact that it was chicken broth instead of pork. Well recommended and am going back to this place very soon. Oh and the service was great too.

u8kfE-HTqtX7_fTy437mFw.text: been here a few times... And every time it taste good.. The owner Go is very nice... They serve fresh unique fish... Would highly recommend this place

wJMJxDDIUf3b3l9VMI_QUw.text: Amazing selection of unusual sashimi specials! It's a hidden gem slightly off the strip!

DQaNGeA2OMdsxK_p7K_iDA.text: I heard about this restaurant from a client, so when I went to Las Vegas, I had to try it.  I also took a friend who lives in Las Vegas.  We were both extremely impressed with the extensive menu and asked for recommendations from the wait staff.  We both had the tempura shrimp and veggies.  Since this was our first time, the chef brought us a few samples and they were wonderful and was a great prelude to the meal.  When our dinner came, the presentation was excellent, but  I was not ready for the fresh, delectable taste of the tempura.  I have never tasted anything so light and tender as this dish.  The choice of veggies was excellent and different.  Even sweet potato dipped in tempura batter and fried to perfection.  My friend also had the miso soup and he said it was the best he had ever eaten.  I am just salivating writing this and will definitely go back again and again.  You need to try this restaurant!!!!  If you are visiting Las Vegas, seek it out, and if you live there, make it one of your regulars!!!!  You won't be sorry!!!!

iITKMJiynhk2LdhEuKaKIg.text: Four of my friends and I went here last night and we ordered lots of different things. The edamame was good and the hamachi Kama was amazing! But the ramen they got was undercooked and the poke wasn't good either :( we also ordered salmon nigiri and the salmon was really fishy. I've never had salmon nigiri taste like that and gummy ever! they also forgot to bring my friends rice and when they brought out the checks separate, it was all wrong and some items were on the others.  They didn't bring our food together and they didn't bring all the checks together either. The service was not great. I'm willing to try it again though next time hopefully it'll be better ?

iKpq9ErneHWAcWB6aYizMA.text: Izakaya Go is located in Chinatown; Valley View and Spring mountain. It is a great place for  an authentic Japanese tapas food experience. The place is small but trendy. You have a good view of the kitchen where you can see the chefs working.   The menu offers a wide variety of mouth-watering starters, sushi burritos and traditional dishes. All the food we ordered were exquisite. I have to say the Ramen burger was different and something we never had before and was very delicious. It had a fried egg and a large piece of pork cooked to tender with large portion of seasoned fries that taste like sweet potato goodness. A standout for me was the fresh octopus ball.  It came in six and they had a nice flavor and as you chew it had different textures. The Poki "Burrito" was fresh as well. The portion is bigger then a typical sushi rolls, and instead of tortilla a sheet of nori seaweed with rice help contained all the ingredients. Deep Fried Soft Shell Crab served with ponzu sauce was fresh and crispy with a light batter and so was the fried baby octopus. You also get  a cup of complementary green tea in the end.  The seafood were fresh and flown in from Japan. They have a wide selection of sake. However, they did not carry Kurosawa which is one of our favorite but did get an equivalent kind called Kikusui Junmai Ginjo. The servers were welcoming and attentive.  The only thing I would advise is the music, they were playing Reggae when we were there. I would suggest to make it authentic is to play Japanese music. I would recommend this place and would definitely return and try something new.

photos.caption: Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Poke burrito and Fried octopus
Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ramen Burger- Yummy!

E-7wXi7gieL93GlrDAd90w.text: On our first GO, we were a little let down by their menu selection. Did we come too early in their grand opening? Did they not expand their menu yet? Maybe the classic "it's not you, it's me" situation, but we just weren't really feeling it! Nothing looked truly original or even exciting, except for an item or two.  We felt that the small tapas style plates were leaning closer towards the pricey range. However, we did find a glimmer of satisfaction in 2 of the dishes we sampled. Here's what we ended up with:  Spicy tuna cracker $6.75 / From the appetizer section. Alright, so you heard me, this isn't original and I can definitely get a great spicy tuna cracker down the street (Gyu-Kaku, Jinya Ramen Bar) but it's still a pretty darn tasty execution of a classic, cult favorite dish. Beautifully presented; fried crispy rice, topped with spicy tuna, avocado, a dot of sriracha, and drizzled with a creamy spicy mayo sauce. Nice proportions  and we enjoyed the delicate, subtle spice. Flavor rating: 5/5  Asparagus bacon $4.95 / From their stir-fried section. It came out in a bowl, super limp and soggy, with about 2 inches of oil at the bottom. We felt that it was also way too salty for its own good, so we ordered an extra side of rice to eat it with. Granted, bacon is supposed to be salty - it was overkill. And what's up with that pool of oil? Flavor rating: 2/5  Uni chawan mushi $6.25 / From the steamed dishes section. This, to us, is an exotic find; we haven't seen it at most restaurants. Also, we can't compare this dish to anywhere else as it's our first time trying it, yet we thought it was exceptionally bland (I apologize in advance if this dish is supposed to be flavored in that manner.) As gorgeous as it was, with the elegant presentation, it wasn't our favorite dish of the evening. The uni flavor was terribly muted and that is a shame. Flavor rating: 2/5  Fresh halibut roll $10.95 / From the sushi rolls section. California roll topped with fluke sashimi, yuzu juice, and natural salt. Extremely simple, however, the fish was very fresh, naturally sweet, and we loved the brightness that the yuzu offered. The surprising sprinkles of salt set off our taste-buds in a explosive direction and we really enjoyed that. Flavor rating: 4/5  We would be curious to return (eventually) to taste their other specials such as the "uni dumplings" or try other popular dishes that our Yelper buddies rave about.  You may find them on a better night than we did - but for the variety seeker, the Izakaya connoisseur, this spot might be a NO-GO.

CL70c-QI8aG9JG6IJ-Q7Zg.text: I love coming to this place with my friends.  Their happy hour is at 10 pm which is usually the time that we all get there.  The wait line isn't long usually but it's very much worth it if you do have to wait.  We got their fish and chips, octopus fried rice, salmon bowl, tuna belly skewer, fries, unagi bowl and the spicy salmon hand roll.  Everythig we ordered was really good, their rice bowls come with a tofu miso soup with seaweed inside.  Everyone enjoyed their food a lot.  The only thing I would really say is that after you order your food, the wait for your food is a bit longer than usual. But eventually the food comes and it's really good. So I do recommend going there to try out there food whether it's happy hour or not. It's really good.

SmTAY9GCYUuG0s0T1R9Lxw.text: We made the mistake of coming here without making reservations.  There was so much to choose from so it was hard to make a decision, but we ordered items from two different menus and were not disappointed with anything. Servers were patient and very helpful. The food was great! The service was great! The experience was great!

8PVIaF1XzyU45aMq6KGS7Q.text: The best Japanese restaurant in Las Vegas!!!! Very authentic. Everything on the menu are delicious. The fishes are always fresh.

oB3CJlrxqUdJKh2cJ95_yQ.text: We had a group of seven people who shared several plates.  Items ordered:  Salmon skin salad Battera Unagi bowl Hamachi kama Takoyaki Agedashi tofu Chicken KaraAge Chawan Mushi Ten zaru soba Tororo Udon Mushroom Zosui Tuna Belly Steak  A standout was the octopus ball.   There were six and they had good flavor and different textures.  The agedashi tofu was good.  The broth was very flavorful. The mushroom porridge was OK but we hadn't yet gotten sharing bowls so we each had some in our small soy sauce saucer.  The udon was also OK.  The mushroom porridge was my favorite dish.  Major fails:  tuna belly steak - overcooked and very dry.  The tempura was not good.  It had not been cooked enough and the batter had an unfinished taste.  The soba noodles were not good and had little flavor.  I was very disappointed in the chawan mushi.  I don't understand why they charge $2.50 for iced green tea but hot green tea is free.  The place is very small.  Maximum capacity sign said 70 and that would be pushing it.  The noise level was high.    There are other izakaya restaurants superior to this.

UmhH38Q2xK5RQwwZHXKB8Q.text: Used to be my fave go-to Japanese place. Used to be fast and attentive service. Until today, it is very disappointing how they pay attention so much on some particular customers. We always go to this place and order my fave takoyaki, tonkotsu ramen, tuna skewers, rolls, and tuna steak. Today we didn't even want to order from Happy Hour (like the half ramen) but that's what they gave us after ordering the full one. But we're not the type to complain so we just tried ordering other dishes. Just sad because the service was really slow. Our water didn't even get refilled either. We don't blame the people for slow service, but please consider hiring more people or maybe make the space not too over crowded that way service can be faster and orders are not being cancelled. Sad to say, we had to cancel the rest of our orders because we had to wait for so long everytime we want to make a new one. I'd like to acknowledge our male server tho for trying his best. Anyhow, food's great, but we may just go somewhere else.

gB5ydSr9ANZaeGapTrVqAQ.text: So the chef/owner opened this establishment after his successes in Los Angeels with Hondaya Izakaya, and a bunch of other Hondaya restaurants. I've had the Izakaya in L.A., and several people I know are fans as well.   What I ate:   Steamed clams in garlic soup/sauce- 5 star. SOOOOOOO GOOD. I don't even like clams very much and LOVED this dish. The clams were cooked to perfection, and the garlic soupy broth just makes this dish stellar. I think I could eat 5 bowls of this.   Yakisoba - 5 star.  I've had so many different Yakisoba's in Japan. This one was very good. Unlike most places, it had a ton of veggies, and a couple pieces of really yummy pork. MAKE SURE YOU GET IT WITH PORK, not chicken or beef.   Fried octopus- 5 star. Everyone at the table loved this dish. It's crispy and delicious.   Chicken porridge (chicken zosui)- 3  star. This was good, but I have had better before. The broth could have been a bit more flavorful.   Spicy miso ramen- 3 star.  It was good, not extraordinary. The spice level if average, and the miso flavor is a bit weak. But hey, this ain't no ramen place.   Halibut carpaccio with uni on top- 3 star. I thought this was an OK. Some other people liked it so, it could be a personal preference.   Salted chicken wings- 3 star.  The chicken was a bit hard on the inside, slightly over cooked. I loved the outside flavoring. Make sure to sprinkle some SICHIMI (Japanese red pepper) on it, and it will be a game changer.   Miso salmon sashimi- 2 star.  I wasn't particularly fond of the flavor of the miso.  Spicy tuna on crispy rice- 1 star. I personally did not like the flavor of the spicy tuna at all.   Service- 5 stars.  I'd come back here to try more items, as the menu is extensive. The service was on point, and it's a nice place to come with a small group of people (up to 4).  There's only one table that I saw that can seat a larger group.  Portions are small for the appetizers/tapas, so if sharing, maybe 4 people can get a bite at most.

photos.caption: Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Halibut carpaccio with uni on top
Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy tuna on rice cracker
Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried octopus

qPF3CURIK6VOf2fhW4hl_w.text: I've got izakaya fever and the only cure is... more Japanese tapas! Heads up that the lunch menu is more casual fusion fare (sushi burritos, for example) while the dinner menu is mostly traditional dishes, with a great board of specials- handily posted over each table for your drooling convenience.  As staples, I'd order the UNI CHAWAN MUSHI ($7)- delicate egg custard dish with uni and mushrooms, served in the cutest French china pot, which was second only to a phenomenal MUSHROOM PORRIDGE with egg (back page of menu by the rice bowls)- it's saucy and carby and comforting and flavorful all at once.  Not to mention packed with mushrooms.   Other favorite dishes include the CRISPY TUNA CRACKER, which manages to be both spicy and crispy without being too spicy or too crispy. The TEMPURA WHITE FISH ($6) is divine- I'd order several for the table, the flavorful, flakey fish goes fast. If it's on the specials menu, I'd consider the TUNA BELLY STEAK ($12) a must-order; the dipping sauce and perfectly-cooked interior make for an orgasmic bite.  I did not originally plan on ordering sushi here, but was easily persuaded to try their sashimi specials- and the freshness of their fish rivals the top-ranked places in town. I also really enjoyed some of their simpler rolls, like the salmon and avocado- that section of the menu isn't too large and consists mostly of classic combinations.  Heads up that orders may take a while if there are several large groups- it's a small place with a small kitchen. I would like to suggest that they NOT use the first table inside the door for groups, as squeezing my butt past someone's face is NOT my idea of a good start to my meal- nor one I would want to experience.

hYrevyqFox47_cWZziBO9g.text: 2015 is undoubtedly gonna be the year of Battle Izakaya (Las Vegas edition).  But seriously, the quality and execution of the dinner items I tried overall was superior to that other established Izakaya restaurant down the street.  The price point is also more consumer friendly.  The lunch menu was okay. But I didn't get to try the ramen noodles, which from the pictures look like they too are on point.   The Ramen Burger that I ordered was a bit of a mess to eat, but I managed to keep my hands clean by donning a pair of latex gloves. However, the big pieces of raw green onions should be grilled or left out entirely. The fried egg with the runny yolk center enhanced the burger. The seasoned fries was pretty good, but I normally skip the fries (I try to save those calories for other stuff like matcha cheesecake or Thai Iced Tea).  The Poki "Burrito" was decent. The portion is bigger then your typical sushi rolls, and instead of tortilla a sheet of nori seaweed with rice help contained all the ingredients in an easy & no mess format ideal for on the go consumption.  Their GO Curry menu is good too. I ordered it with Pork Cutlet, and the curry was good but with maybe just a 1 on the spiciness scale.  I have not asked, if there is an option to make it spicier for those that are into the burning mouth game.  For dinner, we ordered the Teriyaki Chicken Plate, which I thought was a great value and was delicious. My fav Asian friend gave her thumbs up approval.  In spite of initial hesitation, she also enjoyed the Grilled Miso Marinated Alaskan Black Cod.   The Chicken Kara-Age was decent, as well as the Geso (Baby Octopus) Tempura. But the star of the evening was the Uni Chawan Mushi. Seriously good.  Service was good, especially considering that they have just barely opened.  But I have not been there yet when the restaurant was packed and the servers are truly tested.  Overall,4.5 stars!

6teNzgLBotUsHSvEyMP0WA.text: I just checked out Izakaya Go after seeing some great reviews on Yelp. I love Ichiza even though it gets a bad rep: totally understandable. I figure this new place would be modern, clean, and familiar.  I've gone through the yelp photos many times so I new exactly what I wanted.  I came Thursday night at 12:30am. It was EMPTY. I was so happy. We were greeted promptly and basically had the entire staff to ourselves. The seating is cute with butt cushions that I really liked lol  I recently cut out meat as much as possible so I had a pretty vegetarian friendly meal with a friend.  We got French fries, oysters, cucumber roll, crispy rice, agedashi tofu, mushroom porridge, and the uni custard.  I have to say our meal was delicious. We just wanted something light but left ridiculously full. Everything came out prompt, hot, the presentation was nice, and everything was cooked well. I enjoyed all of the above listed items. My one criticism is the dishes all seemed to be missing one little element that could make the food even better.   Maybe some fish eggs to top the uni custard? Maybe something crunchy to top the mushroom porridge? Maybe a house made aioli for the fries?  Although small in size, the oysters were probably my favorite dish. They were fresh and seasoned so well with lemon and ponzu.   I also really loved the uni custard. The texture was almost like silken tofu but it tasted so good! There was some shrimp in there and some other goodies.   I really Enjoyed my self as did my friend. We both left super full from for a total of $40. I can't wait to come back to get some more of the delicious oysters, super comforting mushroom porridge, and that special uni custard.  Maybe it's because we had the place to ourselves, maybe it was because our servers only waited on us, or maybe we just got lucky. I hope to try the sushi burritos and ramen burger soon.  The free hot tea was nice.  I hope they add more desserts to their menu.

Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Agedashi tofu. $4/$5. Nicely done. Stayed crisp. Batter a little thick. Broth was not the best. Tasted mostly just of soy.
Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French fries $3/$4. Could have used a special dipping sauce or some special seasoning. Can&#39;t complain for the price..

dUO5ZU-jSikvr29MXoiQeQ.text: Chill spot in Chinatown, LV. They were able to accommodate same day reservations for a group of 10.   The menu is extensive with lots of tapas, izakaya, and veggie friendly options.   Tako wasa here is a great beer companion. It's relatively cheaper than prices in LA so was thoroughly happy to try a bunch of things with our big party and still not have to fork over a pretty penny.

H9pvqKmRQYiWcbrhOptPtw.text: Came in for a late-night meal after a concert on Saturday night. Servers were kind and attentive (plenty of water refills is a plus). Small but very cozy restaurant atmosphere, and they had chill reggae music playing the whole time. Food was *delicious*...pork belly was the best, chicken hearts and beef tongue were juicy, ramen was SO GOOD, takoyaki was actually cooked properly (most places tend to mess it up by over or undercooking it), and my party regrets not ordering more of the salmon. When my friends and I come back to Vegas, this will be a place to revisit!

yU__0nwZ9r_3SLYtkucArA.text: We stumbled upon this gem one stormy night just craving everything Japanese. The place is very cozy and the people were friendly. Again with a group you really just order a whole bunch and just share, and that's what we did. The food came out one right after the other which was great because it allowed us time to conversare and enjoy each bite. The ramen was so comforting on that cold night. You can never go wrong with Raman, it warmed up my whole body. The takoyaki balls were crunchy and piping hot so watch your mouth!!! It was like a burst of warm flavors oozing all in your mouth!!! So good!! The ribs and mussels we just as delicious! I would definitely love to come back here and try more! I feel like you could never get enough here, there's so many different flavors and textures to play with. Always another surprise!

YIxjVSwAnhFm1xCyK6C7mg.text: Very authentic. Great food. Chawan mushi!!!  Poke ramen was delicious. Totally will come back.

x4lDuAQQODQ5Qyla15Svvw.text: We've been meaning to try Izakaya Go but usually just end up at Ichiza. I took my parents here when they were in town and it was a pleasant experience. It's a very small restaurant and we waited about 10-15 min for a table on a Friday night. We started off with mugi shochu (a Japanese alcohol made from barley.) I can't find anywhere in town that sells it except a few restaurants so I always try to take advantage. Ask for it on the rocks it's very mild but similar to vodka or sake.  We ordered a bunch of little plates to share:  Okonomiyaki: seafood pancake. It's usually a lot thinner than it was served here but everyone agreed the texture was perfect. It was spongy and had a great ratio of batter to filling. A little heavy on the sauce but still good. A good portion size too for sharing.  Karaage: standard fried chicken but served with mayonnaise, interestingly. The seasoning was a lot heavier than I've ever had it but it was great.   Kimchi tofu: one of the highlights. The flavor was amazing. It was served in a bed of broth with tempura crunchies inside. The mix of textures and the sour kimchi was perfection.  Shoga yaki: I've never had this before but loved it. It's stir fried pork with ginger. If I wasn't very hungry I would have just ordered this with a side of rice.  Tsukemono: I love tsukemono (Japanese pickled vegetables) And the waiter was impressed we actually ordered it. It's a great palate cleanser and very refreshing.  Hamachi Kama: Always a must have at izakayas. It's yellow tail collar. Mix in the daikon with the soy broth. You can pick at the collar for a long time and still get some good meat.  Yakisoba: Probably wouldn't order this again. Very similar to the shoga yaki with the vegetables used and felt a little heavy at this point in the meal.   Crunch roll: standard crunch roll. Small order though so it wasn't too filling.   Overall I liked Izakaya Go. Their menu isn't as adventurous as Ichiza but it has all the right stuff. I could definitely come back for some shochu and skewers. The night we went they were out of a lot of the skewers we wanted to try so we skipped that. It's also very close to the Strip compared to the rest of Chinatown so I'd recommend for tourists staying at the Wynn or somewhere nearby.

eZgRb5-6vu6ylwQlNRxmIQ.text: Return visits to one of the Best places in town have not disappointed. Tonight was fun bcz it was a pre-bday Family dinner. The food was fantastic as usual, plated beautifully & served hot and tasting great. Special surprise green tea ice cream & a bday song for the bday guy made him really happy. We thank you Izakaya for a great dinner & evening. We look forward to our next foodie fun adventure there.

o_2AmJoJ8d3PmtCnBrdbFw.text: I can't say enough about this great place. The service is incredible! And the food is amazing. Check out they happy hour menu.   A chill style ambiance. Perfect for date night or birthday celebrations. And the music is always just right! I recommend the izakaya house rice and the tuna belly. My favorite are the fresh fish selection. Their drink selection is plentiful.   Their happy hour is a great price and never too long of a wait to be seated. I've been coming here for over two years now and it only gets better.

JUhk7HqjBn5Dx2kMwaQ4oA.text: Excellent food and service!   The atmosphere was fun for a Thursday evening with Reggae tunes playing in the background and the hum of chatter filling the air.  The staff provided a high chair for our toddler and were so accommodating to toddler requests for additional napkins, dropped cutlery, etc. This was the best service I've experienced in Vegas. I enjoyed all the dishes but here are some I loved :   Aga Dashi Mochi  Shrimp with garlic chilli  Shishito peppers  Pork cheek with ginger scallions  Grilled Lamb chop   Check in on Yelp for a free ice cream. I got the green tea ice cream.

JqQlNlQiW2NevhguzmOluA.text: We went to this cute little Japanese restaurant. It was very nice - we enjoyed the food very much. Their dishes are unique and very good. It seems like a small place, so there might be a long wait. We got there for a late dinner so we didn't have to wait, but it got busy later on because of their late night happy hour. I would definitely go again!

VRRJ4E_SMmb64X0Xw7Oi1A.text: Food is pretty good. Been here for couple of times already. Except, the dynamite is too oily don't get it unless you're trying to drink oil. The server said she usually doesn't recommend it to the customers but never said anything about it to me when I was ordering.

lwGnJI1E9jHYI0vsI69Hkw.text: I'm picky. This place is chef-driven but laid back and consistently brings the A game. Every time I visit Vegas, I eat here. It is small and in an unassuming strip center. Don't let that fool you. The food is on par with NY and LA.   Update...so it's now 2019 and I've been dining here once a year for the last four years. Wow. GO is so great. It's cool local vibe on top of fabulous food is such a treat. Eat at the bar by yourself or take a date. No disappointments. The chef-owner is a pro and will be delighted to talk to you about what would be perfect for you from the menu. The staff is clearly happy to work there as they smile more frequently then most restaurant folks. Go to Izakaya GO!

eRr6GblBCV65qwUB6MMXGg.text: Af thinkter looking for a new ramen spot after the old one closed (RIP Go!ku ramen & j-wraps) I came across this place and decided to give it a shot.  I needed a place to go that was open late and had fair reviews, and with an average 4.5 stars and closing time at 3am, this was the place  After work, my girlfriend and I got here at 1:30am. It was not as busy, even for a Saturday night. Normally little spots like these in Chinatown are POPPIN at this hour on a weekend. We didn't know what to expect, but we were blown away by the speedy service and quality of our food. Our server Travis was on top of everything; whether it was clearing our plates or bringing us our food. The chefs deserve a shout-out as well, as they made everything amazing. We ordered a lot of happy hour menu items ( happy hour starts at 10 and ends at closing ) such as the half-order of Shoyu ramen, pork dumplings, fish n chips, and spicy tuna rolls. We ordered a few skewers as well; shitake mushroom, bacon wrapped quail egg, fried chicken hearts, and even a poached egg. The only thing we got that wasn't off of a specialty menu was a full order of the Nabeyaki udon ramen.  We got so much more than we expected, and we can only thank Izayaki Go for bringing it to us. If you're craving ramen or even Japanese tapas, this is the spot. Another shout out to Travis for being on top of things AND bringing the house chili sauce (;

odqO1AdPPbouaKOBJ9srpg.text: Unbelievable!!! That's how I'll start off this review with a special thanks to my fellow Yelpers(Without you/your reviews I would have never found this gem hidden within LV's Chinatown!)  We ordered several items after we were seated at the bar (more of a food bar than a bar-bar, if that makes sense?!?) Here's what we sampled:  - Spinach with garlic - Whole grilled squid  - Grilled Alaskan Butterfish - Yakisoba w/beef - Poke burrito - Fried whole shrimp - Green ice cream (check-in and you can get one too!)  All was excellently prepared and served by simply wonderful folks... The highlight was watching the grill master work hIs magic!  Here's the rundown: -Satisfied? Yes -Return? Yes -Advocate? Yes

bMVhwZXxPldflF-8LwAWaQ.text: Izakaya Go was a no for me with their Shoyu Ramen. I will explain in a bit.   My sister suggested that we try out the place so I went with her. First off, the ambiance was very casual and this place has some points for some of its aesthetic decorations. Service was very prompt and great. We were quickly asked if my sister and I have been served and brought out waters.   They have a Happy Hour menu starting at 10pm- closing. I wasn't really in the mood to try much this night so this may be a disadvantage in the review for everything else. But after experiencing many other ramen places, I would not go here for ramen if that's what you're looking for.   Their Shoyu ramen is made with egg noodle and come with bamboo as the topping and a half cooked egg. As in my photo, you could tell that it was lacking variety. The broth was very flat and one dimensional.   I forgot what the dessert was called, but it was made with green tea pancake sandwich with red beans and a scoop of vanilla ice cream. If you like green tea unsweetened than you'll enjoy the green tea bitter after taste. I took a scoop of the red beans and vanilla ice cream with the green tea pancake and you get an un-orchestrated concoction of taste. The vanilla ice cream over powered everything.   On a side note I was told to try their tuna dishes and poke salad, so I may come back next time with a bigger appetite to try other things on the menu.   IMHO I would rather go to Ichiza... But I'm willing to give this place a try again some other time.

alr1BDxWHOrM-eVwMh7mvg.text: About a year ago I really wanted a sushi roll but all the restaurants near me that serve sushi were closed.  So my husband and I decided to try this place and we've been going there steadily ever since.  They seem to be open from about 5p-3a and the food there is always great.  I love their plum wine too!  I like to get shiitake mushrooms, Philadelphia rolls, and their steak curry with rice.  I have tried a bunch of other items on the menu though and everything has always tasted great.  I've even brought out of town guests there and they've really enjoyed it too!  Everyone there is super friendly and very attentive without you feeling like you have to make a decision right away.... you can feel free to take your time to make a decision and there's no rush.    I highly recommend this place!

1vwLdU2n8Pmjjd-AycR9vg.text: Great Japanese food! Has good variety of sushi but more importantly a huge variety of small plate foods and yes ochazuke any way you like it! Had a bit of a wait for seating but was well worth it.

KF9k0E8qOlj3lSR4zNcsEg.text: Before we came for our trip to Vegas, I asked my cousin who lives here for some recommendations. This one was great and a fun experience. Because I lived in japan for 18 years, I'm a little picky when it comes to Japanese food. This place had a fun and authentic atmosphere and the food was great! So glad I was able to get a little piece of home during our mini vacay to Vegas.   Some highlights were the fried soft shell crab, shoga yaki (ginger pork), and tako yaki. Loved the free green tea ice cream that I got for checking in on yelp!

v_6PQPodXZaBJ4x56YxVdA.text: Really great food, probably the absolute best Japanese food in Las Vegas. Delicious and a surprising wide variety of delights. Reasonable prices for the quality of yummy treats. Great attentive staff and many of them too. Excellent service.

DfIiEJUoT9x5GTbOi3hXZQ.text: Well  I Stumbled upon this Japanese tapa place by china town after I couldn't wait anymore longer at the long line at pho Kim long during the holiday craziness....  I was still looking for some hot soup, the tok kosh spicy ramen was more than satisfying! One of the best ramen I have had in Vegas, the broth was not so salty and the noodles were very fresh, great flavor.   We also got some skewers to try, my personal favorite was the shiitake mushrooms!  The server did a good job selling the catch of the day menu, we got the barracuda I believe.. the sashimi fish was incredibly fresh, cheaper than most American sea food restaurants too.  The dessert was the cheese cake with yazu? Server said the cheese cake is made in house, it was fresh and delicious and just the right amount of sweetness.  This place was a lucky find..would definitely come back again

K41TpaG677FFo5e9s6CTvQ.text: Was craving some good asian eats while visiting my friends in Vegas.   Had them take me to this Izakaya.   Its a pretty small place, but that is in line with what an Izakaya is.  Ordered some Yakitori particularly the pork belly, tuna, and beef.  Everything was great, but the beef was not on par.   The Takoyaki was good, miso soup was standard, and the yakisoba I personally didn't like, but only because I like my noodles on the softer side, the flavor was good though.    Had the house sake hot, and it was excellent for the price.  They also had a deal where you get free ice cream with a yelp check in, so no complaints here.

433oXNIk8JrZYW7M29C5hA.text: Passes there every once in a while. Menus not bad, has big dishes. The location is next to even more places. Not bad at night. Atomsphere is ok.

FxhhmzIRFylwyBUfyfNWZQ.text: This place has great service and good food. I was a bit put off by the signs all over the restaurant saying that there have been frequent car break-ins within their parking lot, but at least they have a parking lot... My mom and I ordered the 5 kind sashimi, which was great with lemon wedges to douse them with, and the grilled salmon with a side of rice. Our car, thankfully, was intact with everything still in it when we got back to it ;)

I1Uu2mrAfTKn5p1-tsmpmQ.text: I just happen to stumble into this little piece of Japan right in the middle of Vegas.  They have a great selection of tapas, soups & entrees.  It's a warm and intimate environment, they have a clean restroom & their service is efficient!  I'm so glad to have found this place.  I'll definitely be coming back !

_eWBUbQtbDjZBQuf7HDYLg.text: Urchin Dumpling is out of order on the day I came. But we ordered something else, and they are all great. Next time when I visit Vegas, I will come again.

mZWZtVIhOpYGzbKtxJRXxg.text: This is our favorite Japanese tapas restaurant when we're in Las Vegas. Foods are great and staff are very friendly

gPrZS8Yo3zQXMaQMsaq1ww.text: This is my fav Japanese Izakaya in Vegas - located in china town, just 10 min uber ride from the strip.  First off the menu is huge...and a lot of Izakaya items. Service is super fast...and friendly. After my few trips waitress remembers me and I don't have to order m, they just bring my fav items to the table.   Quality of food are excellent. From kimchi pork to ramen I have nothing to complain about.   They also have take out option - i was fortunate to have a fridge and microwave at my hotel and took advantage of take out every night!

igtxb03luvgVtrdWLHkDgw.text: Drove here specifically for their happy hour menu from 10 pm - close. My friends have been raving about this place, so I finally tried it with them and I gotta be honest and say that my experience was mediocre. The food was alright, but the customer service would probably be 2 out of 5 stars. So, for my first time, only 3 stars at best.  The happy hour for food and drinks are pretty generous - lots of variety for it just being a happy hour menu. We got the half ramen, curry rice w/ added chicken cutlet, pork dumplings, California roll, and the seasoned french fries. The half ramen, for the happy hour price of $5, was awesome. I'd come back and get this again. The curry rice + chicken cutlet was decent - they got the flavor right, which IMO is most important, but the serving size is tiny (even with the HH prices, there's an additional cost to add the chicken so I expected a bit more). Everything else we ordered was okay, no complaints.  The customer service needs some work. It was a Friday night, and unexpectedly not as busy relative to other places in Chinatown, yet our server took 15 mins to take our waters, then 20 mins for our actual orders. She also ended up messing up our orders (giving us someone else's order so we had to wait more to get our actual order), and giving me back a different credit card back... not a good first impression.  Overall, a decent experience. I'd come back again for the food and drinks.

3imUH5lGMWz6js7yFyYtUw.text: I'm an Uni FANATIC and I love all of the different options they have!! The space is on the smaller side and make a reservation or be prepared to wait and ultimately settle with sitting at the bar. I don't mind either way but just an fyi. The only dish here I didn't love so far was the mackerel aburi sushi.  The menu is huge! I'll continue to update as I bravely venture out!

Fw5XeH1AAB4dJC9EM46ivQ.text: Love this place.  Lots of variety and the prices were reasonable.  Great food and great service

jSaQCJf7C6H1hIWF9XRkTw.text: They have a pretty wide selection on their menu. Authentic Japanese cuisine. Food is flavorful and of fresh high quality. Reminds me of Japan. Seriously, when the local Japanese come here and there's a wait list, you know it's legit. Worth the wait.  We ordered their tapas street food like skewers and appetizers. From chicken gizzard, chicken heart skewers, spicy chicken wings skewer, chicken cartilage skewer.  sashimi salad, baked mussels and fried pork belly. They're grilled nicely. All were juicy and had a nice char to them. Right amount of hinted of salt and lemon to accompany their natural flavor.  The Raman shoyu broth was clear and clean. Raman perfectly cooked. Bold flavored and the meat was tender and juicy.   Customer service was friendly, nice and efficient. It's a small place but they really get you in and they don't short you on service or quality of their food either.   This is definitely a new go to spot when I visit.

uwHSNy0vVdAF63fy3AJwKw.text: Great quality of seafood and variety of fish sashimi! The place is very casual and friendly, perfect to grab late night tapas or dinner. The place is usually packed but the wait is short! It is a must go when in town!

Hfu5ZaoenjAlUP5rG4XzOg.text: While in Vegas, someone mentioned that Spring Mountain Rd was *the* place to go for ramen, and Asian yumminess in general.   The scene: It's a very small storefront. Upon entering, you are instantly sent to a busy little hole in the wall Japanese local hot spot. Servers are super friendly (although ours was a little less knowledgeable about the sake/wine menu).  The menu: There are a lot of items (and a lot of menus! We were given 3: specials, main menu, drinks, and a tally sheet for smaller dishes), so it can be a bit overwhelming. It would definitely suggest ordering some items off the tally sheet! They are small, taster dishes so you can try a little bit of everything!  The food: Delicious and perfectly timed. We had the cracker roll appetizer, crab brain shiso tempura, spicy beef yakisoba (bf and I split), new zealand lamb skewer, bacon wrapped quail egg skewer, beef tongue skewer and tuna belly hand rolls. It was all SO good, I officially cannot pick my favorite. I will be returning for sure!

StpjVPRGdJAGo6E9ICho1g.text: Amazing, new favorite Vegas Spot!  The Miso Black Cod and Salmon collar are must gets, as are the enoki mushrooms.  Good sashimi as well, and I loved the sharing of a ton of variety of small plates.   Definitely worth the trip off of the strip.

oJ0MR8hUCpV2RB6czaGz2Q.text: Tried this place for the first time on Thursday night and went back again on Friday night! They have the best happy hour menu!!! Skewers are really good and the prices are reasonable. My favorite was the pork cheek, chicken liver, chicken heart, and uni bowl. The uni was VERY fresh! Definitely want to try the uni pasta next time. The people next to us ordered it and it was a good portion with lots of uni.   Service was great and everyone was friendly. Our waiter was Travis for both nights. He's the best! Pays attention and was very detailed when he answered our questions.

nEyyQPcXOyyKEt98VB4H3g.text: Izakaya Go is undoubtedly my most favorite Japanese restaurant in Vegas. I come here all the time after a draining day of work to unwind and enjoy all the delightful tapas. It's almost to the point where you can find me either working, sleeping at home or eating at Izakaya Go. After +20 visits here, I felt that I should list some of my favorites for those that never visited, or for people who are looking for something new to try here.   Since I come here late at night, I like to order from their Happy Hour Special (10PM to close every night!). California Poke Roll is my favorite out of all. Half-size but for $3.50, portion is generous and it is delicious.   Fishes they use are uber fresh. If you follow them on Instagram or Facebook, you will know that this place gets fresh fish from all parts of the world. For that reason, I recommend their sushi and sashimi. My personal favorites are salmon sashimi, fresh halibut roll, salmon avocado roll and Philadelphia roll.   Curry is surprisingly good here too. Just like Zen Curry, you can add toppings to it and also adjust the spice level. I would say that curry here is better than Zen curry. Generous portion, reasonable price (cheaper) and delish!   If you are starving and can't decide what to eat, go to the back of the menu for their combination plates. You choose your main dish and it comes with small dishes on the side, rice, miso soup and salad. My personal favorites are their karaage and tempura. My friends enjoy their katsu and salmon (specifically the salt flavored).   In addition, their special menu has all the good stuff! Baked mussel is my current favorite right now. Must order! Their uni pasta is another good dish-creamy and rich uni flavor. I also enjoy their pork kimchi with jidori egg. Pork cooked with kimchi and poached egg on top. Kimchi adds a little kick to it and this alone with a side of rice is enough for me sometimes.   Support your local business! Top-notch food, attentive/friendly service and a restaurant that makes you feel at home. What's not to love about that? !

photos.caption: Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Assorted oden ($10). Perfect for the cold weather!
Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Monjayaki
Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cold Udon with side of tempura ($9) perfect for those hot summer days!

tL7GkjiFnxif16gqz0zjTQ.text: All the servers work as a team, and are very service oriented. Our server, Travis, was outstanding! He was very knowledgeable about the menu and made great suggestions. He was also very pleasant, and attentive. Thanks, Travis!

nvthOhSnB3OwZ6knOrmizQ.text: We don't normally eat Tapas style but we went on a Thursday night. Food and Saki was excellent. Service was great. We had the buttered mushroom, baked green muscles, and truffle butter corn ( best dish ) with a California Roll and a Rainbow roll. The atmosphere is def very authentic.  There were plenty of people there who were return customers and we will be returning as well.

RHeQh80XG_-zkqLB7fFWEA.text: Great place to hang out with friends/family and have a few drinks with good food. The fish is comparable to a sushi bar in Hawaii (Unagi sushi on Oahu). The prices are affordable, food is excellent and the staff is attentive. If I come to visit again, I look forward to introducing my friends/family to this place.

MVGYek3qLNT79vcbCxCRIg.text: Was here once before when it first opened, I remembered really liking the food so came here again after a show.   We came in around 9pm on a Saturday night, the place was pretty full but not crazy packed, we did not have to wait or anything. We were greeted immediately and quickly seated, our server brought out water while we looked through the menu.   We wanted to try a bunch of items on their specials menu but 90% of the items were not available...So...why did the hostess even give us the menu? Why didn't our server tell us that they are out of the specials before we spent the time choosing what we wanted?  We ended up getting pretty much the same items as before. Food was really good, don't get me wrong. But you should be stocked and prepared for the weekend crowd, I am not sure if they sold out for the day (we came in at 9 so not even that late) or they don't currently offer those dishes anymore.. regardless, either stock up for the weekend or don't offer the menu. It was disappointing after spending time choosing and getting excited about trying new and interesting items then being told literally all items you wanted are not available.  I definitely enjoy the food, some really good stand out items, just disappointed not being able to enjoy their specials.

dMIB4upZoBJdyf8Y0mby4A.text: Amazing sushi - great beer selection - perfect little hole in the wall joint! Had to get out of The Rio and this spot was awesome!

bTGtKpAx43HL4XLv7a-dOg.text: Ate at Izakaya Go twice while in Vegas. Authentic Japanese food at reasonable prices. The sushi was surprisingly awesome. Restaurant was crowded both times but the service was still excellent. Be prepared to wait if you go at peak times. Kid friendly as well.

vsyrxvnqaV92RdeloeE-dA.text: Very good place for dinning with friends. Takoyaki os the best order. Don't forget to order yellowtail collar which is only in secret menu.

3TR97SBVljibvbddqciOhA.text: Honestly this place is not bad, the prices are good and the food is good too. I just have had a bad experience that as much as I try to get rid of, a bad taste in my mouth. The owner is awesome, and the food is not bad. Isn't my go to place, but still manage to go often due to friends still loving it. Don't let my bad experience keep you from trying it at least once!! Comfortable place, and chill environment.

G3_umJ3lXK9hmMkvWgMHxA.text: Such an amazing experience!!! With the Japanese theme interior to the food..right on!! There was a big kotasu table in the middle for big parties..don't forget to take off your shoes before sitting!! A bar and tables..perfect seating arrangement! The menu was so spread out, with lots of delicious options!! There was a variety of both authentic, fusion and simple meals..and we got a few from each! But my favorite was simple..the ume chazuke!! Felt like I was in Japan on a cold spring morning!! This is a definite return spot!!

photos.caption: Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Just like Japan takoyaki!!
Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ume and bonito flake onigiri. Wish it was grilled..but still hit the spot!

uhW4FtZeIf1bUYi5A3wxSQ.text: When my family decides where to go for dinner, I get worried it'll turn out to be a cheat meal. I reviewed the menu very carefully before going to dinner with them. They have veggies, salads, proteins and grilled items.  This is located in Chinatown. We got seated right away and I noticed one of the Japanese diners who runs a Japanese restaurant in town.  Deep Fried Soft Shell Crab: Served with ponzu sauce. The batter was light. 4/5  Gindara: Grilled miso black cod. Light, mildly sweet, smokey fish that simply melts in your mouth. If you like simplistic dishes, this is for you. 5/5  Beef Tataki: Tender slices of beef sashimi served with ponzu sauce, salad and roasted garlic on top. 5/5  Sashimi Salad: Spring mix with hamachi, tuna, salmon, whitefish and shrimp with ponzu garlic dressing and spicy mayo. Perfectly dressed. Protein to greens ratio was just right. 4/5  Salmon Skin Salad: Greens, salmon skin, bonito flakes and yuzu dressing. They were generous with the salmon skin. The salmon skin looked super crispy but it was not quite the case. 4/5  Sea Urchin Dumpling: Out of the dishes we've tried, this one was the most disappointing. Steamed wonton with what seems to be egg inside with a bit of uni on top. The flavor and texture were weird. 1/5  Sea Urchin Sashimi on Wooden Tray: From Santa Barbara, CA, this tray of beauty and perfection is served with nori, wasabi and special soy sauce. Very fresh and buttery texture. 5/5  Uni Pasta: You may have had the same dish from a Japanese trattoria a few blocks away.  I think this version is better. Pasta in very creamy sauce, uni floating on top and nori shreds. 5/5  Ikamaru: Grilled squid served with Japanese mayo. Slightly chewy. 3.5/5  Grilled Tuna Belly Steak: It's nice to have a casual restaurant that serves this. I love this stuff. Flakey, tender and smokey fish that you dip in ponzu. 4.5/5  The prices aren't bad. Apps and entrees anywhere around $4-15. The service was very good. I think everything we've had so far have been delicious except for the uni dumpling.

I1-7g803gMlGS1c1LQ0xww.text: This establishment serves authentic Japanese tapas at a an affordable price. Their 10pm-closing happy hour specials (sushi rolls, grilled mushrooms, fried tuna belly, etc.) are all under $5. There is normal seating as well as a bar area, so this location is perfect for an intimate date as well as night out with a group of friends. On top of that their music selection is perfect which really ties the atmosphere together. Most of the music that is played is dub reggae and lovers rock. I will definitely be returning very soon to get my fill of authentic Japanese food at an amazing price.   The only downside that I can think of  is that sometimes parking can be tight, but that is not the fault of the restaurant .

Restaurant is really small but I noticed you can call in advance & make reservations! I'll be back soon!

naZg42b_lWTIL8b7Ird8Zg.text: A pretty good place for Japanese tapas.    Came here for dinner one night and we had a pretty good meal. I have to say the Ramen burger was the bomb, it had a fried egg and a large piece of pork in there along with some well seasoned fries. Very tasty. The Halibut carpaccio with Uni was very pretty and presentation but not very tasty, the quality of fish was mediocre. The tomato and yam salad was very good, very unique in presentation and taste. Must order if you are an adventurous foodie.    The service was very nice, and drink filled regularly. The store manager also came often to check on us to make sure everything was good.

ddFrPMps3wzyIun-g65DBQ.text: Went with my hubby, our baby and friends. It was our first time here and we were craving for some ramen. The place was small but it did accomodate all 12 of us. At first we got divide into 2 tables but we saw a big table and we ask them if we could move there, one of the guy was nice to say it was ok.  We already ordered before we got moved so by the time we got all seated the foods were coming out.   We ordered in their HH menu, the portions are not bad, some of us ordered appetizers too. The food is good, the ambience is nice plus it's more fun eating with a big group of friends hahaha.   Oh, one of my friends told the server that we're celebrating my husband's bday which we are. It's suppose to be a surprise cuz the turn off all the light and sing to u while they bring a little dessert but someone else was celebrating their bday so my husband knows already what's gonna happen, but was still gun.  The only think I notice is when one of my friends ask if she could get an extra bowl they gave her a 2 small ones and when she ask if she could get the same size as the HH ramen bowl the lady server said to her that she already gave her one and wasn't very nice when she said that to our friend.   We might come back here but it depends if we're in Vegas again.....hahaha.....oh they open late that's why we went there.

Pq51iNaujtZQzuaCSU5XMw.text: I thought this was a real nice restaurant and reasonable prices! Seemed like a good place to get a drink because it's homey and comfortable. The food wasn't bad at all, although it does rank 2nd in our book to Soho (which is also closer to us). Staff was very friendly and helpful and unrushed. If we're in the neighborhood, I would definitely come back here, but otherwise, it's a little far from home

RmA7hAsty4poCc2SYaDJOw.text: Got my favorite appetizer Tako Wasabi here! Really cool spot to spend your Saturday night here.   The price is moderate, the only thing thing I can say is maybe give Kyara a try if you want to make a drive to the restaurant, if not this is a good location in Chinatown area!!

GyWVrNTmquFuao6tkuA3YQ.text: Great food and great prices. It was my first time at Izakaya Go and it definitely lives up to its hype. I went for their Happy Hour (10pm-close) and their prices are very reasonable and their portions are are generous. I would say Izakaya Go will be one of my top choices for whenever I go to Chinatown now.   I got the curry with braised pork belly and I thought the portions were going to be smaller due to happy hour prices, but it definitely exceeded my expectations. The curry arrived in a big plate, half rice and half curry with a small pork belly on top. The meat to rice ratio was 1:2 so I had a lot of rice left over, but that wasn't a problem for me. I ordered 2 pork belly skewers and I ate that with my rice and the curry is so delicious. The skewers were actually very tasty as well. We tried the mango and lychee cocktail and it was pretty strong in my opinion. Next time I go I want to try their hot pot or ramen.   The service was very nice. We didn't wait too long to be seated and we ordered right away when we sat down. The food arrived in the usual amount of time it takes to make.

bldlhVDM7FD6dB-BMTikkw.text: Went for an izakaya experience in the fall. Didn't end up writing a review until now. Honestly, it's exactly what you'd expect: great food and great service.  The server that served us, though lacking in energy a bit, provided us with a lot of time to decide and was caring. He made sure we were comfortable.  My friend ordered the ramen, which I thought was okay. I ordered the chazuke because I was craving umeboshi, rice, and different flavors. Very light, very distinct umami. The umeboshi was a nice addition to the dish: slightly pungent and very refreshing. We also had the otoro sashimi. I didn't get the melt in your mouth feeling I usually get, but it tasted pretty good.  Overall, nice dining experience, very comfortable and a nice addition to the Las Vegas scene.

2DKhUmE1CnYBKAXIzG_wAg.text: Tried this place pretty late at night. We ordered a variety of different dishes. Nothing we had was great. The pork ramen was very flavorless. The kimchee fried rice was average. The beef carpaccio wasn't very good either.   I would rate this restaurant less stars for food quality and taste. The only thing positive about this restaurant is that it's open very late, and the variety of dishes they offer is very big. Nothing was bad, nothing was great but the fair yet of dishes offered is good.

KONIIt3FdOFnSVWrpb4lmQ.text: I lovee this place. It was my first time here a few weeks ago and I still can't get over it . I'm from OC, CA. The food here is DELICIOUS and their seafood is FRESH. Our waitress was very nice and attentive. Their service is superb. She recommended a sake drink, my friend and I couldn't be happier on agreeing w her. I really like their uni pasta. They are not cheap on their uni. You see the uni everywhere in the pasta. We also ordered some sort of fish sashimi and it wasn't bad ! I hate the fishy smell, but it sure didn't have any fishy smell. I would definitely come back here again.
