mNR3DldYD-R1RxXMbQlzuw.text: This place was great! HUGE food and drinks menu. It's a really nice cozy little place. We got there about 1am with that being said , I hate walking into a place that's about to close but it was the only thing open aside fast food. The servers were great about taking us in! I appreciated that so much!! Food was delicious! Definitely will come again

cC3YuCgowUqZR4btwm96DA.text: I thought I was making reservations for a different restaurant and completely stumbled on Izakaya Go (IG). The cooked dishes were a tasty surprise. While I will avoid the sushi and sashimi in the future, I will definitely add this place to my rotation.  HOT DISHES Gindara (black cod) Hamachi Kama (yellow tail collar) Spinach with garlic Asparagus with bacon Agedashi Tofu Onigiri (with bonito flakes)  Cold Dishes Halibut sashimi Tuna sashimi Mochi  I can't say how authentic the asparagus and spinach are, but I can say that they are seasoned well, greasy (in the best way), and delicious. The hamachi Kama was the standout dish of the meal. So often I've ordered this dish from other establishemnts and found the fish collar is overcooked, not properly crisped, or the piece of fish is naturally thin and lacking in enough fat or flavor. The collar here was thick and cooked very well. it's such a simple and comforting dish that I cannot help but base my impression largely on my experience with this piece of fish. I am always seeking a good piece of fish treated well.  We raved about our hot dishes, but the table was silent when we ate the sashimi. The tuna pieces were cut way too thick and there was chewy/difficult gristle in each piece that made for an unappetizing bite. Since the raw fish was only a small portion of our meal, it did not sully our experience.   In total, I had ZERO expectations when we walked in the door. And I left pleased with the service and each of the cooked dishes. I really like this place--its vibe, the hot dishes, and the location. While I hit some bumps in my meal, there is so much more on the menu I want to try. Based on my first experience, I am absolutely going to come back.

dGJLKnEWQx5-W3jJZv_yag.text: My friend and I went here because it was late, and I was craving some takoyaki. The staff were nice, we were welcomed and they said goodbye. Our server was attentive and patient, I don't remember her name but she was great.      Since I came late, they have a special discounted menu, which had some great deals. I ended up ordering a half Miso ramen for $5 and the truffle edamame for $4. I also tried my friend's order of the takoyaki. The ramen was well worth the money, and it came with pork, a piece of nori, and an half an egg. The edamame was buttery, and the flavor is subtle. The takoyaki was delicious, it's about 6 pieces for $6.      I would recommend this place if you aren't too hungry, and have a friend. It can get pretty expensive if you order too much. The traditional and fun Japanese atmosphere/theme makes for a good social spot.

SZgcmYHsgymTo45nedFUtA.text: Amazing service, great prices, flavors are spot on (add salt yourself), and the beer selections will satisfy any beer-craving maniac.   Will be returning shortly.   COME AFTER 10:00 TO ACCESS THE HAPPY HOUR MENU, THANK ME LATER.

j-8SbOpkw1FGEyfbBg6ACg.text: A good place to go if you want some small plate food. I ordered a lot skewers cause I love BBQ. Happy hour is after 10pm which is a better deal.

photos.caption: Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Takoyaki is good too
Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Love this steam clam soup with sake. Next time I will try the garlic one.

B27mA3XC-VexNAjlK5honQ.text: This is a small sushi/tapas place with a lot of menu choices. Went here with a couple friends and ordered a lot from the skewer tapas menu and some from the regular menu. The beef tongue was actually pretty tender as was the spicy chicken wings, although not that spicy. Quail eggs wrapped in bacon, also pretty solid. The clams with garlic butter had some good flavor, blue crab avocado salad was decent for a crab salad. The food was simple for the most part, had good flavor but not incredible. Overall 4/5

zhByRN634SAPwEWX1hp7vg.text: Good sushi and even better fried foods had fried baby octopus best thing I had. Spicy tuna was okay needed more flavor. The eel amazing and the spider roll was okay had a funny texture but great flavor. Also had soft shell crab crunchy some nice flavor which was really amazing. Will come again when it town. My waitress was beautiful as which was a added bonus.

photos.caption: Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

uj0KKUxMAHP40AFVgdlx5g.text: The host was great and professional.  The selections salon the menu are large. There is enough to choose from to satisfy every guests tastes.  We ordered a sashimi sampler which was probably the best thing we picked.  5 items for $19.99. It tasted great even on Sunday. Service was fast and most of the food came out promptly.   The only item we were disappointed by was the dynamite.I can only believe that the cook forgot to put in the seafood.  All I can scoop up was a couple of shreds of mushrooms. The rest was mayo.  The ramen is serviceable . The udon was good. This place has a good vibe and a good change of pace for someone who wants to venture away from the strip.

tWG01ftGaJKMyHwBqEI7Qg.text: Good just not great. This is my second time here since I'm a fan of the close location to the strip and relative proximity to the heart of Chinatown  We were seated within 5 mins and our terrible service began. I had to constantly wave her down throughout the night.   They are basically a neo American Japanese fusion place local influences of Mexican and Korean cuisine as well. It is quite well thought out and they have an amazing bar and selection of sake. My main complain is the portion size here is ridiculously small!! It is "tapas" style jap dishes almost and number of dishes such as their grilled fish does not even come with anything else like a bowl of rice or soup. All of us had to order basically 2 or even 3 items to get a decent meal. Overall decent but since there is so much competition close by, this is probably my last time here

photos.caption: Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Poke burrito
Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp tempura roll
Photo of Izakaya Go - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0611S3ko5bszKODVzTSyhQ.text: This is my favorite sushi spot in Las Vegas and it's always on my agenda when I'm there.  Try the whole fish sashimi.  It's the coolest presentation ever!

1RHIDBtTQRNToLoGLi43bQ.text: This place gets rather busy in the evenings. It's no wonder, food is good. So busy, in fact that they forgot my sushi burrito. I drank in the interim. We hung out at the bar and dined.

3Hc26Padnf7_wWQB-jQ31Q.text: The food is good and everything is reasonably priced. From the izakaya menu, we ordered scallops, asparagus, and beef, all were good but a little salty. The beef yaki udon came out on a sizzling plate and was delicious but it had two pieces of beef in it (literally two). I was really excited for the Poke bowl but the ratio of poke to rice was way off. There was barely any of that delicious tuna in the bowl.

3H68JbQ4M6HP3cgC6C_F2w.text: Very tasty food located close to the strip. Fish was very fresh and udon noodles perfectly cooked. Ramen could have been a little softer but overall it was great. Restaurant is very unassuming and the booths offer a great private space to eat.  Great experience.

b_Efy8wSQlPAmBPXEW2Ydg.text: I had the worst experience at this restaurant last night. I brought a party of 9 people from California and Hawaii for dinner. 2 people ordered the soba noodles with tempura. The soba noodles look like ramen noodles in texture and color. It also didn't have the taste like regular soba. The service was also lacking. I did not get my order of the sea bream sashimi until everyone was finished eating! I had eaten here before and it was great! But last night the service was lacking in the timing of the dishes. I'm sorry Mr Go, but it was not a good experience last night.

q-9y5TvuPGxymG2TtDZX3g.text: Few meals more memorable in Vegas! Everything here was delicious and tasted very fresh. The happy hour is a great value and I left very full on just $22 worth of a wonderful variety of Japanese dishes like tonkotsu ramen, dumplings, salmon tartar, and tuna belly steak. Very impressed and will definitely recommend this place to friends visiting Vegas in the future!

PDnKA2PeV7W02Zn4-M3EjQ.text: This place can get quite packed and has limited seating but it is by far the best izakaya place in Vegas.

cLAh6r7jxpds2kPX6VQ1FA.text: They have a wide variety of food types to choose from. The flavors of the food are on point and worth experiencing.  I urge anyone to take the time to enjoy the warm welcoming ambiance as well as the delicious food.

a9I4bmewSjZm9qAdwHSb3w.text: After I read some of the reviews of this restaurant,  I figured why not give it a try? Best decision ever! Others are right. This place is a hidden gem.  I ordered  Ten Zaru soba w/ Tempura, karage, agedashi tofu, super go crunch burrito and unagi bowl.  Every item were tremendous and flavorful. I was so suprised to find  a good Japanese restaurant in Vegas. The price was very cheap :)  I would come back in the future !

_uhxpO50lbPzlvkWMe9V8Q.text: Great little spot with amazing food and very reasonable prices. I've already went twice on this trip and will be back again. I personally like the beef tataki the most but I feel you can't go wrong with anything you order here!

B278B74BFnUu11Oh3BY3DQ.text: Izakaya is where you want to go when you want good company, great food and owners that care. I travel often and can't wait to come back again.

Ovo-sHeUzum7cX27wM5EEw.text: Was in vegas for a reunion and visited "IZUKAYZA GO" on a recommendation.  WE WERE  NOT DISAPPOINTED !! A dozen of us went the small dish route.   Off the extensive menu we picked things to try.   2 of each dish that we shared.   The server recommened somethings to round out our eating experience.   I think we had maybe a dozen things to try......Everyone had there favorites..... Mine was the "deep fried baby octopus".... It  made your standard calamares seem so regular. Service was excellent we never felt rushed and the food came out one dish at a time.   We also left with full  tummys !! When all the eating was done,  the only thing we complained about was the bill.    We thought it was not enough..... Thank you Go.....we will be back !!

EBjrFjJo_6WiY5wzuldCzA.text: This is the poor man's Raku. I was solo and got the terrible end bar seat staring at the register. Izakaya Go interior is kinda beat up but not unacceptable. Very difficult to get served & no assistance from the staff at all. Love the large mugs of cold Japanese beer. I ordered a "special fish flown in from Japan"(sea bream) sashimi style. After the strange looks from my server, it took over 25 minutes for it come out. Actually all the dishes took 15 minutes minimum. The overrated sea urchin dumplings were sticky, overcooked and boring. I ordered 3 different yakitori and got 2. Those 2 seemed like they were precooked and reheated on the grill. I stopped after the yakitori due to no service and just average food. There are more civilized options in Las Vegas.

kv8SGT6pnMFiKO9MFnJ0nQ.text: loved this place. had a bunch of recommendations and was really satisfied with halibut rolls, crunchy cracker appetizers, shoyu ramen, and thee best mochi ice cream i've ever had (red bean and sesame seed)

fE1jR9FlM1xOSmfViOaELQ.text: Not sure what the big deal is with this place. Maybe because there aren't many Izakaya joints in the area? The food was underwhelming. Usually there's some innovation with Izakaya...some new flavour profile etc. The menu was very basic...the most basic sushi options and the typical deep fried stuff. Fried pork belly...was fried pork belly. Would not go out of my way to visit again

ljuGXvq4cwDhbmtj4t-BzQ.text: Great shoyu ramen, meat was tender and juicy. It was such a comfort to drink some soup after a long night clubbing.

pu1DpU_ZuTxiRtNtoSAoaA.text: This place is my favorite Japanese tapas. The food is always fresh and delicious, love the ambiance so relaxed and welcoming. The staff is fantastic and very friendly. Some of my favorites are Tofu salad, yellowtail carpaccio, and lamp chop. Overall love this place.

z62-9AHYCLs3GM_0o_9_gg.text: Service is great, they welcome you and treat you great! Knowledge of food products and its source is low! Price is $$$ for an off strip location! Food overall taste great! Limited bar! Very small location but it's not really busy!

SIURlvQbF3QIreACnHr7Sw.text: Open late, wide variety menu, cost-effective = perfect go-to spot for anyone who works in nightlife or on the Strip.

9p7Z3a6VeIcX534ShqU0kg.text: This is my new favorite spot to eat at! This place never lets me down. Love their bento box.. And their drinks are good too!

oDcGPyS4IdUDIZlnrisbZQ.text: We had some really good dishes here.  There was pork belly, so there's that!  We tried shark cartilage, jelly fish and monkfish liver.  It was beautifully presented, but the shark shreds were a bit....hard core for us. We had some sushi and sashimi as well.  It was fresh, sweet and beautiful.  Definitely on the repeat list when we go back to Vegas.

a9ZedDH-dYNhXryLq-IXrg.text: Came here hungry after our drive in. Lots of Japanese patrons so you know this place is legit. Call ahead for reservations because this is a small restaurant with only a handful of tables. Ordered the yellowtail collar, poke salad, yakisoba, eel tempura, and Japanese pancake. Everything came out great. Our favorite was the poke salad and yakisoba.
